abandon	L01 U01	[əˈbændən][sound:abandon.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】a-[ad-, to]+ban[v.＆n.禁令]+-don[v.＆n.], to ban, 禁令下达后的结果→v.放弃；停止做某事；放弃（理智、责任）→v.＆n.放纵<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />v./n. <strong><ins>放纵：</ins></strong>carefree, freedom from <strong><ins>constraint</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　abandon oneself to emotion　感情用事<br /><strong>近</strong>　unconstraint, uninhibitedness, unrestraint<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />v. <strong><ins>放弃：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>withdraw</ins></strong> from often in the face of danger or encroachment<br /><strong>例</strong>　abandon the home　离家<br /><strong>反</strong>　salvage　救援<br />
abase	L01 U01	[əˈbeɪs][sound:abase.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】a-[ad-, to]+base[底部], to base, 向底部（降）→v.降低（地位、职位、威望或尊严）<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>base</strong>　base[底部，基础]作词根时也表示“底部”。basement[地下室]就是一栋楼里“最底部[base]、最下面的屋子[-ment]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　abase, debase, self-abasement, abysmal<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />v. <strong><ins>降低（地位、职位、威望或尊严）：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>lower</ins></strong> in rank, office, prestige, or esteem<br /><strong>例</strong>　He was unwilling to abase himself by pleading guilty to a crime that he did not commit．他不愿意屈就自己去承认一个莫须有的罪名。<br /><strong>近</strong>　debauch, degrade, profane, vitiate, discredit, foul, smirch, take down<br /><strong>反</strong>　elevate, ennoble, uplift, aggrandize, canonize, deify, exalt　使高贵，使有声望<br />

abate	L01 U01	[əˈbeɪt][sound:abate.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】a-[ad-, to]+bat[beat, 打]+-e[v.], tobeat (down)→v.减轻（程度或者强度）；减少（数量），降低（价值）<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>beat</strong>　<br /><strong>同根</strong>　abate, browbeat, offbeat, upbeat<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />v. <strong><ins>减轻（程度或者强度）：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>reduce</ins></strong> in <strong><ins>degree</ins></strong> or <strong><ins>intensity</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　abate his rage/pain　平息他的愤怒/减轻他的痛苦<br /><strong>近</strong>　moderate, recede, subside, remit, wane, die (away or down or out), let up, phase down, taper off<br /><strong>反</strong>　intensify　加强，加剧<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />v. <strong><ins>减少（数量），降低（价值）：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>reduce</ins></strong> in <strong><ins>amount or value</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　abate a tax　降低税收<br /><strong>近</strong>　de-escalate, deplete, downscale, dwindle, ratchet (down)<br /><strong>反</strong>　augment, promote　增加<br />
abbreviate	L01 U01	[əˈbriːvieɪt][sound:abbreviate.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ab-[ad-, to]+brev (i) [brief]+-ate[v.], (make) brief→v.缩写，缩短<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>brev</strong>　词根brev表示brief[简洁]。单词brief与词根brev同源（可看做brief的字母组合i脱落，清辅音f变成对应的浊辅音v）。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　brevity, abbreviate, abridge<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />v. <strong><ins>缩写，缩短：</ins></strong>to make <strong><ins>briefer</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　abbreviate the word “building” as “bldg.”将“building”缩写作“bldg”。<br /><strong>近</strong>　abridge, curtail, cut back, syncopate, truncate<br /><strong>反</strong>　extend, protract, elongate, lengthen, prolong　延长<br />
abdicate	L01 U01	[ˈæbdɪkeɪt][sound:abdicate.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ab-[away]+dic[say]+-ate[v.], sayaway (from power, responsibility)→v.正式放弃（权力、责任）<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>dic, dict</strong>　词根dic(t)表示say[说]。常见词predict[预测]，字面义say[dict=say]before[pre-=before], 即预先说（结果）。同大部分与说相关的词根一样，这个词根也有“words”的含义，dictionary[字典]就是a collection of words。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　abdicate, addict, indict, interdict, valediction, vindicate, contradict, dictate<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />v. <strong><ins>正式放弃（权力、责任），不干了：</ins></strong>to renounce a <strong><ins>throne</ins></strong>, to relinquish（power or responsibility）formally<br /><strong>例</strong>　abdicate the throne/crown　退位<br /><strong>近</strong>　cede, relinquish, renounce, resign, step down (from)<br /><strong>反</strong>　constitute, assume, usurp　任命；承担；篡位<br />

abet	L01 U01	[əˈbet][sound:abet.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【源】a-[ad-, to]+bet[bite], to bite, “去咬”，源自英国曾经盛行的纵狗咬熊的游戏，在群狗的撕咬下，熊最终会惨烈牺牲。游戏过程中，观众常常向狗大喊“去咬”，即教唆狗咬熊→v.帮助，怂恿；鼓励<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />v. <strong><ins>鼓励：</ins></strong>to actively <strong><ins>encourage</ins></strong> (as an activity or plan)<br /><strong>例</strong>　abet someone's opinion　支持某人的观点<br /><strong>近</strong>　aid, assist, back, support, prop (up)<br /><strong>反</strong>　stymie, frustrate, obstruct, thwart, impede, forestall, hinder　阻挠<br />

abject	L01 U02	[ˈæbdʒekt][sound:abject.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ab-[away]+ject[throw], throw (spirit) away→a.无精打采的；throw away (by society）→a.（地位、身份）悲惨、凄凉的；throw (dignity) away→a.卑微的，讨好的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>ject</strong>　词根ject表示throw[扔]（或翻译成“投，掷, 抛”）。reject[拒绝]字面含义“扔[ject]回去[re-]”；inject[注射]字面含义“扔[ject]进去[in-]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　abject, conjecture, deject, project, subject, jettison<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>（地位、身份）悲惨、凄凉的：</ins></strong>sunk to or existing in a <strong><ins>low state</ins></strong> or condition<br /><strong>例</strong>　abject poverty　让人绝望的贫穷<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>卑微的，讨好的：</ins></strong>expressing or offered in a <strong><ins>humble</ins></strong> and often ingratiating spirit<br /><strong>例</strong>　abject flattery　卑躬屈膝般的恭维<br />　　an abject apology　讨好般的道歉<br /><strong>近</strong>　base, humble, menial, servile, slavish<br />

abridge	L01 U02	[əˈbrɪdʒ][sound:abridge.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【联】a+bridge[桥]，桥直通两地，缩短距离→v.缩短，缩小；（写作上）缩短→v.在不改变本意的条件下删减词语，缩写<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>brev</strong>　词根brev表示brief[简洁]。单词brief与词根brev同源（可看做brief的字母组合i脱落，清辅音f变成对应的浊辅音v）。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　brevity, abbreviate, abridge<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />v. <strong><ins>缩短，缩小：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>shorten</ins></strong> in duration or extent<br /><strong>例</strong>　The modern transportation abridges distance．现代运输方式缩短了路途。<br /><strong>近</strong>　curtail, truncate, cut back<br /><strong>反</strong>　extend in length, protract, amplify　延长，放大<br />
abrogate	L01 U02	[ˈæbrəɡeɪt][sound:abrogate.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ab-[away]+rog[ask]+-ate[v.], 要求…away→v.官方的正式废除；away (from) asking, 不过问→v.无视（某事的）存在<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>rog</strong>　词根rog的含义相当于ask[命令，要求，问]，可以通过与词根log的拼写相似性进行记忆。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　abrogate, arrogance, interrogate, prerogative, surrogate<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />v. <strong><ins>官方的正式废除：</ins></strong>to abolish by authoritative action, <strong><ins>annul</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　abrogate the law/treaty 废除法律、条约<br /><strong>近</strong>　disannul, invalidate, nullify, quash, rescind, roll back, strike down<br /><strong>反</strong>　embrace, uphold, institute　采纳；支持；建立<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />v. <strong><ins>无视（某事的）存在：</ins></strong>to treat as <strong><ins>nonexistent</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　abrogate their responsibilities　抛开、不顾他们的责任<br />

absolute	L01 U03	[ˈæbsəluːt][sound:absolute.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ab-[away]+solut[loosen]+-e[a.], loosen awayfrom (constrains, etc.）, 形容某事物“没有被（能够影响它的东西）约束或沾染”，（君主的权力）没有被约束→a.专制的；（数量或程度上）没有约束→a.无限的；没有沾染（不好的东西）→a.完美的，纯净不掺杂的；没有沾染（削弱效力的东西）→a.不容置疑的，确凿的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>solv, solut</strong>　词根solv和solut表示loosen[松开，解开]。solve[解决；溶解]（名词形式solution）字面含义“解开”[solv, solut], 指“解开（绳结、问题）”, 以及“解开（被束缚成一个整体的物质）”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　absolute, absolve, dissolute, dissolve, resolute, solvent<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>专制的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>unconstrained</ins></strong> by constitutional or other provisions<br /><strong>例</strong>　absolute ruler　专制的统治者<br /><strong>近</strong>　arbitrary, autocratic, despotic, dictatorial, monocratic, tyrannical<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>无限的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>unqualified</ins></strong> in extent or degree; total<br /><strong>例</strong>　absolute silence　鸦雀无声<br /><strong>近</strong>　complete, utter, deadly, downright, out-and-out<br /><strong>反</strong>　qualified　有限的，有保留的<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 3</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>完美的，纯净不掺杂的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>free from imperfection</ins></strong>; free or relatively free from <strong><ins>mixture</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　absolute alcohol　无水酒精（纯酒精）<br /><strong>近</strong>　plain, refined, unadulterated, unalloyed, undiluted, unmixed<br /><strong>反</strong>　adulterated, alloyed, diluted, impure, mixed　掺杂的，不纯的<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 4</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>不容置疑的，确凿的：</ins></strong>positive, <strong><ins>unquestionable</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　absolute proof　确凿的证据<br /><strong>近</strong>　clear, deciding, decisive, definitive<br /><strong>反</strong>　inconclusive, indecisive, unclear　不明确的<br />
absolve	L01 U03	[əbˈzɑːlv][sound:absolve.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ab-[away]+solv[loosen]+-e[v.], loosen away (from guilt)→v.使无罪，解除责任<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>solv, solut</strong>　词根solv和solut表示loosen[松开，解开]。solve[解决；溶解]（名词形式solution）字面含义“解开”[solv, solut], 指“解开（绳结、问题）”, 以及“解开（被束缚成一个整体的物质）”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　absolute, absolve, dissolute, dissolve, resolute, solvent<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />v. <strong><ins>使无罪，解除责任：</ins></strong>to set <strong><ins>free from</ins></strong> an obligation or the consequences of <strong><ins>guilt</ins></strong>, <strong><ins>exculpate</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　absolve somebody from blame　使某人免受责备<br /><strong>近</strong>　acquit, exonerate, vindicate<br /><strong>反</strong>　blame, criminate, incriminate　定罪<br />
abstain	L01 U03	[əbˈsteɪn][sound:abstain.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】abs-[away]+tain[hold], away (from)“hold”, 不再持有→v.自我克制，主动戒绝<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>tain, tin, ten (t)</strong>　词根tain, 以及变形tent, tin和ten都表示hold。contain[包含]（字面义hold...together[con-]）和attain[获得]（字面义to[at-=ad-]hold）都来自词根tain[hold]。continent[大陆]（字面义holdtogether）就是“连在一起（的土地）”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　abstain, detain, pertain, retainer, content, malcontentn, countenance, retentive, tenable, untenable, tenacious, pertinent, impertinent, pertinacious, retinue<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />v. <strong><ins>自我克制，主动戒绝：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>refrain</ins></strong> from something <strong><ins>by one's own choice</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　abstain from smoking/voting　戒烟；弃权<br /><strong>近</strong>　forgo, keep from, refrain from, withhold (from)<br /><strong>反</strong>　bow to, give in to, submit to, succumb to, surrender to, yield to　屈服于<br />
abstemious	L01 U03	[əbˈstiːmiəs][sound:abstemious.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【联】abs-[away]+tem[tin, hold]+-(i) ous[a.], 不再拿起（烟酒）→a.（吃喝等）有节制的，节俭的<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>（吃喝等）有节制的，节俭的：</ins></strong>marked by <strong><ins>restraint</ins></strong> especially in the consumption of <strong><ins>food or alcohol</ins></strong>, <strong><ins>sparing</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　an abstemious diet　有节制的饮食<br />　　abstemious meals　节俭的饭餐<br /><strong>近</strong>　continent, temperate, self-abnegating, self-denying<br /><strong>反</strong>　indulgent　放纵的<br />
abstract	L01 U03	[æbˈstrækt][sound:abstract.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】abs-[away]+tract[draw], drawaway (mainpoints)→vt.作总结，概括；draw away (attention)→vt.使分心<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>tract</strong>　词根tract表示draw[拉], attract[吸引]字面含义“to[at-=ad-]draw[tract]”, 即“拉（注意力）”, 引申为“吸引”。abstract[抽象]就是“（从众多事物中）抽[tract]出[abs-]共同且本质的特征”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　abstract, contract, detract, distract, distraught, extract, extraction, protract, retract, tractable<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>做总结，概括：</ins></strong>to make an <strong><ins>abstract</ins></strong> of, <strong><ins>summarize</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　abstract an essay　概括一篇文章<br /><strong>近</strong>　digest, recapitulate, synopsize, sum up, boil down<br /><strong>反</strong>　elaborate　详细描述<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>使分心：</ins></strong>to draw <strong><ins>away</ins></strong> the <strong><ins>attention</ins></strong> of<br /><strong>例</strong>　abstract my attention from work　转移我对工作的注意力<br /><strong>近</strong>　detract, divert, call off, throw off<br /><strong>派</strong>　abstraction n．心不在焉<br />　　<strong>反</strong>　attention　关注<br />

accede	L01 U04	[əkˈsiːd][sound:accede.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ac-[ad-, to]+ced[go]+-e[v.], go to (an agreement)→v.赞成；go to (an office)→v.就任，就职<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>ced, cess</strong>　词根ced和cess表示go[走]，其中尾辅音d-s相互替换（很多情况下，词根中辅音字母的双写与单写在含义上是等价的，例如词根cess的ss可以看做s）。access[接近]字面含义“go[cess]to[ac-=ad-]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　accede, accessory, accessible, intercessor, precedent, predecessor, recessive, secede<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />v. <strong><ins>赞成：</ins></strong>to express <strong><ins>approval</ins></strong> or give <strong><ins>consent</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　accede to public demand　顺应民意<br /><strong>近</strong>　acquiesce, assent, consent, subscribe, come round<br /><strong>反</strong>　demur, dissent　反对<br />

accessible	L01 U04	[əkˈsesəbl][sound:accessible.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ac-[ad-, to]+cess[go]+-ible[a., able], (destination) abletogoto→a.可以到达的；（intelligently) able to go to→a.可以理解的；able to access, 能够接近，引申→a.能够获得的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>ced, cess</strong>　词根ced和cess表示go[走]，其中尾辅音d-s相互替换（很多情况下，词根中辅音字母的双写与单写在含义上是等价的，例如词根cess的ss可以看做s）。access[接近]字面含义“go[cess]to[ac-=ad-]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　accede, accessory, accessible, intercessor, precedent, predecessor, recessive, secede<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>可以到达的：</ins></strong>situated <strong><ins>within easy reach</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　the town accessible by rail　有铁路通达的城镇<br /><strong>近</strong>　handy, reachable<br /><strong>反</strong>　inconvenient, unhandy, unreachable, untouchable　无法到达的，不方便的<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>可理解的：</ins></strong>capable of being <strong><ins>understood</ins></strong> or appreciated<br /><strong>例</strong>　accessible to general audience　对于普通读者浅显易懂<br /><strong>近</strong>　apprehensible, fathomable, legible, scrutable<br /><strong>反</strong>　abstruse, incoherent, incomprehensible, inscrutable, insensible　深奥的；难以理解的<br />
accessory	L01 U04	[əkˈsesəri][sound:accessory.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ac-[ad-]+cess[go]+-ory[a.＆n.], go to (an organization), 加入（组织）的→a.辅助的，附属的；辅助（做坏事）的人→n.帮凶<br />　　　【注】accessory可看做accede[入职，加入]的形容词形式。当一个人加入一个组织，那么他对这个组织来讲就是“辅助的，附属的”。<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>ced, cess</strong>　词根ced和cess表示go[走]，其中尾辅音d-s相互替换（很多情况下，词根中辅音字母的双写与单写在含义上是等价的，例如词根cess的ss可以看做s）。access[接近]字面含义“go[cess]to[ac-=ad-]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　accede, accessory, accessible, intercessor, precedent, predecessor, recessive, secede<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>辅助的，附属的：</ins></strong>having a <strong><ins>secondary</ins></strong>, <strong><ins>supplementary</ins></strong>, or <strong><ins>subordinate</ins></strong> function<br /><strong>例</strong>　accessory features such as call-waiting　类似呼叫等待的附属功能<br /><strong>近</strong>　peripheral, supplementary<br /><strong>反</strong>　of primarily importance, chief, main, principal　主要的<br />
accidental	L01 U04	[ˌæksɪˈdentl][sound:accidental.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ac-[ad-, to]+cid[fall]+-ent[n.]+-al[a.], to fall, 事件的偶然降临, by accident→a.意外发生的，偶然的；〈联〉像落[cid]叶一样（随着秋风飘落，对这个世界毫无影响）→a.附带的，不重要的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cid, cad, cas</strong>　词根cid（其他形式cad, cas, ）表示“fall[落下，下降]”, 例如occident[n.西方]指“太阳落下[cid]的地方”。该词根也引申指“事件的（意外）降临”，例如casual[偶然的]指“落下[cas]的[-ual], 事件[case]降临，落在人的头上”，类似的单词还有incident[n.事件], accident[n.事故；意外]。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　accidental, recidivate, cascade, decadent<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>意外发生的，偶然的：</ins></strong>occurring <strong><ins>unexpectedly</ins></strong> or by chance<br /><strong>例</strong>　accidental death　意外死亡<br /><strong>近</strong>　incidental, fortuitous, unintended, unintentional, unpremeditated, unwitting<br /><strong>反</strong>　calculated, deliberate, intended, planned, premeditated　预先计划好的<br />

accrete	L01 U05	[æˈkriːt][sound:accrete.mp3]<br />			<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />v. <strong><ins>逐渐增长：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>grow</ins></strong> or increase <strong><ins>gradually</ins></strong>, as by addition<br /><strong>例</strong>　accrete the public interest　增加公众利益<br /><strong>近</strong>　accumulate, build up, pile (up), stack（up）<br /><strong>反</strong>　wear away　衰退<br /><strong>派</strong>　accretion n．慢慢增加<br />

acerbic	L01 U05	[əˈsзːrbɪk][sound:acerbic.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【记】（话语等）尖酸刻薄→a.（心情、心境或者语调）尖酸的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>ac</strong>　词根ac表示sharp[尖，锐利]，构成的单词有比较丰富的比喻义。例如acid既指味觉上的sharp, 即刺激味觉、嗅觉的酸味，也指具有强烈腐蚀性的酸，例如硫酸。此外，acid还指语言上的尖酸刻薄，“说话带刺”而使人不舒服。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　acerbic, acme, acrid, acrimonious, exacerbate, acumen, acute<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>（心情、心境或者语调）尖酸的：</ins></strong>marked by the use of <strong><ins>wit</ins></strong> that is intended to <strong><ins>cause hurt feelings</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　acerbic commentary　尖酸的评论<br /><strong>近</strong>　pungent, sardonic, satiric, scalding, scathing<br /><strong>反</strong>　sweet, saccharine　甜的<br /><strong>派</strong>　acerbity n．尖酸，刻薄<br />
acme	L01 U05	[ˈækmi][sound:acme.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【记】（山的）顶尖→n.顶点，极点；顶尖（的例子）→n.最佳典范<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>ac</strong>　词根ac表示sharp[尖，锐利]，构成的单词有比较丰富的比喻义。例如acid既指味觉上的sharp, 即刺激味觉、嗅觉的酸味，也指具有强烈腐蚀性的酸，例如硫酸。此外，acid还指语言上的尖酸刻薄，“说话带刺”而使人不舒服。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　acerbic, acme, acrid, acrimonious, exacerbate, acumen, acute<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>顶点，极点：</ins></strong>the <strong><ins>highest</ins></strong> point or stage, as of achievement or development<br /><strong>例</strong>　the acme of his career　他事业的巅峰<br /><strong>近</strong>　culmination, pinnacle, tip-top, high-water mark<br /><strong>反</strong>　bottom, nadir, rock bottom　最低点<br />
acquiesce	L01 U05	[ˌækwiˈes][sound:acquiesce.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ac-[ad-, to]+qui[quiet, 安静的]+-esce[v., become], to become quiet, 变得安静（不再提出异议）→v.勉强同意；默许<br />　　　【注】动词后缀-esce表示“变得[become]…”，对应的形容词（或名词）后缀是-escent[-esc (e)+-ent]。adolescent[青少年的；青少年]字面含义“to[ad-]become[-escent]older[ol], to grow”，指“处于（快速）成长时期的青少年”，其中的词根ol表示grow[生长]的含义，old[变老]是“grow”的结果，正如青少年成长为成年人[adult]。<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>qui (et)</strong>　<br /><strong>同根</strong>　acquiesce, quiescent, tranquility<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />v. <strong><ins>勉强同意；默许：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>accept</ins></strong>, comply, or submit <strong><ins>tacitly or passively</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　acquiesce to my own fleecing　默许我的敲竹杠行为<br /><strong>近</strong>　assent, consent, subscribe, come round<br /><strong>反</strong>　resist, defy, dissent　抵制，不同意<br /><strong>派</strong>　acquiesence n．听话，顺从<br />

addict	L01 U06			<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ad-[to]+dict[say], to say (repeatedly), 不断地说→v.沉溺，上瘾n.对某事上瘾的人<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>dic, dict</strong>　词根dic(t)表示say[说]。常见词predict[预测]，字面义say[dict=say]before[pre-=before], 即预先说（结果）。同大部分与说相关的词根一样，这个词根也有“words”的含义，dictionary[字典]就是a collection of words。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　abdicate, addict, indict, interdict, valediction, vindicate, contradict, dictate<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />[əˈdɪkt] [sound:addict_v.mp3]<br />v. <strong><ins>沉溺，上瘾：</ins></strong>to devote or <strong><ins>surrender</ins></strong> (oneself) to something habitually or <strong><ins>obsessively</ins></strong><br />[ˈædɪkt] [sound:addict_n.mp3]<br />n. <strong><ins>对某事上瘾的人：</ins></strong>a person with a strong and <strong><ins>habitual liking</ins></strong> for something<br /><strong>例</strong>　be addicted to drug/alcohol　沉溺于毒品、酒<br />　　science-fiction addicts who eagerly await each new installment in the series　科幻小说爱好者，等待着系列的每一次更新<br /><strong>近</strong>　devotee, enthusiast, fanatic, maniac<br /><strong>反</strong>　nonfan　非粉丝<br />

adventitious	L01 U07	[ˌædvenˈtɪʃəs][sound:adventitious.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ad-[to]+vent[come]+it+-ious[a.], "come" ( instead of being innate)→a.外来的，后天的，非内在的<br />　　　【注】通过词根区别adventitious与advantageous（优势的，有利的），其中advantage表“优点，优势”，加上后缀-ous[a.]表示“优点多的”，即优势的，有利的。<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>ven (t)</strong>　词根ven (t)表示come[来]。advent[到来]就是“to[ad-]come[vent]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　contravene, convene, convenience, adventitious, convention, circumvent, inventory<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>外来的，后天的，非内在的：</ins></strong>coming from another source and <strong><ins>not inherent or innate</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　adventitious viruses　外来病毒<br /><strong>近</strong>　alien, extraneous, external, foreign, supervenient<br /><strong>反</strong>　constitutional, essential, intrinsic, inborn, inbred, innate, inherent　天生的，内在的<br />

apposite	L02 U03	[ˈæpəzɪt][sound:apposite.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【记】ap-[ad-, to]+posite[position], （near) totheposition, “说到点子上，做得到位”→a.相关的，合适的<br />　　　【注】position[位置]指“一个东西放[pos]在哪里”<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>pos (t)</strong>　词根pos表示put[放]，同源词根还有post。expose[揭露]就是“（把隐藏的东西）放到[pos]外面[ex-]”;poster[海报]指“放[post]在外面起宣传作用的东西[-er]”。另外, suppose[假设]指“（将未证实的结论）放在[pos]下面[sup-=sub-]（作为研究和讨论的基础）”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　apposite, apropos, compose, depose, deposit, discompose, imposing, poseur, posit, superimpose, supposition, repose, impostor, postulate, posture<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>相关的，合适的：</ins></strong>highly <strong><ins>pertinent</ins></strong> or <strong><ins>appropriate</ins></strong>: apt<br /><strong>例</strong>　enrich his essay with some very apposite quotations from famous people　用名人名言来丰富他的文章<br /><strong>近</strong>　applicable, apropos, germane, pointed, relative, relevant<br /><strong>反</strong>　extraneous, irrelevant, impertinent, irrelative, pointless　无关的<br />

apprehension	L02 U04	[ˌæprɪˈhenʃn][sound:apprehension.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ap-[ad-, to]+prehens[seize]+-ion[n.], seize (mentally), “抓心”→n.忧虑，恐惧；seize (criminal), 抓（犯人）→n.逮捕；seize (the meaning of), 抓（含义）→n.理解<br />　　　【派】apprehensive[a.知晓的，理解的；恐惧的，害怕的]<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>prehend, prehens</strong>　（1）词根prehend表示seize[抓]，变体prehens。comprehend[理解]就是“抓住（含义）”；名词形式comprehension, 短语“reading comprehension”是“阅读理解”。<br />　　　（2）词根prehend的另一种变体是pris, 构成的单词prison[监狱]是“抓[pris]（犯人）的地方[-on]”, comprise[包含，由…组成]就是“将…抓[pris]到一起[com-]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　comprehend, apprehension, misapprehension, reprehend, apprise, comprise<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>忧虑，恐惧：</ins></strong><strong><ins>suspicion</ins></strong> or <strong><ins>fear</ins></strong> especially of future evil<br /><strong>例</strong>　She had a strong apprehension about her sister's health．她非常担心她姐姐的健康。<br /><strong>近</strong>　dread, foreboding, misgiving, anxiousness, unease, uneasiness, worry<br /><strong>反</strong>　composure, equanimity　镇定；unconcern　冷漠<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>理解：</ins></strong>the knowledge gained from the process of coming to know or <strong><ins>understand</ins></strong> something<br /><strong>例</strong>　sudden apprehension of something strange　突然间领悟了陌生事物<br /><strong>近</strong>　understanding, comprehension<br /><strong>反</strong>　incomprehension<br />
apprise	L02 U04	[əˈpraɪz][sound:apprise.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ap-[ad-, to]+prise[prehens, seize], 使抓住（消息）→v.通知，告知<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>prehend, prehens</strong>　（1）词根prehend表示seize[抓]，变体prehens。comprehend[理解]就是“抓住（含义）”；名词形式comprehension, 短语“reading comprehension”是“阅读理解”。<br />　　　（2）词根prehend的另一种变体是pris, 构成的单词prison[监狱]是“抓[pris]（犯人）的地方[-on]”, comprise[包含，由…组成]就是“将…抓[pris]到一起[com-]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　comprehend, apprehension, misapprehension, reprehend, apprise, comprise<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />v. <strong><ins>通知，告知：</ins></strong>to give notice to; <strong><ins>inform</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　apprise him of the danger that may be involved　告知他可能涉及的危险<br /><strong>近</strong>　inform, acquaint, make known to<br /><strong>反</strong>　withhold information　隐瞒信息<br />
approbation	L02 U04	[ˌæprəˈbeɪʃn][sound:approbation.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【记】approval[n.赞成，批准]→n.同意<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>prob, prov</strong>　词根prob，prov（字母b和v的替换，参考mobile和move）表示“test[检验]，prove[证明]”以及引申含义“通过了检验”，即“证明（或认为）…为好，正确[right]”。probable[a.很可能的；可信的]字面含义“（对于不完全确定的事物）可[-able]证明正确[prob]的”。approve[v.赞成；批准]来自词根prov“认为…正确”的含义。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　approbation, disprove, probe, probity, reprobate, reprove, proofread<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>同意：</ins></strong>an expression of warm <strong><ins>approval</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　The proposal met his approbation．这项建议得到了他的同意。<br /><strong>近</strong>　approval, favor<br /><strong>反</strong>　disapproval, disapprobation, disfavor　不同意<br />
appropriate	L02 U04				<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />[əˈproʊprieɪt] [sound:appropriate_v.mp3]<br />v. <strong><ins>私自挪用：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>take possession</ins></strong> of or make use of exclusively for oneself, often <strong><ins>without</ins></strong> <strong><ins>permission</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　appropriate private property　盗用私人财产<br />　　The economy has been weakened by corrupt officials who have appropriated the country's resources for their own use．经济因为腐败的官员们私自挪用国家资源而被削弱了。<br /><strong>近</strong>　purloin, pirate, embezzle, peculate, usurp<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />[əˈproʊpriət] [sound:appropriate_a.mp3]<br />a. <strong><ins>适当的：</ins></strong>especially <strong><ins>suitable</ins></strong> or compatible: <strong><ins>fitting</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　Red wine is a more appropriate choice with the meal．红酒更适合这顿饭。<br /><strong>近</strong>　apt, becoming, felicitous, fitting, proper, meet, suitable, apposite, apropos<br /><strong>反</strong>　improper, inapposite, inappropriate, inapt, unmeet, unseemly, unsuitable　不合适的<br />
apropos	L02 U04	[ˌæprəˈpoʊ][sound:apropos.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【记】a-[to]+propos[propose], （near) to what is proposed→a.相关的prep.关于，有关<br />　　　【注】propose[提出]字面含义“put[pos]forth[pro-]”<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>pos (t)</strong>　词根pos表示put[放]，同源词根还有post。expose[揭露]就是“（把隐藏的东西）放到[pos]外面[ex-]”;poster[海报]指“放[post]在外面起宣传作用的东西[-er]”。另外, suppose[假设]指“（将未证实的结论）放在[pos]下面[sup-=sub-]（作为研究和讨论的基础）”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　apposite, apropos, compose, depose, deposit, discompose, imposing, poseur, posit, superimpose, supposition, repose, impostor, postulate, posture<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>相关的：</ins></strong>being both <strong><ins>relevant</ins></strong> and opportune<br /><strong>例</strong>　The actor announced to reporters that he would only answer to apropos questions about the movie．演员向记者表示，他只回答和电影有关的问题。<br /><strong>近</strong>　applicable, apposite, germane, pointed, relative, relevant<br /><strong>反</strong>　extraneous, irrelevant, impertinent, irrelative, pointless　无关的<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />prep. <strong><ins>关于，有关：</ins></strong><strong><ins>having to do with</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　make a number of telling observations apropos the current political situation　做了很多关于当前政治形势有力的观察<br /><strong>近</strong>　apropos, apropos of, as far as, as for, as regards (also as respects), as to, concerning, regarding, respecting, touching, toward（or towards）<br />
apt	L02 U04	[æpt][sound:apt.mp3]<br />			<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>恰当的，合适的：</ins></strong>exactly <strong><ins>suitable</ins></strong>; <strong><ins>appropriate</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　apt remark/choice/description　恰当的评述/选择/描述<br /><strong>近</strong>　apropos, germane, relative, relevant, appropriate<br /><strong>反</strong>　extraneous, irrelevant, impertinent, irrelative　无关的；inappropriate, improper, unseemly　不恰当的，不合时宜的<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>聪明的：</ins></strong>keenly <strong><ins>intelligent</ins></strong> and <strong><ins>responsive</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　an apt pupil　一个聪明的小学生<br />　　He is apt at mathematics．他擅长数学。<br /><strong>近</strong>　brilliant, clever, quick-witted, ready-witted, smart<br /><strong>反</strong>　foolish, dull, dumb, stupid, unintelligent　傻的，愚蠢的<br />

assiduous	L02 U06	[əˈsɪdʒuəs][sound:assiduous.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】as-[ad-, to]+sid[sit]+u+-ous[a.], sit, 一直坐着（做某事，例如学习），形容十分用心→a.勤勉的，专心仔细的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>sid, sed, sess</strong>　同源词根sid, sed, sess都表示sit[坐]。可以将它们看做sit的变形。president[主席]的字面含义“在前面[pre-]坐着[sid]的人[-ent]”, 引申出“一个团体中最重要的人”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　assiduous, residue, subside, subsidiary, subsidy, supersede, sedate, sedentary, sedulous, obsess<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>勤勉的，专心仔细的：</ins></strong>marked by <strong><ins>careful</ins></strong> unremitting attention or persistent application; busy<br /><strong>例</strong>　He always tended his garden with assiduous attention．他总是专心仔细地照看他的花园。<br />　　The project required some assiduous planning．该项目需要细心的规划。<br /><strong>近</strong>　diligent, industrious, sedulous<br /><strong>反</strong>　idle, inactive, unbusy, unemployed, unoccupied　空闲的<br /><strong>派</strong>　assiduity n．勤勉：persistent application or diligence; unflagging effort<br />

beneficent	L03 U02	[bɪˈnefɪsnt][sound:beneficent.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ben (e) [goodness]+fic[make]+-ent[a.], make goodness→a.仁慈的，好慈善的；（对个人或社会）有益的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>fic</strong>　词根fic表示make[做，使], 和词根fac (t）同源。efficient[有效的，生效的]字面含义“make out”, 即“做出（效果）”。后缀-fy[使…]即变形自词根fic。例如intensify[加剧]表示“to make[-fy]intense”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　beneficent, deficiency, efficacious, gasification, magnificent, nullification, officious, proficient, soporific, specific<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>仁慈的，好慈善的：</ins></strong>characterized by or performing acts of kindness or <strong><ins>charity</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　a beneficent couple who are regular volunteers at an orphan　一对常在孤儿院做义工的慈善的夫妇<br /><strong>近</strong>　kind, altruistic, benevolent, philanthropic, benign, compassionate, sympathetic<br /><strong>反</strong>　atrocious, barbarous, truculent, vicious　残忍的<br /><strong>派</strong>　beneficently adv．仁慈地<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>（对个人或社会）有益的：</ins></strong>promoting or <strong><ins>contributing</ins></strong> to personal or social well-being<br /><strong>例</strong>　the beneficent effect of sunshine　日光浴的益处<br /><strong>近</strong>　helpful, advantageous, favorable, kindly, profitable, salutary<br /><strong>反</strong>　detrimental, harmful, noxious, toxic　有害的<br />

caprice	L04 U01	[kəˈpriːs][sound:caprice.mp3]<br />			<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>反复无常，善变：</ins></strong>an inclination to <strong><ins>change</ins></strong> one's mind <strong><ins>impulsively</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　His decision is pure caprice．他的决定完全是心血来潮。<br /><strong>近</strong>　freakishness, impulsiveness, whimsicalness<br /><strong>反</strong>　confirmation　确认<br /><strong>派</strong>　capricious adj．反复无常的，善变的<br />　　<strong>反</strong>　steadfast, resolute, constant, pertinacious　坚定不变的<br />
captivate	L04 U01	[ˈkæptɪveɪt][sound:captivate.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】capt[seize]+-iv (e)+-ate[v.], seize (attentions), 抓注意力→vt.吸引<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cap, capt, cept, cip, cup</strong>　这些词根都表示seize[抓]或take[拿]，有着相同的词源。它们的拼写区别在于元音字母的不同，以及词根末尾的t。下面是由它们组成的一些单词：<br />　　　（1）capacity[容量]就是amount one could take[cap], 即一个容器能“拿”多少；<br />　　　（2）capture[捕获]相当于seize[capt]；<br />　　　（3）except[除…外]字面含义“take[cept]...out[ex-]”;accept[接受]是指“to[ac-=ad-]take[cept]”；<br />　　　（4）participate[参与]相当于“take[cip]part (in)”；<br />　　　（5）occupy[占用；占领]字面含义“to take[cup]over[oc-=ob-]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　captious, captivate, inception, exceptional, unexceptionable, perceptible, perceptive, susceptibility, disciple, emancipate, incipient, principal, preoccupation, recuperate<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>吸引：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>attract</ins></strong> and hold by charm, beauty, or excellence<br /><strong>例</strong>　I was captivated by her brilliant mind．我被她的才华横溢所吸引。<br /><strong>近</strong>　allure, beguile, bewitch, enchant, fascinate, magnetize<br /><strong>反</strong>　repulse　使反感<br />
cardinal	L04 U01	[ˈkɑːrdinl][sound:cardinal.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】card[cord, heart]+in+-al[a.], 像心脏一样的地位→a.主要的，非常重要的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cord</strong>　词根cord表示heart[心]。cordial表示“衷心的，热心的”。core[核心]也与词根cord同源。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　accord, chord, concord, discord, cardinal, hearten, dishearten, halfhearted, heartrending, stouthearted<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>主要的，非常重要的：</ins></strong>of <strong><ins>foremost importance</ins></strong>; <strong><ins>paramount</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　the cardinal rule of medicine: do no harm　药物的首要标准就是无害<br /><strong>近</strong>　dominant, overbearing, overriding, paramount, preeminent, primal, supreme<br /><strong>反</strong>　minor　次要的<br />

circumlocution	L04 U06	[ˌsзːrkəmləˈkjuːʃn][sound:circumlocution.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】circum-[around]+locu[speak]+-tion[n.], speak in circle→n.绕圈子的说话；引申出n.冗长<br />　　　【注】circum-来自circle, 字面义[in]circle, 即around<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>log</strong>　词根log表示speak[说]。例如dialogue[对话]字面义speak[log=speak]across[dia-=across]，形象一点说就是“话语在（人）之间穿梭”。作名词讲时，log表示“记录的话”，引申为“文字、作品”。log还有“学说”的含义，-logy是表示学科的后缀。此外，log有两个由尾辅音音变产生的同义词根loqu和locu。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　eulogize, monologue, prologue, grandiloquent, loquacious, obloquy, soliloquy, terminology, circumlocution<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>冗长：</ins></strong>the use of <strong><ins>too many</ins></strong> words to express an idea<br /><strong>例</strong>　Your papers have to be five pages long, but that's five pages of substance, not circumlocution．你的论文要求是5页，但是那5页都是实质内容，不是废话。<br /><strong>近</strong>　diffuseness, diffusion, long-windedness, prolixity, redundancy, verbalism, verboseness, verbosity, windiness, wordage, wordiness<br /><strong>反</strong>　conciseness, concision, pithiness, succinctness, terseness　简洁<br />

coagulate	L04 U07	[koʊˈæɡjuleɪt][sound:coagulate.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】co-[together]+ag[drive]+ul+-ate[v.], drive... together, （使）…到一起→v.（使）凝结，（使）变稠<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>ag, act</strong>　词根ag变形自act[做，行动]（g-ct相互替换）。agent[办事者，代理人]就是指“who[-ent]acts[ag]”。此外，词根ag还有“引导[drive, lead]”的含义。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　agility, agitate, coagulate, cogent, demagogue, pedagogue, agog, react, reactionary<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />v. <strong><ins>（使）凝结，（使）变稠：</ins></strong>to (cause to) become viscous or thickened into a <strong><ins>coherent</ins></strong> mass: curdle, <strong><ins>clot</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　The blood coagulates to stop wounds bleeding．血液会凝结以防止伤口流血。<br /><strong>近</strong>　clot, congeal, jelly<br /><strong>反</strong>　melt, liquefy, fluidify, dissolve　融化，溶解；thin　使变稀薄<br /><strong>派</strong>　coagulant n．凝结剂：an agent that causes a liquid to coagulate<br />

commotion	L04 U10	[kəˈmoʊʃn][sound:commotion.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】com-[together]+mot[move]+-ion[n.], move together, 一起（骚）动→n.骚乱<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>mot</strong>　词根mot表示move[动，移动]，构成单词motion[n.运动], motor[n.发动机]和motive[n.动机]。此外，mot的同源词根mov和mob具有相同的含义（例如move[移动], mobile[移动的]）。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　commotion, demote, motile, motivate, automatic<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>骚乱：</ins></strong>an agitated <strong><ins>disturbance</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　The commotion was created when the nation's top rock band arrived in town．当全国顶级摇滚乐队来到小镇时，人们骚乱了。<br /><strong>近</strong>　tumult, turmoil, pandemonium, hurry-scurry<br /><strong>反</strong>　tranquility, calmness, quiet, serenity　安静；order　有序<br />
compendium	L04 U10	[kəmˈpendiəm][sound:compendium.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【记】com-[together]+pend[hang]+-ium[n.], （将主要内容）挂在一起→n.摘要；目录，各种项目的列表或集合<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>pend, pens</strong>　词根pend（其他形式pens）表示hang[挂，悬挂]。depend[v.依赖，依靠]字面含义“挂在[pend]下面[de-]”，引申出“挂靠、附属于（某机构）”的含义；independent表示“不[in-]挂在[pend]任何事物下面[de-]的[-ent]”，独立的。pending[紧迫的，即将发生的]来自词根pend的引申义，表示“（某事件）处于悬挂状态”，即还没有发生，但（随时）可能“掉下来，发生”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　compendium, dependable, indispensable, impending, propensity, suspend, pensive<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>摘要：</ins></strong>a brief <strong><ins>summary</ins></strong> of a larger work or of a field of knowledge: <strong><ins>abstract</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　a compendium of information　资料概要<br /><strong>近</strong>　abstract, brief, overview<br /><strong>派</strong>　compendious adj．简洁而全面的：concise and comprehensive<br />　　<strong>例</strong>　his compendious knowledge of this subject　他关于这一学科的全面知识<br />　　<strong>近</strong>　concise, brief, laconic, compendiary, succinct<br />

compose	L04 U10	[kəmˈpouz][sound:compose.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】com-[together]+pos[put]+e[v.], puttogether→v.组成，构成；put (conflictions) together, 调和内心的冲突→vt.使镇定<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>pos (t)</strong>　词根pos表示put[放]，同源词根还有post。expose[揭露]就是“（把隐藏的东西）放到[pos]外面[ex-]”;poster[海报]指“放[post]在外面起宣传作用的东西[-er]”。另外, suppose[假设]指“（将未证实的结论）放在[pos]下面[sup-=sub-]（作为研究和讨论的基础）”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　apposite, apropos, compose, depose, deposit, discompose, imposing, poseur, posit, superimpose, supposition, repose, impostor, postulate, posture<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>使镇定：</ins></strong>to free from agitation: <strong><ins>calm</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　She took a deep breath and composed herself．她做了一个深呼吸，使自己安定下来。<br /><strong>近</strong>　contain, settle<br /><strong>反</strong>　agitate, discompose, disquiet, disturb, perturb, upset, vex　使激动，使不安<br /><strong>派</strong>　composed adj．镇静的，安定的：free from agitation: calm<br />　　<strong>反</strong>　distraught, restless　发狂的，不平静的<br /><strong>派</strong>　composure n．镇定：a calmness or repose especially of mind, bearing, or appearance<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />v. <strong><ins>组成，构成：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>form</ins></strong> the substance of: <strong><ins>constitute</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　composed of many ingredients　由很多配料组成<br /><strong>近</strong>　constitute, comprise, make up<br />
compound	L05 U01			<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】com-[together]+pound[put, 词根pon的变形], put (differentthings) together→n.混合物a.混合的vt.混合；put (samethings) together→v.扩大，增多；put (conflicting opinions) together→v.和解<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>pon</strong>　词根pon也表示put[放]，与词根pos同源。component[组件]字面含义是“放在（pon）一起（com-）的东西（-ent）”, 相对于所构成的整体它们就是“组件”。compound[混合物]字面含义是“将一切放在（poun）一起（com-），”即使混合，混合物。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　exponent, proponent, compound<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />[ˈkɑːmpaʊnd] [sound:compound_n.mp3]<br />n. <strong><ins>混合物：</ins></strong><strong><ins>something composed</ins></strong> of or resulting from union of separate elements, ingredients, or parts<br />[ˈkɑːmpaʊnd] [sound:compound_a.mp3]<br />a. <strong><ins>混合的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>consisting</ins></strong> of two or more substances, ingredients, elements, or parts<br />[kəmˈpaʊnd] [sound:compound_v.mp3]<br />vt. <strong><ins>混合：</ins></strong>to put or bring <strong><ins>together</ins></strong> so as to form a new and longer whole<br /><strong>例</strong>　mixed the chemicals together to form a new compound　将化学试剂混合形成新的化合物<br />　　a compound word　复合词<br />　　“Steamboat”is a compound noun．“汽船”是一个复合名词。<br />　　the German language's propensity for compounding words　德语喜欢复合单词<br /><strong>近</strong>　admixture, alloy, amalgam, amalgamation, cocktail, combination, composite, fusion, intermixture, meld, mix, conflation, synthesis; amalgamated; chain, conjugate, couple, hook, interconnect, interlink, join, link, yoke<br /><strong>反</strong>　noncompound　非混合的；disconnect, disjoin, disjoint, dissever, disunite, separate, unchain, uncouple, unhitch, unyoke　分开<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />[kəmˈpaʊnd] [sound:compound_v.mp3]<br />vt. <strong><ins>使恶化，加重：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>make worse</ins></strong>, more serious, or more severe<br /><strong>例</strong>　Additional bloodshed and loss of life will only compound the tragedy in this nation．额外的流血和牺牲只会加重这个国家的悲剧。<br /><strong>近</strong>　aggravate, complicate, exacerbate, intensify, worsen<br /><strong>反</strong>　allay, alleviate, assuage, mitigate, mollify, palliate, relieve, soothe　缓和，减轻<br />

concur	L05 U02	[kənˈkзːr][sound:concur.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】con-[together]+cur[run], （ideas) run together→vi.同意；（some things) run（=occur) together→vi.同一时间发生、存在；run together→vi.团结合作<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cur (s)</strong>　词根cur (s)表示run[跑]。occur[发生]就是指“（事件）跑[cur]过来[oc-=ob-, toward]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　concur, excursive, incursion, precursor, cursory, discursive<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vi. <strong><ins>同意：</ins></strong>to express <strong><ins>agreement</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　concur with an excellent opinion　同意一个好的想法<br /><strong>近</strong>　agree, coincide<br /><strong>反</strong>　differ, disagree　不同意<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />vi. <strong><ins>同一时间发生、存在：</ins></strong>to occur or exist at the <strong><ins>same time</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　The race to the moon, the Vietnam War, and the civil rights movement all concurred in the 1960s．登月、越战和人权运动都发生在二十世纪六十年代。<br /><strong>近</strong>　coexist, synchronize, co-occur<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 3</strong>】<br />vi. <strong><ins>团结合作：</ins></strong>to participate or assist in a <strong><ins>joint</ins></strong> effort to accomplish an end<br /><strong>例</strong>　All people concurred to pass the reform legislation．所有人都联合起来使改革法案通过。<br /><strong>近</strong>　band together, collaborate, concert, conjoin, league, team up, unite<br />

conscientious	L05 U04	[ˌkɑːnʃiˈenʃəs][sound:conscientious.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【参】conscience[n.良心，良知]（“（道德上）是人都[con-]知道[sci]的（良知）”）的形容词形式→a.有良心的，正直的；conscious[a.有意识的；意识到的]“（对某事物有认知[sci]（能力）的”）→a.仔细的，一丝不苟的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>sci</strong>　词根sci表示know[知道]。science[科学]的早期含义与“knowledge”类似。SCI是“Science Citation Index”[科学引文索引]的缩写，可以联想成“人类科研上的已知[sci]”来加深词根sci的记忆。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　omniscient, prescience, conscientious<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>仔细的，一丝不苟的：</ins></strong>taking, showing, or <strong><ins>involving great care</ins></strong> and effort<br /><strong>例</strong>　a conscientious researcher　一丝不苟的研究者<br /><strong>近</strong>　careful, exact, heedful, meticulous, painstaking, scrupulous<br /><strong>反</strong>　careless, remiss　粗心大意的<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>有良心的，正直的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>governed by</ins></strong> or conforming to the dictates of <strong><ins>conscience</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　a conscientious police officer　一名有良心的警察<br /><strong>近</strong>　conscionable, ethical, honest, moral, upright, principled, scrupulous<br /><strong>反</strong>　unscrupulous　不正直的<br /><strong>派</strong>　conscience n．良心<br />

contagious	L05 U05	[kənˈteɪdʒəs][sound:contagious.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】con-[together]+tag[touch]+-(i) ous, touch (together), 通过接触传播→a.传染的；touching, 触碰心灵→a.（情绪等）唤起共鸣的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>ta (n) g</strong>　词根ta (n) g表示touch[触摸]。tangible[可感知的；确凿的，真实的]字面含义“able[-ible]to touch[tang]”。此外，词根tact与词根tag同源，contact[v.接触，联系]字面含义“touch[tact]together[con-]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　intangible, tangent, contagious, integral, contiguous<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>传染的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>communicable</ins></strong> by contact; catching<br /><strong>例</strong>　contagious diseases　传染病<br /><strong>近</strong>　infectious, pestilent, transmissible, epidemic<br /><strong>反</strong>　incommunicable　不传染的<br /><strong>派</strong>　contagiousness n．可传染性<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>（情绪等）唤起共鸣的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>exciting a similar feeling</ins></strong> or reaction in others<br /><strong>例</strong>　The enthusiasm of the new club members was contagious．新成员的热情具有很强的感染力。<br /><strong>近</strong>　catching, spreading<br />

content	L05 U05			<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】con-[together]+tent[hold], hold together, 使一个人持有所有想要的→vt.使满足；（一本书中、一场讲座等）包含的东西→n.主题；内容，内涵<br />　　　【注】注意区分content和contend:content来自contain[包含]的变形——做决策时“包含”某人要求即“使那个人满足”，包含的东西即主题和内容；而contend表示“一起[con-]伸[tend]手抢”，即竞争。<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>tain, tin, ten (t)</strong>　词根tain, 以及变形tent, tin和ten都表示hold。contain[包含]（字面义hold...together[con-]）和attain[获得]（字面义to[at-=ad-]hold）都来自词根tain[hold]。continent[大陆]（字面义holdtogether）就是“连在一起（的土地）”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　abstain, detain, pertain, retainer, content, malcontentn, countenance, retentive, tenable, untenable, tenacious, pertinent, impertinent, pertinacious, retinue<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />[kənˈtent] [sound:content_v.mp3]<br />vt. <strong><ins>使满足：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>appease</ins></strong> the desires of<br /><strong>例</strong>　One glass of beer every day could content him．每天一杯啤酒就能满足他。<br /><strong>近</strong>　satisfy, gratify, rejoice<br /><strong>反</strong>　discontent　不满足<br /><strong>派</strong>　contented adj．满足的<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>内容，内涵：</ins></strong>the <strong><ins>idea that is conveyed</ins></strong> or intended to be conveyed to the mind by language, symbol, or action<br /><strong>例</strong>　The speech was filled with fancy words but devoid of any real content．这篇演讲辞藻华丽，但是没什么实质性内容。<br /><strong>近</strong>　intention, purport, sense, significance<br />
cloak	L05 U06	[kloʊk][sound:cloak.mp3]<br />			<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>遮掩，隐藏：</ins></strong>to change the dress or looks of so as to <strong><ins>conceal true identity</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　cloak his evil purpose under sweet words　用甜言蜜语掩盖邪恶目的<br /><strong>近</strong>　belie, camouflage, conceal, cover, curtain, disguise, mask, obscure, occult, screen, sham, shroud, suppress, veil<br /><strong>反</strong>　debunk, disclose, display, divulge, expose, reveal, show, uncloak, uncover, unmask, unveil　揭露，揭穿<br />
contentious	L05 U06	[kənˈtenʃəs][sound:contentious.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【记】来自contend[竞争；声明], -（i) ous是形容词后缀，争论的→a.引起争论的；好争论的，好战的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>tend, tens, tent</strong>　词根tend表示stretch[伸出，伸展]，例如extend[拓展]就是“向外[ex-]伸展[tend]”;tend作为单词有“趋向”的含义，即“（向某方向）伸展”。词根tend有两个常见的变体tens和tent。extension[拓展，伸展]是extend的名词形式；extent[程度]就是“向外伸展”的多少。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　tendentious, contend, contentious, distend, intensify, pretense, unpretentious, ostensible, ostentatious, portentous<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>引起争论的：</ins></strong>likely to cause contention; <strong><ins>argumentative</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　contentious contents in a movie　电影中引发争论的内容<br /><strong>近</strong>　controversial, disputatious, polemical<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>好争论的，好战的：</ins></strong>exhibiting an perverse and wearisome <strong><ins>tendency</ins></strong> to <strong><ins>quarrels</ins></strong> and disputes<br /><strong>例</strong>　The Tartars were a contentious people who terrorized much of Asia and eastern Europe during the Middle Ages．鞑靼是一个好斗的民族，他们在中世纪时期统治了亚洲和东欧的大片土地。<br /><strong>近</strong>　belligerent, bellicose, combative, truculent, litigious, pugnacious, scrappy<br /><strong>反</strong>　dovish, peace-loving　爱好和平的<br />

contract	L05 U06			<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】con-[together]+tract[draw], drawtogether, （法律意义上将人）拉到一起→n.契约，合同；拉到一起，集中在一起使体积变小→v.收缩；“（和病毒）拉到一起”, draw[=catch] (a disease)→v.感染疾病<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>tract</strong>　词根tract表示draw[拉], attract[吸引]字面含义“to[at-=ad-]draw[tract]”, 即“拉（注意力）”, 引申为“吸引”。abstract[抽象]就是“（从众多事物中）抽[tract]出[abs-]共同且本质的特征”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　abstract, contract, detract, distract, distraught, extract, extraction, protract, retract, tractable<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />[ˈkɑːntrækt] [sound:contract_n.mp3]<br />n. <strong><ins>契约，合同：</ins></strong>a <strong><ins>binding agreement</ins></strong> between two or more persons or parties, especially one that is written and enforceable by law<br /><strong>例</strong>　a billion-dollar contract from Department of Defense　来自国防部的巨额合同<br /><strong>近</strong>　agreement, compact, convention, treaty<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />[kənˈtrækt] [sound:contract_v.mp3]<br />v. <strong><ins>收缩：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>reduce</ins></strong> in <strong><ins>size</ins></strong> by drawing together; shrink<br /><strong>例</strong>　contract muscle　收缩肌肉<br /><strong>近</strong>　compress, condense, concentrate<br /><strong>反</strong>　expand　扩展；inflate　膨胀<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 3</strong>】<br />[kənˈtrækt] [sound:contract_v.mp3]<br />v. <strong><ins>感染疾病：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>become affected</ins></strong> by a disease or disorder<br /><strong>例</strong>　He contracted a severe cold that later turned into pneumonia．他染上了重感冒，最终发展成为肺炎。<br /><strong>近</strong>　catch, get, sicken<br /><strong>反</strong>　heal　痊愈<br />

convoluted	L05 U07	[ˈkɑːnvəluːtɪd][sound:convoluted.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】con-[together]+volu[volv, roll]+t+ed[a.], roll together, 卷在一起的→a.复杂的，费解的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>volv</strong>　词根volv表示roll[卷，转动]。involve[使陷入，包含]指“卷[volv]入[in-]”，可以说“将一个人卷入到一个案子中”。revolve[循环]字面含义“（天体）转[volv]回来[re-]”，最初描述天体周而复始的运动。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　convoluted, voluble, revolt<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>复杂的，费解的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>complicated</ins></strong>; intricate<br /><strong>例</strong>　a convoluted way of describing a simple mechanism　用令人费解的方法解释一个简单的原理<br /><strong>近</strong>　complex, knotty, involved, sophisticated, twisted, tangled, labyrinthine<br /><strong>反</strong>　straightforward　直截了当的<br />

defer	L06 U06	[dɪˈfзːr][sound:defer.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】de-[down, 向下]+fer[carry], （将某事的日程）带到下面→v.推迟，延期；（将上面的意见）带下来[de-=down]→vi.遵从<br />　　　【派】deference[n.尊崇，顺从]<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>fer</strong>　词根fer表示bring, carry[带，拿]。conference[会议]（动词形式confer[协商]），指“将大家的观点带到[fer]一起[con-]”。“prefer[更喜欢]某物”是指当有许多选择的时候“预先[pre-]拿[fer]”它。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　defer, indifferent, proffer, referee, peripheral, fertilize, euphoria, aphorism, belligerent<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />v. <strong><ins>推迟，延期：</ins></strong>to put off; <strong><ins>postpone</ins></strong>; defer<br /><strong>例</strong>　We agreed to defer a discussion of the issue．我们决定推迟问题的讨论。<br /><strong>近</strong>　delay, remit, shelve, hold off, hold over, lay over, put off<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />vi. <strong><ins>遵从：</ins></strong>to submit to another's wishes, opinion, or governance usually through deference or <strong><ins>respect</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　defer to her father's wishes　遵从她父亲的意愿<br /><strong>派</strong>　deference n．尊崇，顺从：a readiness or willingness to yield to the wishes of others<br />　　<strong>例</strong>　He is shown much deference by his colleagues．　他的同事很尊敬他。<br />　　<strong>近</strong>　acquiescence, compliancy, docility, obedience, submissiveness<br />　　<strong>反</strong>　contempt, defiance, disobedience, intractability, recalcitrance　轻视，不服从<br /><strong>派</strong>　deferential adj．表示尊重的，恭敬的：showing or expressing deference<br />　　<strong>反</strong>　imperious, impudent　专横无礼的<br />
deficiency	L06 U06	[dɪˈfɪʃnsi][sound:deficiency.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】de-[down]+fic[make]+i+-ency[n.], 做得不够→n.缺乏，不足<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>fic</strong>　词根fic表示make[做，使], 和词根fac (t）同源。efficient[有效的，生效的]字面含义“make out”, 即“做出（效果）”。后缀-fy[使…]即变形自词根fic。例如intensify[加剧]表示“to make[-fy]intense”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　beneficent, deficiency, efficacious, gasification, magnificent, nullification, officious, proficient, soporific, specific<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>缺乏，不足：</ins></strong>the quality or state of being deficient: <strong><ins>inadequate</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　There is a deficiency of fresh food in the diet of many of the working poor．很多劳工阶层的饮食都缺乏新鲜食物。<br /><strong>近</strong>　want, dearth, deficit, famine, paucity, scantiness, scarcity<br /><strong>反</strong>　surfeit, abundance, adequacy, amplitude, opulence, sufficiency　过度，充足<br />

desultory	L07 U01	[ˈdesəltɔːri][sound:desultory.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】de-[down]+sult[leap]+-ory[a.], (leaf) leap down→a.无计划的，无目的的；(make mood) leapdown→a.令人失望的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>sul (t)</strong>　词根sul (t)表示leap[跳]。insult[侮辱]字面含义是“跳[leap]到一个人身上[in-]”, 表示“践踏，侮辱”；result[结果]字面含义是“跳[sult]回来[re-]”, 是指对于所做出行为的回应。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　desultory, exult, resilience, salient<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>无计划的，无目的的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>lacking</ins></strong> a definite <strong><ins>plan</ins></strong>, purpose, or pattern<br /><strong>例</strong>　a desultory conversation　漫谈<br /><strong>近</strong>　digressive, excursive, meandering, rambling, wandering<br /><strong>反</strong>　carefully planned, strictly methodical, assiduous　精心计划的，有条理的，专心致志的<br />

detain	L07 U01	[dɪˈteɪn][sound:detain.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】de-[away]+tain[hold], hold (sb./sth.) away, 拿走（人/物）→vt.拘留，扣留<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>tain, tin, ten (t)</strong>　词根tain, 以及变形tent, tin和ten都表示hold。contain[包含]（字面义hold...together[con-]）和attain[获得]（字面义to[at-=ad-]hold）都来自词根tain[hold]。continent[大陆]（字面义holdtogether）就是“连在一起（的土地）”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　abstain, detain, pertain, retainer, content, malcontentn, countenance, retentive, tenable, untenable, tenacious, pertinent, impertinent, pertinacious, retinue<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>拘留，扣留：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>hold</ins></strong> or <strong><ins>keep</ins></strong> in or as if in custody<br /><strong>例</strong>　arrest and detain the drug dealers　逮捕并拘留毒贩<br /><strong>反</strong>　manumit　释放<br />

diminish	L07 U03	[dɪˈmɪnɪʃ][sound:diminish.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】di-[de-, down]+min[small]+-ish[v.], make small down, （使）小下来→v.（使）变小，（使）减少；小看，将（价值或影响力）低估→v.轻视，贬低<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>min</strong>　词根min有“small[小]”和“jut[突出]”两层含义，合起来可以看做“突出的小尖”。<br />　　　（1）词根min的一个常见含义表示“小”，例如“迷你”就来源于mini的音译；minister[大臣]原指（相对于国王来讲的）“小[min (i）]人[-ster]、手下”；<br />　　　（2）词根min的另外一个含义是“突出”，这层含义与（1）的联系是“突出的尖端”很小。mountain[山]（看做与词根min元音替换）相对于地球来讲，就是“突出的（小尖）”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　diminish, eminent, menace, menial, minatory, mince, minimize, miniscule, minute, preeminent<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />v. <strong><ins>（使）变小，（使）减少：</ins></strong>to（cause to）become <strong><ins>smaller</ins></strong> or <strong><ins>less</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　diminish an army's strength　削弱军队力量<br />　　The sound of the train diminished as our distance from it increased．当我们距离火车越远时，火车的声音就越小。<br /><strong>近</strong>　abate, dwindle, lessen, lower, reduce, decline<br /><strong>反</strong>　aggrandize, amplify, augment, boost, enlarge, escalate, expand, increase, raise, balloon　增加，增大<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />v. <strong><ins>轻视，贬低：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>lessen</ins></strong> the authority, dignity, or reputation of: <strong><ins>belittle</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　diminish a rival's accomplishments　贬低对手的成就<br /><strong>近</strong>　belittle, deprecate, depreciate, disparage<br /><strong>反</strong>　acclaim, applaud, exalt, extol, glorify, laud, praise　赞美<br />

disciple	L07 U05	[dɪˈsaɪpl][sound:disciple.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】dis-[away]+cip[take]+-le[n.], people whotakes away (doctrines), 带走[接受]教义的人→n.信徒，追随者<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cap, capt, cept, cip, cup</strong>　这些词根都表示seize[抓]或take[拿]，有着相同的词源。它们的拼写区别在于元音字母的不同，以及词根末尾的t。下面是由它们组成的一些单词：<br />　　　（1）capacity[容量]就是amount one could take[cap], 即一个容器能“拿”多少；<br />　　　（2）capture[捕获]相当于seize[capt]；<br />　　　（3）except[除…外]字面含义“take[cept]...out[ex-]”;accept[接受]是指“to[ac-=ad-]take[cept]”；<br />　　　（4）participate[参与]相当于“take[cip]part (in)”；<br />　　　（5）occupy[占用；占领]字面含义“to take[cup]over[oc-=ob-]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　captious, captivate, inception, exceptional, unexceptionable, perceptible, perceptive, susceptibility, disciple, emancipate, incipient, principal, preoccupation, recuperate<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>信徒，追随者：</ins></strong>one who accepts and assists in spreading the doctrines of another, <strong><ins>follower</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　A circle of dedicated disciples who conscientiously wrote down everything the prophet said．一圈忠实的信徒认真地记下了先知所说的话。<br /><strong>近</strong>　acolyte, adherent, convert, epigone, partisan, votary<br /><strong>反</strong>　leader, coryphaeus　领导者<br />

discompose	L07 U05	[ˌdɪskəmˈpoʊz][sound:discompose.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】dis-[opposite to]+com-[together]+pos[put]+e[v.], oppositeto“puttogether”→vt.使不安；使混乱<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>pos (t)</strong>　词根pos表示put[放]，同源词根还有post。expose[揭露]就是“（把隐藏的东西）放到[pos]外面[ex-]”;poster[海报]指“放[post]在外面起宣传作用的东西[-er]”。另外, suppose[假设]指“（将未证实的结论）放在[pos]下面[sup-=sub-]（作为研究和讨论的基础）”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　apposite, apropos, compose, depose, deposit, discompose, imposing, poseur, posit, superimpose, supposition, repose, impostor, postulate, posture<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>使不安：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>disturb</ins></strong> the <strong><ins>composure</ins></strong> or calm of; <strong><ins>perturb</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　GRE does not seem to discompose Jason; on the contrary, he looks rather relaxed. GRE没有使Jason感到慌乱，正相反，他看上去很轻松。<br /><strong>近</strong>　agitate, bother, discomfort, disquiet, distemper, disconcert, disturb, perturb, upset, weird out<br /><strong>反</strong>　calm, compose, quiet, settle, soothe, tranquilize　平息，抚慰<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>使混乱：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>undo</ins></strong> the proper <strong><ins>order</ins></strong> or <strong><ins>arrangement</ins></strong> of<br /><strong>例</strong>　The wind discomposed arranged papers．风吹乱了细心整理的纸张。<br /><strong>近</strong>　disarrange, disarray, disorganize<br /><strong>反</strong>　arrange, array, order, organize, range　使有序<br />

disregard	L07 U08	[ˌdɪsrɪˈɡɑːrd][sound:disregard.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【记】dis-[opposite of, not]+regard[n.＆v.注意；考虑；尊重], opposite of“regard”→v.漠视，不关注；缺乏兴趣，缺乏关心<br />　　　【注】regard[n.＆v.注意；考虑；尊重]的字面含义是“（一再[re-]地）看[词根gard]”（参guard[v.看守]，字面含义“keep watching”），指对某事物“关注，注意”；也表示对某人“尊重”（参respect）。<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>漠视，不关注：</ins></strong>to pay <strong><ins>no attention</ins></strong> to<br /><strong>例</strong>　disregard his feelings　漠视他的感受<br /><strong>近</strong>　ignore, overlook, slight<br /><strong>反</strong>　heed, mind, regard, attend to　关注<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>缺乏兴趣，缺乏关心：</ins></strong>lack of <strong><ins>interest</ins></strong> or <strong><ins>concern</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　Revelers fired guns in the air with complete disregard for the possible consequences．饮酒狂欢者朝空中乱开枪，一点也不关心可能产生的后果。<br /><strong>近</strong>　apathy, disinterestedness, incuriosity, nonchalance, torpor, unconcern<br /><strong>反</strong>　concern, interest, regard　关心，感兴趣<br />

diverge	L07 U10	[daɪˈvзːrdʒ][sound:diverge.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】di-[apart]+verg[turn]+-e[v.], turn (direction) apart→vt.改变方向；(beam) turn apart→vt.（使）分叉，散开；(opinions) turn apart→vi.分歧；turn apart (from the subject)→vi.离题<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>verg</strong>　词根verg（与vers, vert仅末尾字母不同）表示turn[转]。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　converge, diverge<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>（使）分叉，散开：</ins></strong>to(cause to)go or move in <strong><ins>different directions</ins></strong> from a <strong><ins>central</ins></strong> point<br /><strong>例</strong>　The river's branches diverged．河的支流分叉了。<br /><strong>近</strong>　branch out, divide, spread<br /><strong>反</strong>　converge, join　会合<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />vi. <strong><ins>分歧：</ins></strong>to become or be <strong><ins>different</ins></strong> in character or form: <strong><ins>differ</ins></strong> in opinion<br /><strong>近</strong>　differ, disagree<br /><strong>反</strong>　conform　遵从<br /><strong>派</strong>　divergence n．分歧，不同意：disagreement<br />
diversity	L07 U10	[daɪˈvзːrsəti][sound:diversity.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】di-[apart]+vers[turn]+-ity[n.], （species) turn apart→n.多样性；（opinions) turn apart→n.分歧，不同点<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>vers</strong>　词根vers表示turn[转]。reverse[相反；倒退]的字面义是“反[re-]转[vers]”。universe[宇宙]字面含义“turn[vers]（into) one[uni-]”, 即“囊括一切的整体”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　adversary, adversity, aversion, conversant, diversity, versatile, verse, traverse<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>多样性：</ins></strong><strong><ins>variety</ins></strong> or <strong><ins>multiformity</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　the diversity of species　物种的多样性<br /><strong>近</strong>　diverseness, multifariousness, multiplicity, variousness, miscellaneousness<br />
divert	L07 U10	[daɪˈvзːrt][sound:divert.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】di-[apart]+vert[turn], turn (apart)→vt.使转向；使转向（其他的事）→vt.使分心；使转向（轻松的事）→vt.使消遣<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>vert</strong>　词根vert表示turn[转]。revert[恢复，归还]字面含义“turn[vert]back[re-]”。advertise[作宣传，作广告]就是“使[-ise]（人的视线）转向[to[ad-]turn[vert]]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　advert, convert, divert, inadvertent, incontrovertible, subvert, vertigo<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>使转向：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>turn</ins></strong> from one course or use to another: <strong><ins>deflect</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　divert traffic to a side street　使交通转至辅路<br /><strong>近</strong>　deflect, redirect, swing, veer, wheel<br /><strong>反</strong>　fix, set, settle　固定<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>使消遣：</ins></strong>to cause (someone) to pass the time <strong><ins>agreeably</ins></strong> occupied<br /><strong>例</strong>　A light comedy divert the tired business executive．一个轻松的喜剧让疲惫的企业主管人员得到了放松。<br /><strong>近</strong>　disport, entertain, regale, solace<br />

effluvium	L08 U06	[ɪˈfluːviəm][sound:effluvium.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ef-[ex-, out]+flu (v) [flow]+-ium[n.], (sth.) flow out→n.难闻的气味；没用的副产品，废品<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>flu</strong>　词根flu表示flow[流动]。作为单词，flu表示“流感”。influence[影响]字面含义“流[flu]入[in-]”，如果某想法“流入”一个人，就会对他产生影响。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　affluent, confluence, effluvium, fluctuate, fluent, influx, superfluous, mellifluous, flush<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>难闻的气味：</ins></strong>an <strong><ins>offensive</ins></strong> exhalation or <strong><ins>smell</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　Repulsive effluvia made us vomit．这恶臭让我们作呕。<br /><strong>近</strong>　malodor, stink, stench<br /><strong>反</strong>　fragrance, aroma　芳香<br /><strong>派</strong>　effluvial adj．恶臭的<br />

effusive	L08 U06	[ɪˈfjuːsɪv][sound:effusive.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ef-[ex-, out]+fus[pour]+-ive[a.], (flow of emotion) pour out→a.感情泛滥/溢于言表的；感情表达不节制和过度的；过分多情的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>fus</strong>　词根fus表示pour[倒，流，倾泻]。confuse[使混乱；使困惑]指“（将…）倒[fus]在一起[con-]”, 增加混乱的程度；refuse[拒绝]的字面含义是“倒[fus]回[re-]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　diffuse, effusive, infuse, profuse, suffuse<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>感情泛滥的/溢于言表的；感情表达不节制的/过度的；过分多情的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>unrestrained</ins></strong> or excessive <strong><ins>in emotional expression</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　The principal delivered an effusive address at the commencement ceremony．校长在毕业典礼上做了充满感情的演讲。<br /><strong>近</strong>　emotional, expansive, demonstrative, gushy, passionate<br /><strong>反</strong>　inhibited, reserved, restrained　节制的；undemonstrative, unemotional　不易动情的；numb, torpid　麻木不仁的<br /><strong>派</strong>　effusion n．流出，溢出<br />

emancipate	L08 U07	[ɪˈmænsɪpeɪt][sound:emancipate.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】e-[out]+man[hand]+cip[take]+-ate[v.], take handout, 放开（被束缚的）手→vt.解放，解除束缚<br />　　　【注】词根man表示“手”，构成单词manual[n.手册a.手工的]<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cap, capt, cept, cip, cup</strong>　这些词根都表示seize[抓]或take[拿]，有着相同的词源。它们的拼写区别在于元音字母的不同，以及词根末尾的t。下面是由它们组成的一些单词：<br />　　　（1）capacity[容量]就是amount one could take[cap], 即一个容器能“拿”多少；<br />　　　（2）capture[捕获]相当于seize[capt]；<br />　　　（3）except[除…外]字面含义“take[cept]...out[ex-]”;accept[接受]是指“to[ac-=ad-]take[cept]”；<br />　　　（4）participate[参与]相当于“take[cip]part (in)”；<br />　　　（5）occupy[占用；占领]字面含义“to take[cup]over[oc-=ob-]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　captious, captivate, inception, exceptional, unexceptionable, perceptible, perceptive, susceptibility, disciple, emancipate, incipient, principal, preoccupation, recuperate<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>解放，解除束缚：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>free</ins></strong> from bondage, oppression, or restraint<br /><strong>例</strong>　emancipate the slaves　解放奴隶<br /><strong>近</strong>　discharge, enfranchise, free, liberate, loose, manumit, release<br /><strong>反</strong>　bind, shackle　束缚；enslave, enthrall　奴役<br /><strong>派</strong>　emancipation n．解放，获得自由<br />

eminent	L08 U08	[ˈemɪnənt][sound:eminent.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】e-[out]+min[jut]+-ent[a.], jut out, （人在群体中）突出→a.杰出的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>min</strong>　词根min有“small[小]”和“jut[突出]”两层含义，合起来可以看做“突出的小尖”。<br />　　　（1）词根min的一个常见含义表示“小”，例如“迷你”就来源于mini的音译；minister[大臣]原指（相对于国王来讲的）“小[min (i）]人[-ster]、手下”；<br />　　　（2）词根min的另外一个含义是“突出”，这层含义与（1）的联系是“突出的尖端”很小。mountain[山]（看做与词根min元音替换）相对于地球来讲，就是“突出的（小尖）”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　diminish, eminent, menace, menial, minatory, mince, minimize, miniscule, minute, preeminent<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>杰出的：</ins></strong>exhibiting eminence especially in standing <strong><ins>above others</ins></strong> in some quality or position<br /><strong>例</strong>　an eminent young scientist　一名杰出的青年科学家<br /><strong>近</strong>　famous, celebrated, distinguished, famed, notable, prominent, renowned<br /><strong>反</strong>　mediocre, undistinguished　中庸的，平凡的<br /><strong>派</strong>　eminence n．杰出，显赫<br />

encumber	L08 U09	[ɪnˈkʌmbər][sound:encumber.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【记】en-[使]+cumber[阻碍], (to make) cumber→vt.阻碍，妨碍；给…增添负担<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cu (m) b</strong>　（1）词根cu (m) b表示lie[躺；位于]。cubicle[小卧室]中的词根cub指“躺下睡觉”，-cle是表示“小”的名词后缀。（另一方面，cubicle可以看做“小[-（c) le]立方体[cube, 形容词形式cubic]”, 从轮廓上描述了“小卧室”。）<br />　　　（2）cumber[n.＆v.阻碍]可以理解成“躺[cumb]（在路上）（的东西[-er]）”, 像绊脚石那样阻碍前进。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　incubate, incumbent, recumbent, succumb, cumbersome, encumber<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>阻碍；妨碍：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>impede</ins></strong> or hamper the function or activity of<br /><strong>例</strong>　encumber their progress　妨碍他们的进步<br />　　encumber myself with unnecessary luggage　受不必要的行李防碍<br /><strong>近</strong>　hamper, hinder, impede, obstruct, retard, stymie<br /><strong>反</strong>　promote, further　推动；aid, assist, facilitate, help　帮助<br />

eulogize	L09 U04	[ˈjuːlədʒaɪz][sound:eulogize.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】eu-[well]+log[speak]+-ize[v.], speakwell (of), 说…好→vt.称赞；颂扬<br />　　　【注】eu读音联想“优”<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>log</strong>　词根log表示speak[说]。例如dialogue[对话]字面义speak[log=speak]across[dia-=across]，形象一点说就是“话语在（人）之间穿梭”。作名词讲时，log表示“记录的话”，引申为“文字、作品”。log还有“学说”的含义，-logy是表示学科的后缀。此外，log有两个由尾辅音音变产生的同义词根loqu和locu。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　eulogize, monologue, prologue, grandiloquent, loquacious, obloquy, soliloquy, terminology, circumlocution<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>称赞；颂扬：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>speak</ins></strong> or write <strong><ins>in high praise of</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　The boss eulogized about his versatility．老板称赞了他的多才多艺。<br /><strong>反</strong>　defame, pan　诬蔑，指责<br />

euphonious	L09 U04	[juːˈfoʊniəs][sound:euphonious.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】eu[good]+phon[sound]+-(i) ous[a.], (of) good sound→a.悦耳的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>phon</strong>　词根phon表示sound[声音]。由词根phon构成的phone[电话]是telephone的缩写，字面含义是“向远处[tele-]传递声音[phon]的东西[-e]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　cacophony, euphonious<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>悦耳的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>pleasing</ins></strong> or agreeable to the ear<br /><strong>例</strong>　euphonious music　悦耳的音乐<br /><strong>近</strong>　mellifluous, melodious, canorous, harmonizing, symphonious, tuneful<br /><strong>反</strong>　cacophonous, discordant, disharmonious, dissonant, tuneless, unmelodious　刺耳的<br />
euphoria	L09 U04	[juːˈfɔːriə][sound:euphoria.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】eu[well]+phor[fer, carry]+-ia[n.状态（往往是生病的状态）], carrying well, 处于感觉极好的状态→n.感觉极其愉快<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>fer</strong>　词根fer表示bring, carry[带，拿]。conference[会议]（动词形式confer[协商]），指“将大家的观点带到[fer]一起[con-]”。“prefer[更喜欢]某物”是指当有许多选择的时候“预先[pre-]拿[fer]”它。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　defer, indifferent, proffer, referee, peripheral, fertilize, euphoria, aphorism, belligerent<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>感觉极其愉快：</ins></strong>a state of <strong><ins>overwhelming usually pleasurable</ins></strong> emotion<br /><strong>例</strong>　There was euphoria after election．选举之后是一阵狂喜。<br />　　the euphoria of her victory　她胜利的喜悦<br /><strong>近</strong>　elation, exhilaration, intoxication, transport, rapture, rhapsody<br /><strong>反</strong>　depression　沮丧<br />

exacerbate	L09 U05	[ɪɡˈzæsərbeɪt][sound:exacerbate.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ex-[thoroughly]+acerb[acerbic]+-ate[v.], makethoroughlysharp, acerbic→vt.使加剧，使恶化<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>ac</strong>　词根ac表示sharp[尖，锐利]，构成的单词有比较丰富的比喻义。例如acid既指味觉上的sharp, 即刺激味觉、嗅觉的酸味，也指具有强烈腐蚀性的酸，例如硫酸。此外，acid还指语言上的尖酸刻薄，“说话带刺”而使人不舒服。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　acerbic, acme, acrid, acrimonious, exacerbate, acumen, acute<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>使加剧，使恶化：</ins></strong>to make more violent, bitter, or <strong><ins>severe</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　a heavy rainfall that exacerbated the flood problems　大雨恶化了洪水问题<br /><strong>近</strong>　aggravate, complicate, worsen<br /><strong>反</strong>　allay, alleviate, assuage, mitigate, relieve, palliate　缓和<br />

exceptional	L09 U05	[ɪkˈsepʃənl][sound:exceptional.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】（ex-[out]+cept[take]+-ion[n.])+-al[a.], exception[n.例外]+-al[的]→a.例外的，特别的，非凡的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cap, capt, cept, cip, cup</strong>　这些词根都表示seize[抓]或take[拿]，有着相同的词源。它们的拼写区别在于元音字母的不同，以及词根末尾的t。下面是由它们组成的一些单词：<br />　　　（1）capacity[容量]就是amount one could take[cap], 即一个容器能“拿”多少；<br />　　　（2）capture[捕获]相当于seize[capt]；<br />　　　（3）except[除…外]字面含义“take[cept]...out[ex-]”;accept[接受]是指“to[ac-=ad-]take[cept]”；<br />　　　（4）participate[参与]相当于“take[cip]part (in)”；<br />　　　（5）occupy[占用；占领]字面含义“to take[cup]over[oc-=ob-]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　captious, captivate, inception, exceptional, unexceptionable, perceptible, perceptive, susceptibility, disciple, emancipate, incipient, principal, preoccupation, recuperate<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>例外的，特别的，非凡的：</ins></strong>being an exception; <strong><ins>uncommon</ins></strong>; <strong><ins>extraordinary</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　children with exceptional ability　能力非凡的孩子们<br /><strong>近</strong>　aberrant, abnormal, anomalous, exceeding, extraordinary, peculiar, unwonted<br /><strong>反</strong>　commonplace, prosaic, customary, normal, ordinary, typical, unextraordinary, usual　平凡常见的<br />

excursive	L09 U06	[ɪkˈskзːrsɪv][sound:excursive.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ex-[out]+curs[run]+-ive[a.], run out (of main subject)→a.离题的；（attention) run out, 心不在焉→a.散漫的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cur (s)</strong>　词根cur (s)表示run[跑]。occur[发生]就是指“（事件）跑[cur]过来[oc-=ob-, toward]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　concur, excursive, incursion, precursor, cursory, discursive<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>离题的；散漫的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>passing</ins></strong> from one topic to another<br /><strong>例</strong>　an excursive story line that some readers of Melville's novel find very rewarding　梅尔维尔小说的一些读者非常喜欢松散的故事主线<br /><strong>近</strong>　desultory, digressive, meandering, rambling, wandering<br />
execrate	L09 U06	[ˈeksɪkreɪt][sound:execrate.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ex-[out]+(s) ecr[sacr, sacred]+-ate[v.], 请神消灭→v.谴责；痛恨<br />　　　【联】execrate的后四个字母rate[v.责骂]，berate[v.痛骂]<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>sacr, sanct</strong>　词根sacr和sanct都表示“holy, sacred”[神的，神圣的]。sacrifice[n.牺牲]原指“为神[sacr]做[fic]的（牺牲）”，古代拜神时需要杀“牲口”（甚至是人）。saint[n.圣人a.神圣的]（音似“圣徒”）与词根sanct同源。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　sacrosanct, desecrate, execrate, sanction, sanctify, sanctimonious, sanctuary<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />v. <strong><ins>痛恨：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>dislike strongly</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　execrate the hideous side of religion　痛恨宗教丑恶的一面<br /><strong>近</strong>　abhor, abominate, despise, detest, loathe<br /><strong>反</strong>　love　爱<br />
exemplary	L09 U06	[ɪɡˈzempləri][sound:exemplary.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ex-[out]+emp[take]+l+-ary[a.], take out (as example):good example→a.榜样的，值得效仿的；bad example→a.作为警告的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>emp (t), sum (pt)</strong>　（1）词根emp (t)表示take[拿]，example[例子，形容词形式exemplary]就是“拿[amp=emp]出来[ex-]的东西[-le]”；preempt[预先占有]就是“预先[pre]拿下[empt]”。<br />　　　（2）词根sum (pt)来自“sub-+empt”的缩写，含义也是take[拿]，例如assume[假设，名词形式assumption]就是“去[as-=ad-]拿[sum]（未被证实的条件）”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　exemplary, exempt, peremptory, preempt, presumptuous, sumptuous<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>榜样的，值得效仿的：</ins></strong>constituting, serving as, or worthy of <strong><ins>being a pattern</ins></strong> to be <strong><ins>imitated</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　an exemplary innovation　榜样的创新<br /><strong>近</strong>　archetypal, imitable, paradigmatic, quintessential<br /><strong>派</strong>　exemplify vt．（通过榜样）示范，显示：to show or illustrate by example<br />

extenuate	L09 U08	[ɪkˈstenjueɪt][sound:extenuate.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ex-[out]+tenu[thin]+-ate[v.], make (seriousness) thin out→vt.减轻罪过<br />　　　【注】词组thin out表示“变薄”<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>tenu</strong>　词根tenu表示thin[薄]，可以理解成tend[伸展]之后的结果：当伸展一个物体（例如金属片）后，它的厚度会变薄。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　tenuous, attenuate, extenuate<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>减轻罪过：</ins></strong>to lessen or to try to <strong><ins>lessen the seriousness</ins></strong> or extent of by making partial excuses<br /><strong>例</strong>　Try to extenuate their vandalism with the old refrain of“Boys will be boys.”企图用“江山易改本性难移”的俗语为他们的暴行开脱。<br /><strong>近</strong>　deodorize, excuse, explain away, gloss over, gloze over<br />

extinguish	L09 U09	[ɪkˈstɪŋɡwɪʃ][sound:extinguish.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ex-[out]+(s) ting[刺]+u+-ish[v.], “刺，使out (offire)”, 刺灭（火焰）→vt.熄灭；终止<br />　　　【派】形容词extinct[a.灭绝的]<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>sti, sti (n) g</strong>　单词stick[刺；坚持]也有“钉”的含义（钉需要刺过物体，被钉的物体不容易变化位置）。很多由sti开头的单词（或词根）从词源（或可以联想成）与“钉、刺”有关。例如：sting[刺，刺痛；叮咬；讽刺]，以及与sting同源的词根stig, stinct。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　distinctive, extinguish, instigate, prestige, stickler, stiff, stifle, stigma, stingy, stipple, stipulate, stitch<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>熄灭：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>put out</ins></strong> (a fire, for example); quench<br /><strong>例</strong>　The fire in the skillet was quickly extinguished by slamming the lid on．盖上锅盖后，平底锅的火苗很快熄灭了。<br /><strong>近</strong>　blanket, douse, quench, put out, snuff out<br /><strong>反</strong>　ignite, rekindle　点燃<br />

feckless	L10 U02	[ˈfekləs][sound:feckless.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】feck[fect, do]+-less[a.少的]，做的（行动）少→a.粗心不负责任的；做（出）的effect少→a.无成果的，没有价值的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>fac (t), fect, feit</strong>　词根fac (t）以及同源词根fect, feit表示“做[do, make]”。例如factory[工厂]就是“做、制造[fact]（东西）的地方[-ory]”。effect指“做[fect]出[ef-=ex-]的结果”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　facilitate, faction, affectation, disaffected, disinfect, feckless, counterfeit, surfeit, forfeit<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>无成果的，没有价值的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>having no</ins></strong> real <strong><ins>worth</ins></strong> or purpose<br /><strong>例</strong>　years of feckless negotiations　长达数年的毫无成果的谈判<br /><strong>近</strong>　bootless, fruitless, futile, meaningless, purposeless, useless, worthless<br /><strong>反</strong>　effective, effectual, efficacious　有成效的<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>粗心不负责任的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>careless</ins></strong> and irresponsible<br /><strong>例</strong>　a feckless young man　一个极不负责的年轻人<br /><strong>近</strong>　careless, heedless, inadvertent, irresponsible, slipshod, sloppy<br /><strong>反</strong>　careful, cautious, circumspect, discreet, wary　谨慎小心的<br />

fluent	L10 U06	[ˈfluːənt][sound:fluent.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】flu[flow]+-ent[a.], offlow, （说话）如流水般→a.表达流利的；（做某件事）如行云流水般→a.不费力的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>flu</strong>　词根flu表示flow[流动]。作为单词，flu表示“流感”。influence[影响]字面含义“流[flu]入[in-]”，如果某想法“流入”一个人，就会对他产生影响。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　affluent, confluence, effluvium, fluctuate, fluent, influx, superfluous, mellifluous, flush<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>表达流利的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>able to express</ins></strong> oneself clearly and <strong><ins>well</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　a fluent speaker　表达清楚的演说家<br /><strong>近</strong>　eloquent, silver-tongued, well-spoken<br /><strong>反</strong>　inarticulate, ineloquent, unvocal　说话不清楚的<br /><strong>派</strong>　fluency n．流畅，流利<br />

flush	L10 U06	[flʌʃ][sound:flush.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】来自词根flu, （水）流→vi.冲洗；（像水一样源源不断地）流动→a.大量的；引申→a.富有的；（血液的）流动→a.（肤色）健康红润的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>flu</strong>　词根flu表示flow[流动]。作为单词，flu表示“流感”。influence[影响]字面含义“流[flu]入[in-]”，如果某想法“流入”一个人，就会对他产生影响。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　affluent, confluence, effluvium, fluctuate, fluent, influx, superfluous, mellifluous, flush<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>大量的：</ins></strong>marked by <strong><ins>abundance</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　a field flush with flowers　长满了鲜花的原野<br /><strong>近</strong>　abounding, abundant, awash, fraught, lousy, replete, swarming, teeming, thronging<br /><strong>反</strong>　inadequate, insufficient, scant, scarce, short　匮乏的，不足的<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />vi. <strong><ins>冲洗：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>pour liquid</ins></strong> over or through in order to cleanse<br /><strong>例</strong>　flush a wound with iodine　用碘酒冲洗伤口<br /><strong>近</strong>　irrigate, rinse, sluice, wash<br />
