grandeur	L11 U06	[ˈɡrændʒər][sound:grandeur.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】grand[grand, great]+-eur[n.], grand, great→n.宏伟，壮丽<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>grand</strong>　词根grand表示“great, large”[大]，作为单词grand表示“宏伟的；重要的”。grandiloquent指“说[loqu]大[grand]话”，（语言）浮夸的。grandmother[n.祖母]中的grand指“年龄上的大”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　aggrandize, grandeur, grandiose<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>宏伟，壮丽：</ins></strong>the quality or condition of being <strong><ins>grand</ins></strong>; magnificence<br /><strong>例</strong>　the glory that was Greece and the grandeur that was Rome　希腊的荣耀和罗马的辉煌<br /><strong>近</strong>　magnificence, augustness, brilliance, glory, majesty, nobility, resplendence, splendor<br /><strong>反</strong>　frivolousness　无关紧要<br /><strong>派</strong>　grand adj．宏伟壮观的<br />
grandiloquent	L11 U06	[ɡrænˈdɪləkwənt][sound:grandiloquent.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】grand[big]+i[连字符，无义]+loqu[speak]+-ent[a.], speak...(unrealistically) big, 夸大的→a.（语言等）浮夸的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>log</strong>　词根log表示speak[说]。例如dialogue[对话]字面义speak[log=speak]across[dia-=across]，形象一点说就是“话语在（人）之间穿梭”。作名词讲时，log表示“记录的话”，引申为“文字、作品”。log还有“学说”的含义，-logy是表示学科的后缀。此外，log有两个由尾辅音音变产生的同义词根loqu和locu。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　eulogize, monologue, prologue, grandiloquent, loquacious, obloquy, soliloquy, terminology, circumlocution<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>（语言等）浮夸的：</ins></strong>a lofty, <strong><ins>extravagantly</ins></strong> colorful, pompous, or <strong><ins>bombastic</ins></strong> style, manner, or quality especially in language<br /><strong>例</strong>　feel disgusted with his grandiloquent speech　对他浮夸的演讲表示厌恶<br /><strong>近</strong>　rhetorical, bombastic, inflated, magniloquent, pretentious<br /><strong>反</strong>　secretive　低调的，隐秘的；simple　简单的<br /><strong>派</strong>　grandiloquence n．夸张的话语<br />
grandiose	L11 U06	[ˈɡrændioʊs][sound:grandiose.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】grand[grand, great]+-(i) ose[a.], grand→a.宏大的；自认为grand→a.自命不凡的，浮夸的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>grand</strong>　词根grand表示“great, large”[大]，作为单词grand表示“宏伟的；重要的”。grandiloquent指“说[loqu]大[grand]话”，（语言）浮夸的。grandmother[n.祖母]中的grand指“年龄上的大”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　aggrandize, grandeur, grandiose<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>自命不凡的，浮夸的：</ins></strong>characterized by feigned or affected <strong><ins>grandeur</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　grandiose words　自命不凡的话语<br /><strong>近</strong>　extravagant, flamboyant, pompous, pretentious<br /><strong>反</strong>　humble　谦逊的<br />

gratify	L11 U06	[ˈɡrætɪfaɪ][sound:gratify.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】grat[pleased]+-ify[v.], make...pleased→vt.使满足<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>grat</strong>　词根grat表示“高兴[pleased];感激[grateful]”。gratuity指“由于高兴或感激而送给别人”的“赠物”，尤其指送给服务生的“小费”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　ingratiating, gratify, gratuitous<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>使满足：</ins></strong>to give what is <strong><ins>desired</ins></strong> to, to <strong><ins>please</ins></strong> or satisfy<br /><strong>例</strong>　gratify her curiosity　满足她的好奇心<br />　　Her praise will gratify all who worked so hard to earn it．她的表扬会使所有辛勤工作的人们高兴。<br /><strong>近</strong>　appease, cater, content, satisfy<br /><strong>反</strong>　displease　使不满；grieve　使悲痛<br /><strong>派</strong>　gratification n．满意<br />

heterodox	L12 U03	[ˈhetərədɑːks][sound:heterodox.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】hetero-[other]+dox[opinion], of other opinion→a.异端的，非正统的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>doc (t), dox</strong>　（1）词根doc (t)表示teach[教]。例如，doctor[博士]可看做“受过最高等教育[doct]的人[-or]”；document[文件]最初指“sth.[-ment]thatteaches[doc](the reader)”；doctrine[教条]也来自词根doct, 可以看成“doct[教]line[条]”。<br />　　　（2）词根dox表示opinion[思想]，与词根doc有一定联系，“教育”传递和塑造“思想”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　doctrinaire, indoctrinate, heterodox, orthodox, paradox<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>非正统的，异端的：</ins></strong>holding <strong><ins>unorthodox opinions</ins></strong> or doctrines, not rigidly following established form, custom, or rules<br /><strong>例</strong>　Her heterodox approach to teaching science initially met with some resistance from her peers．她对于教学的一些非正统方法最开始受到了同辈的抵触。<br /><strong>近</strong>　dissenting, out-there, unconventional, unorthodox<br /><strong>反</strong>　conforming, conventional, orthodox, regular, routine　正常的，正统的<br />

impending	L12 U08	[ɪmˈpendɪŋ]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】im-[in-, in]+pend[hang]+-ing[a.], 处于悬挂的状态（摇摇欲坠）→a.即将发生的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>pend, pens</strong>　词根pend（其他形式pens）表示hang[挂，悬挂]。depend[v.依赖，依靠]字面含义“挂在[pend]下面[de-]”，引申出“挂靠、附属于（某机构）”的含义；independent表示“不[in-]挂在[pend]任何事物下面[de-]的[-ent]”，独立的。pending[紧迫的，即将发生的]来自词根pend的引申义，表示“（某事件）处于悬挂状态”，即还没有发生，但（随时）可能“掉下来，发生”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　compendium, dependable, indispensable, impending, propensity, suspend, pensive<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>即将发生的：</ins></strong>being <strong><ins>soon to</ins></strong> appear or <strong><ins>take place</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　an impending celebration　即将来临的庆祝<br /><strong>近</strong>　approaching, coming, imminent, nearing, pending, proximate, upcoming, around the corner<br /><strong>反</strong>　late, recent　最近发生的；distant, remote　遥远的<br />

impertinent	L12 U09	[ɪmˈpзːrtnənt][sound:impertinent.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】im-[not]+pertinent[相关的；恰当的]，不相关的→a.无关紧要的；（为人处世）不恰当的→a.粗鲁无礼的，大胆的；不守礼节的，不为他人着想的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>tain, tin, ten (t)</strong>　词根tain, 以及变形tent, tin和ten都表示hold。contain[包含]（字面义hold...together[con-]）和attain[获得]（字面义to[at-=ad-]hold）都来自词根tain[hold]。continent[大陆]（字面义holdtogether）就是“连在一起（的土地）”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　abstain, detain, pertain, retainer, content, malcontentn, countenance, retentive, tenable, untenable, tenacious, pertinent, impertinent, pertinacious, retinue<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>无关紧要的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>not having</ins></strong> a clear decisive <strong><ins>relevance</ins></strong> to the matter in hand<br /><strong>例</strong>　Your résumé needlessly lists extracurricular experiences that are impertinent to the PhD program for which you are applying．你的简历里列出的一些课外活动和你申请的博士项目是毫不相关的。<br /><strong>近</strong>　extraneous, immaterial, inapplicable, inapposite, irrelevant<br /><strong>反</strong>　germane, pertinent, relevant　相关的；crucial, important, significant　重要的<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>粗鲁无礼的，大胆的：</ins></strong>given to or characterized by <strong><ins>insolent rudeness</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　I don't like strangers who ask impertinent questions．我很讨厌那些问无礼问题的陌生人。<br /><strong>近</strong>　audacious, bold, brash, brassbound, brassy, brazen, impudent, insolent<br /><strong>反</strong>　meek, mousy, retiring, shy, timid　内敛的，胆小的<br />

imposing	L12 U10	[ɪmˈpoʊzɪŋ][sound:imposing.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】im[in-, in]+pos[put]+-ing[a.], put in (sight), （容易被）放到视线中的→a.宏伟壮丽的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>pos (t)</strong>　词根pos表示put[放]，同源词根还有post。expose[揭露]就是“（把隐藏的东西）放到[pos]外面[ex-]”;poster[海报]指“放[post]在外面起宣传作用的东西[-er]”。另外, suppose[假设]指“（将未证实的结论）放在[pos]下面[sup-=sub-]（作为研究和讨论的基础）”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　apposite, apropos, compose, depose, deposit, discompose, imposing, poseur, posit, superimpose, supposition, repose, impostor, postulate, posture<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>宏伟壮丽的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>impressive</ins></strong> in size, bearing, dignity, or grandeur<br /><strong>例</strong>　The corporation's imposing headquarters were designed by one of the nation's cutting-edge architects．这家公司宏伟壮丽的总部是由该国最优秀的建筑师之一设计的。<br /><strong>近</strong>　august, epic, glorious, grand, imperial, magnificent, monumental, noble, splendid<br /><strong>反</strong>　common, humble, inferior, low　低下的，平凡的<br />
impostor	L12 U10	[ɪmˈpɑːstər]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】im-[in]+post[put]+-or[n.人], put in (other's position)，到其他人的位置上（就职）的人→n.冒充者<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>pos (t)</strong>　词根pos表示put[放]，同源词根还有post。expose[揭露]就是“（把隐藏的东西）放到[pos]外面[ex-]”;poster[海报]指“放[post]在外面起宣传作用的东西[-er]”。另外, suppose[假设]指“（将未证实的结论）放在[pos]下面[sup-=sub-]（作为研究和讨论的基础）”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　apposite, apropos, compose, depose, deposit, discompose, imposing, poseur, posit, superimpose, supposition, repose, impostor, postulate, posture<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>冒充者，骗子：</ins></strong>one that <strong><ins>assumes false identity</ins></strong> or title for the purpose of deception<br /><strong>例</strong>　an unforgivable impostor　一个不可原谅的冒充者<br /><strong>近</strong>　charlatan, fake, fraud, hoaxer, mountebank, phony, pretender, quack, sham<br />

incantation	L13 U01	[ˌɪnkænˈteɪʃn][sound:incantation.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】in-[in]+cant[sing]+-ation[n.], （魔女）进入唱的状态→n.咒语<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cant</strong>　词根cant表示sing[唱]。单词chant[v.唱 n.颂歌]是词根cant的变形；读音联想“唱它”。此外，词根cant由“唱”引申出以下两层含义：<br />　　　（1）“带腔调地说”。例如accent[n.口音；重音]，其中词根cant的元音a变为e。<br />　　　（2）“吸引人的咒语”。（传说海上有一个巫女，当看到有过往的船只时就会唱出令人陶醉的歌声（即咒语）令船员忘却一切，最终导致船永远停止航行。）<br /><strong>同根</strong>　incantation, recant, disenchant, incentive<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>咒语：</ins></strong>a spoken word or set of words believed to have <strong><ins>magic power</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　Hovering over the sick child, the witch doctor muttered mysterious incantations．巫医在生病的小孩子身边走来走去，嘴里念着神秘的咒语。<br /><strong>近</strong>　abracadabra, bewitchment, charm, conjuration, enchantment, glamour, hex, invocation<br />

inception	L13 U02	[ɪnˈsepʃn][sound:inception.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】in-[in]+cept[take]+-ion[n.], take (hand) in, 入手→n.开端，开始<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cap, capt, cept, cip, cup</strong>　这些词根都表示seize[抓]或take[拿]，有着相同的词源。它们的拼写区别在于元音字母的不同，以及词根末尾的t。下面是由它们组成的一些单词：<br />　　　（1）capacity[容量]就是amount one could take[cap], 即一个容器能“拿”多少；<br />　　　（2）capture[捕获]相当于seize[capt]；<br />　　　（3）except[除…外]字面含义“take[cept]...out[ex-]”;accept[接受]是指“to[ac-=ad-]take[cept]”；<br />　　　（4）participate[参与]相当于“take[cip]part (in)”；<br />　　　（5）occupy[占用；占领]字面含义“to take[cup]over[oc-=ob-]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　captious, captivate, inception, exceptional, unexceptionable, perceptible, perceptive, susceptibility, disciple, emancipate, incipient, principal, preoccupation, recuperate<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>开端，开始：</ins></strong>an act, process, or instance of <strong><ins>beginning</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　This seemed like a good program at its inception, but it isn't working out as planned．一开始这像是个不错的项目，但是它没有按照我们的预期发展。<br /><strong>近</strong>　beginning, birth, commencement, dawn, genesis, kickoff, launch, nascence, onset, outset, start, threshold<br /><strong>反</strong>　close, conclusion, end, termination, omega　结束，终止<br /><strong>派</strong>　inceptive adj．开端的，初生的<br />

incipient	L13 U02	[ɪnˈsɪpiənt][sound:incipient.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】in-[in]+cip[take]+-ient[a.], take (hand) in, 入手→a.起初的，初现的<br />　　　【派】inception[n.开端，开始]<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cap, capt, cept, cip, cup</strong>　这些词根都表示seize[抓]或take[拿]，有着相同的词源。它们的拼写区别在于元音字母的不同，以及词根末尾的t。下面是由它们组成的一些单词：<br />　　　（1）capacity[容量]就是amount one could take[cap], 即一个容器能“拿”多少；<br />　　　（2）capture[捕获]相当于seize[capt]；<br />　　　（3）except[除…外]字面含义“take[cept]...out[ex-]”;accept[接受]是指“to[ac-=ad-]take[cept]”；<br />　　　（4）participate[参与]相当于“take[cip]part (in)”；<br />　　　（5）occupy[占用；占领]字面含义“to take[cup]over[oc-=ob-]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　captious, captivate, inception, exceptional, unexceptionable, perceptible, perceptive, susceptibility, disciple, emancipate, incipient, principal, preoccupation, recuperate<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>起初的，初现的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>beginning to come into being</ins></strong> or to become apparent<br /><strong>例</strong>　an incipient economic recovery　刚刚出现的经济复苏<br /><strong>近</strong>　aborning, beginning, inceptive, inchoate, initial, nascent<br /><strong>反</strong>　adult, full-blown, full-fledged, mature, ripe　成熟的，成型的；moribund　将死的<br />

incubate	L13 U03	[ˈɪŋkjubeɪt][sound:incubate.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】in-[on]+cub[lie]+-ate[v.], (hens) lie on (eggs) →vt.孵化；引申→vt.帮助，培养，促进<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cu (m) b</strong>　（1）词根cu (m) b表示lie[躺；位于]。cubicle[小卧室]中的词根cub指“躺下睡觉”，-cle是表示“小”的名词后缀。（另一方面，cubicle可以看做“小[-（c) le]立方体[cube, 形容词形式cubic]”, 从轮廓上描述了“小卧室”。）<br />　　　（2）cumber[n.＆v.阻碍]可以理解成“躺[cumb]（在路上）（的东西[-er]）”, 像绊脚石那样阻碍前进。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　incubate, incumbent, recumbent, succumb, cumbersome, encumber<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>孵化：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>cover and warm eggs</ins></strong> as the young inside develop<br /><strong>例</strong>　The hen incubated her eggs for two weeks．母鸡孵蛋两周。<br /><strong>近</strong>　brood, hatch, sit<br /><strong>派</strong>　incubator n．恒温箱；incubation n．孵化，孵卵<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>帮助，培养，促进：</ins></strong>to cause or <strong><ins>aid</ins></strong> the development of<br /><strong>例</strong>　Hopefully, these youthful visits to the museum will incubate an enduring love of art．我们希望年轻时参观博物馆能够培养人们对于艺术的持久热爱。<br /><strong>近</strong>　advance, cultivate, encourage, forward, further, nourish, nurse, nurture, promote<br /><strong>反</strong>　check, discourage, frustrate, hinder, impede, inhibit, obstruct, retard, shackle　妨碍，阻碍<br />

indispensable	L13 U04	[ˌɪndɪˈspensəbl][sound:indispensable.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】in-[not]+dis-[away]+pens[hang]+-able[a.], not able to hang away, 不能挂在一边而不理会的→a.必不可少的，不可或缺的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>pend, pens</strong>　词根pend（其他形式pens）表示hang[挂，悬挂]。depend[v.依赖，依靠]字面含义“挂在[pend]下面[de-]”，引申出“挂靠、附属于（某机构）”的含义；independent表示“不[in-]挂在[pend]任何事物下面[de-]的[-ent]”，独立的。pending[紧迫的，即将发生的]来自词根pend的引申义，表示“（某事件）处于悬挂状态”，即还没有发生，但（随时）可能“掉下来，发生”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　compendium, dependable, indispensable, impending, propensity, suspend, pensive<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>必不可少的，不可或缺的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>impossible to do without</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　indispensable resources　必不可少的资源<br />　　3K is indispensable to GRE preparation　3千对GRE备考必不可少<br /><strong>近</strong>　critical, crucial, imperative, necessary, necessitous, needed, required, requisite, vital<br /><strong>反</strong>　dispensable　可替代的；redundant, superfluous, surplus　多余的<br />
indoctrinate	L13 U04	[ɪnˈdɑːktrɪneɪt][sound:indoctrinate.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】in-[in]+doctrin (e) [doctrine]+-ate[v.], make sb. (believe) in (certain) doctrine→vt.灌输思想，教育<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>doc (t), dox</strong>　（1）词根doc (t)表示teach[教]。例如，doctor[博士]可看做“受过最高等教育[doct]的人[-or]”；document[文件]最初指“sth.[-ment]thatteaches[doc](the reader)”；doctrine[教条]也来自词根doct, 可以看成“doct[教]line[条]”。<br />　　　（2）词根dox表示opinion[思想]，与词根doc有一定联系，“教育”传递和塑造“思想”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　doctrinaire, indoctrinate, heterodox, orthodox, paradox<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>教育，灌输思想：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>instruct</ins></strong> especially in fundamentals or rudiments<br /><strong>例</strong>　indoctrinate students with the notion of egalitarianism　向学生灌输平等主义的思想<br /><strong>近</strong>　educate, instruct, lesson, teach, train, tutor<br /><strong>反</strong>　learn, study　学习<br />

infuse	L13 U06	[ɪnˈfjuːz][sound:infuse.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】in-[in]+fus[pour]+-e[v.], pour in, 注入→vt.灌输，使…充满；pour (courage) in→vt.鼓舞<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>fus</strong>　词根fus表示pour[倒，流，倾泻]。confuse[使混乱；使困惑]指“（将…）倒[fus]在一起[con-]”, 增加混乱的程度；refuse[拒绝]的字面含义是“倒[fus]回[re-]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　diffuse, effusive, infuse, profuse, suffuse<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>灌输，使…充满：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>fill</ins></strong> or cause to be filled with something<br /><strong>例</strong>　New members infused enthusiasm into the club．新成员为俱乐部注入了激情。<br /><strong>近</strong>　endue, imbue, implant, ingrain, instill, permeate, suffuse, steep<br /><strong>反</strong>　extract　提取<br /><strong>派</strong>　infusion n．注入<br />
ingenious	L13 U06	[ɪnˈdʒiːniəs][sound:ingenious.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】in-[in]+gen[generate]+-(i) ous[a.], 头脑中可以产生idea→a.聪明的，有创造才能的<br />　　　【派】ingenuity[n.独创性，创新性]<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>gen</strong>　词根gen表示“generate[产生；生育], create, bear”。gene[n.基因]就来自该词根。gentle[a.温和的，文雅的，有教养的]原指“生在[gen]（一个好的家庭）”的绅士[gentleman], 他们往往表现出有教养，性格上温和文雅。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　engender, indigenous, ingenious, ingenuous, homogenize, regenerate, genial, genteel, benign, malign, pregnant<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>聪明的，有创造才能的：</ins></strong>marked by originality, <strong><ins>resourcefulness</ins></strong>, and <strong><ins>cleverness</ins></strong> in conception or execution<br /><strong>例</strong>　Ingenious designers soon came up with a solution to the battery problem．聪明的设计者们很快便提出了电池问题的解决方案。<br /><strong>近</strong>　artful, clever, imaginative, innovative, inventive, original<br /><strong>反</strong>　awkward　笨拙的；uncreative, unimaginative　无创造力或想象力的<br /><strong>派</strong>　ingenuity n．独创性，创新性<br />
ingenuous	L13 U07	[ɪnˈdʒenjuəs][sound:ingenuous.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】in-[in]+gen[generate]+-(u) ous[a.], 处于新生状态的→a.天真纯朴的；坦白的<br />　　　【注】注意区分ingenuous[天真纯朴的；坦白的]（参genuine[诚恳的；真实的]）与ingenious[聪明的]（参genius[天才]）<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>gen</strong>　词根gen表示“generate[产生；生育], create, bear”。gene[n.基因]就来自该词根。gentle[a.温和的，文雅的，有教养的]原指“生在[gen]（一个好的家庭）”的绅士[gentleman], 他们往往表现出有教养，性格上温和文雅。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　engender, indigenous, ingenious, ingenuous, homogenize, regenerate, genial, genteel, benign, malign, pregnant<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>天真淳朴的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>lacking</ins></strong> in <strong><ins>cunning</ins></strong>, guile, or worldliness<br /><strong>例</strong>　Photographs captured the ingenuous smiles of young children at play．摄影家捕捉到了演出中孩子们天真无邪的笑脸。<br /><strong>近</strong>　artless, innocent, guileless, naïve, simple, unaffected, unpretending, unsophisticated<br /><strong>反</strong>　artful, cunning, sly　狡猾的；assuming, hypocritical　虚伪做作的；sophisticated, worldly　世故的，老练的<br />

instigate	L13 U09	[ˈɪnstɪɡeɪt][sound:instigate.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】in-[in]+stig[stick]+-ate[v.], 向里面刺→vt.煽动，激起<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>sti, sti (n) g</strong>　单词stick[刺；坚持]也有“钉”的含义（钉需要刺过物体，被钉的物体不容易变化位置）。很多由sti开头的单词（或词根）从词源（或可以联想成）与“钉、刺”有关。例如：sting[刺，刺痛；叮咬；讽刺]，以及与sting同源的词根stig, stinct。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　distinctive, extinguish, instigate, prestige, stickler, stiff, stifle, stigma, stingy, stipple, stipulate, stitch<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>煽动，激起：</ins></strong>to goad or <strong><ins>urge forward</ins></strong>; to <strong><ins>stir up</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　instigate his flame　激起他的热情<br /><strong>近</strong>　abet, arouse, excite, foment, goad, incite, inflame, provoke, stir<br /><strong>反</strong>　assuage, allay, mitigate, mollify, pacify, soothe　平息，缓和<br /><strong>派</strong>　instigation n．煽动<br />

intensify	L13 U10	[ɪnˈtensɪfaɪ][sound:intensify.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】intens[intense]+-ify[v.to make], to make...intense→vt.加强，激化<br />　　　【注】intense[强烈的；紧张的]：一根绳子“处于[in-=in]拉伸[tens=stretch]的状态”就是“绷紧的”，一个人处于这种状态就是“紧张的”，即对外界事物有“强烈的”反应。<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>tend, tens, tent</strong>　词根tend表示stretch[伸出，伸展]，例如extend[拓展]就是“向外[ex-]伸展[tend]”;tend作为单词有“趋向”的含义，即“（向某方向）伸展”。词根tend有两个常见的变体tens和tent。extension[拓展，伸展]是extend的名词形式；extent[程度]就是“向外伸展”的多少。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　tendentious, contend, contentious, distend, intensify, pretense, unpretentious, ostensible, ostentatious, portentous<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>加强，激化：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>make intense</ins></strong> or more intensive<br /><strong>例</strong>　Both companies intensified their efforts to win the contract．为了获得这份合同，两家公司都加大了投入。<br /><strong>近</strong>　accentuate, aggravate, amplify, deepen, enhance, magnify, redouble, strengthen<br /><strong>反</strong>　abate, assuage, attenuate, mitigate, moderate　减缓，降低（程度）<br /><strong>派</strong>　intensity n．强度<br />

intermittent	L14 U01	[ˌɪntərˈmɪtənt][sound:intermittent.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】inter-[between]+mit[send]+-(t) ent[a.], send between, interrupt→a.间歇的，断断续续的；不定期的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>mis (s), mit</strong>　词根mis (s）和mit表示send[发送]。emit[发出]字面含义“send[mit]out[e-]”。missile[导弹]指“可以[-ile]发射[miss]”的东西。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　manumit, submissive, surmise, commitment, committed, intermittent, remiss, unremitting, compromise<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>断断续续的：</ins></strong>coming and going at intervals, <strong><ins>not continuous</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　intermittent rain in June　六月里断断续续的梅雨<br /><strong>近</strong>　episodic, erratic, occasional, periodical, recurrent, recurring<br /><strong>反</strong>　constant, continuous, incessant, unceasing　持续不断的<br />
interregnum	L14 U01	[ˌɪntəˈreɡnəm][sound:interregnum.mp3]<br />			<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>过渡期：</ins></strong><strong><ins>break</ins></strong> in continuity<br /><strong>例</strong>　The democratic regime proved to be a short-lived interregnum between dictatorships．这个民主政权被证明只不过是两个独裁政权之间的短暂过渡罢了。<br /><strong>近</strong>　breach, break, gap, interim, interruption, interval, interlude, parenthesis<br /><strong>反</strong>　continuation, continuity　持续<br />
interrogate	L14 U01	[ɪnˈterəɡeɪt][sound:interrogate.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】inter-[between]+rog[ask]+-ate[v.], interac－tively (andformally) ask→vt.质问，审问<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>rog</strong>　词根rog的含义相当于ask[命令，要求，问]，可以通过与词根log的拼写相似性进行记忆。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　abrogate, arrogance, interrogate, prerogative, surrogate<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>质问，审问：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>question formally</ins></strong> and systematically<br /><strong>例</strong>　interrogate the prisoner of war for valuable intelligence　审问战俘以获取有价值的情报<br /><strong>近</strong>　ask, grill, inquire, milk, question<br /><strong>反</strong>　answer, reply, respond　回答，回复<br /><strong>派</strong>　interrogation n．审讯<br />

invidious	L14 U02	[ɪnˈvɪdiəs][sound:invidious.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】in-[in, upon]+vid[see]+-ious[a.], （过于）看（别人）的→（把人惹毛了）a.惹人反感的；羡慕嫉妒恨的<br />　　　【注】invidious与envy[n.＆v.嫉妒]是同源词。envy中的en-相当于in-，vy相当于vid<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>vis, vid</strong>　词根vis和vid表示see[看]。visible[可见的]字面含义“able[-ible]to see[vis]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　improvise, provisional, provisory, revise, visionary, invidious, provident, providential, wit, unwitting<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>惹人反感的：</ins></strong>tending to <strong><ins>cause discontent</ins></strong>, animosity, or envy<br /><strong>例</strong>　the invidious task of arbitration　令人反感的仲裁任务<br /><strong>近</strong>　abhorrent, detestable, obnoxious, odious, repugnant, repellent<br /><strong>反</strong>　agreeable, gratifying, pleasant　令人高兴的<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>羡慕嫉妒恨的：</ins></strong>having or showing mean <strong><ins>resentment of another's possessions</ins></strong> or advantages<br /><strong>例</strong>　Inevitably, his remarkable success attracted the invidious attention of the other sales representatives．不可避免地，他的巨大成功引来了其他销售代表羡慕嫉妒恨的眼光。<br /><strong>近</strong>　covetous, envious, jaundiced, jealous, resentful, green-eyed<br />

invoke	L14 U03	[ɪnˈvoʊk][sound:invoke.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】in-[in, into]+voke[call], call (plan) in→vt.实施；call into (situation）→vt.产生，造成<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>voc, vok</strong>　词根voc, vok对应于英文单词call[呼唤]。作名词时有时相当于同源词voice[声音]。vocabulary[words, 词汇]也是由词根voc构成的。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　advocate, equivocate, vociferous, vocation, convoke, evoke, invoke, provoke, revoke<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>实施：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>put into effect</ins></strong> or operation<br /><strong>例</strong>　New train timetable has been invoked．新的火车时刻表已经生效。<br /><strong>近</strong>　enforce, effect, execute, implement, perform<br /><strong>反</strong>　suspend　暂停，搁置<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>产生，造成：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>be the cause</ins></strong> of (a situation, action, or state of mind)<br /><strong>例</strong>　We should be prepared for the possibility that any solution may invoke another set of problems．我们必须要为这样一种可能做好心理准备：任何解决方案都可能带来一系列新的问题。<br /><strong>近</strong>　beget, bring, catalyze, cause, create, engender, generate, induce, produce, result<br />

loquacious	L15 U02	[ləˈkweɪʃəs][sound:loquacious.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】loqu[speak]+-acious[much], speak (too) much→a.话多的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>log</strong>　词根log表示speak[说]。例如dialogue[对话]字面义speak[log=speak]across[dia-=across]，形象一点说就是“话语在（人）之间穿梭”。作名词讲时，log表示“记录的话”，引申为“文字、作品”。log还有“学说”的含义，-logy是表示学科的后缀。此外，log有两个由尾辅音音变产生的同义词根loqu和locu。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　eulogize, monologue, prologue, grandiloquent, loquacious, obloquy, soliloquy, terminology, circumlocution<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>话多的：</ins></strong>given to fluent or <strong><ins>excessive talk</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　Sometimes the loquacious talk show host barely lets her guests get a word in．有时候多话的脱口秀主持人让她的嘉宾一句话都插不进来。<br /><strong>近</strong>　chatty, conservational, gabby, garrulous, talkative, voluble<br /><strong>反</strong>　laconic, reserved, reticent, taciturn, uncommunicative　话少的<br /><strong>派</strong>　loquaciousness, loquacity n．话多<br />

malign	L15 U05	[məˈlaɪn][sound:malign.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】mal[bad]+i+gn[gen, generate], “generate bad”, 心生恶意→a.恶意的vt.诽谤<br />　　　【派】malignant[a.恶毒的，邪恶的]<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>gen</strong>　词根gen表示“generate[产生；生育], create, bear”。gene[n.基因]就来自该词根。gentle[a.温和的，文雅的，有教养的]原指“生在[gen]（一个好的家庭）”的绅士[gentleman], 他们往往表现出有教养，性格上温和文雅。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　engender, indigenous, ingenious, ingenuous, homogenize, regenerate, genial, genteel, benign, malign, pregnant<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>恶意的：</ins></strong>having or showing a desire to <strong><ins>cause</ins></strong> someone pain or <strong><ins>suffering</ins></strong> for the sheer enjoyment of it<br /><strong>例</strong>　Both parties to the divorce showed a malign desire to make each other's future life utterly miserable．离婚双方都表露出了恶毒的愿望，希望对方未来的生活陷入彻底的悲剧之中。<br /><strong>近</strong>　bad, cruel, despiteful, evil, malevolent, malicious, mean, nasty, spiteful, vicious, virulent, wicked<br /><strong>反</strong>　benevolent, benign, benignant, charitable, kind, kindly　善良的，仁慈的<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>诽谤：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>utter injuriously</ins></strong> misleading or false reports about: speak evil of<br /><strong>例</strong>　the belief that it is possible to win an election without maligning anyone　一种信念，那就是不需要诽谤他人而赢得选举是可能的<br /><strong>近</strong>　asperse, blacken, calumniate, defame, libel, smear, traduce, vilify<br /><strong>反</strong>　acclaim, applaud, eulogize, extol, laud, praise　赞美；defend, vindicate　辩护<br />

menace	L15 U08	[ˈmenəs][sound:menace.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【联】拿出“突出的小尖[men=min], （像A[ace]一样的匕首）”→vt.威胁，使处于危险<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>min</strong>　词根min有“small[小]”和“jut[突出]”两层含义，合起来可以看做“突出的小尖”。<br />　　　（1）词根min的一个常见含义表示“小”，例如“迷你”就来源于mini的音译；minister[大臣]原指（相对于国王来讲的）“小[min (i）]人[-ster]、手下”；<br />　　　（2）词根min的另外一个含义是“突出”，这层含义与（1）的联系是“突出的尖端”很小。mountain[山]（看做与词根min元音替换）相对于地球来讲，就是“突出的（小尖）”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　diminish, eminent, menace, menial, minatory, mince, minimize, miniscule, minute, preeminent<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>威胁，使处于危险：</ins></strong>to make a show of <strong><ins>intention to harm</ins></strong>; to place in danger<br /><strong>例</strong>　Stockpiles of nuclear weapons continue to menace the inhabitants of this planet．大量的核武器继续威胁着这个行星上的居民。<br /><strong>近</strong>　compromise, hazard, imperil, jeopardize, peril, risk, threaten<br /><strong>反</strong>　rescue, save　救出<br /><strong>派</strong>　menacing adj．具有威胁性的<br />

minatory	L15 U10	[ˈmɪnətɔːri][sound:minatory.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【记】minat[menace]+-ory[a.], 威胁的，危险的→a.带来威胁的，有凶兆的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>min</strong>　词根min有“small[小]”和“jut[突出]”两层含义，合起来可以看做“突出的小尖”。<br />　　　（1）词根min的一个常见含义表示“小”，例如“迷你”就来源于mini的音译；minister[大臣]原指（相对于国王来讲的）“小[min (i）]人[-ster]、手下”；<br />　　　（2）词根min的另外一个含义是“突出”，这层含义与（1）的联系是“突出的尖端”很小。mountain[山]（看做与词根min元音替换）相对于地球来讲，就是“突出的（小尖）”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　diminish, eminent, menace, menial, minatory, mince, minimize, miniscule, minute, preeminent<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>带来威胁的，有凶兆的：</ins></strong>being or showing <strong><ins>a sign of evil</ins></strong> or calamity to come<br /><strong>例</strong>　The novel's protagonist is haunted by a minatory black specter．这部小说的主人公被不祥的黑色幽灵所骚扰。<br /><strong>近</strong>　baleful, direful, doomy, foreboding, ill-boding, inauspicious, menacing, portentous, sinister, threatening<br /><strong>反</strong>　unthreatening　没有威胁的；reassuring　令人安心的<br />

moderate	L16 U03				<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />[ˈmɑːdəreɪt] [sound:moderate_v.mp3]<br />vt. <strong><ins>使缓和：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>lessen</ins></strong> the <strong><ins>intensity</ins></strong> or extremeness of<br /><strong>例</strong>　Sopranos and tenors moderates their voices to fit the size of the theater．女高音和男高音们根据剧场的大小调节他们的声音以创造合适的效果。<br /><strong>近</strong>　abate, diminish, dwindle, ease, lessen, lower, modulate, subside, taper, temper, wane<br /><strong>反</strong>　escalate, enhance, expand, heighten, intensify　扩大，升级，增强<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />[ˈmɑːdərət] [sound:moderate_a.mp3]<br />a. <strong><ins>适度的，中庸的：</ins></strong>being <strong><ins>within</ins></strong> reasonable <strong><ins>limits</ins></strong>; not excessive or extreme<br /><strong>例</strong>　The new proposals regarding defense budget were met with only moderate enthusiasm．关于国防预算的新提案只得到了平淡的热情。<br /><strong>近</strong>　average, conservative, fair, intermediate, mediocre, modest, reasonable, temperate<br /><strong>反</strong>　exorbitant, excessive　过分的；extreme, radical　极端的<br /><strong>派</strong>　immoderate adj．不适度的<br />

monochromatic	L16 U04	[ˌmɑːnəkroʊˈmætɪk][sound:monochromatic.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】mono[single]+chrom[color]+-atic[a.], of a single color→a.单色的；颜色单一，缺乏变化→a.单调无聊的<br />　　　【参】近义词monotonous[单调的]指“音调[ton]单一[mono]的[-ous]”，因缺乏变化而令人乏味<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>chrome</strong>　词根chrome表示color[颜色]。chrome浏览器的命名来自词根chrom[color], 它的logo由许多色彩组成，寓意“呈现给用户五彩缤纷的网络世界”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　chromatic, monochromatic<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>单调无聊的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>lacking variety</ins></strong>, creativity, or excitement<br /><strong>例</strong>　a monochromatic article eulogizing a hero　一篇无聊的赞颂英雄的文章<br /><strong>近</strong>　arid, dreary, drudging, dull, jejune, monotonous, pedestrian, ponderous, stale, stodgy, tiresome<br /><strong>反</strong>　absorbing, engaging, engrossing, gripping, interesting, intriguing, involving, riveting　吸引人的<br />
monologue	L16 U04	[ˈmɑːnəlɔːɡ]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】mono-[single, alone]+logue[speak], (of actor) speakalone→n.独白<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>log</strong>　词根log表示speak[说]。例如dialogue[对话]字面义speak[log=speak]across[dia-=across]，形象一点说就是“话语在（人）之间穿梭”。作名词讲时，log表示“记录的话”，引申为“文字、作品”。log还有“学说”的含义，-logy是表示学科的后缀。此外，log有两个由尾辅音音变产生的同义词根loqu和locu。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　eulogize, monologue, prologue, grandiloquent, loquacious, obloquy, soliloquy, terminology, circumlocution<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>独白：</ins></strong>a dramatic sketch performed <strong><ins>by one actor</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　deliver a tedious monologue　做了一个冗长的独白<br /><strong>近</strong>　soliloquy, solo, speech<br /><strong>反</strong>　dialogue　对话<br />

obloquy	L17 U02	[ˈɑːbləkwi][sound:obloquy.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ob-[against]+loqu[speak]+-y[n.], speakagainst (sb.)→n.谩骂，诽谤；（被别人）谩骂→n.恶名，耻辱<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>log</strong>　词根log表示speak[说]。例如dialogue[对话]字面义speak[log=speak]across[dia-=across]，形象一点说就是“话语在（人）之间穿梭”。作名词讲时，log表示“记录的话”，引申为“文字、作品”。log还有“学说”的含义，-logy是表示学科的后缀。此外，log有两个由尾辅音音变产生的同义词根loqu和locu。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　eulogize, monologue, prologue, grandiloquent, loquacious, obloquy, soliloquy, terminology, circumlocution<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>谩骂，诽谤：</ins></strong><strong><ins>abusively</ins></strong> detractive <strong><ins>language</ins></strong> or utterance; calumny<br /><strong>例</strong>　she unleashed a torrent of obloquy on her opponent．她滔滔不绝地辱骂了对手一顿。<br /><strong>近</strong>　billingsgate, fulmination, invective, scurrility, vitriol, vituperation<br /><strong>反</strong>　adulation　极度谄媚<br />
obscure	L17 U02	[əbˈskjʊr][sound:obscure.mp3]<br />			<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>含义模糊的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>not clearly</ins></strong> understood or expressed; having an often intentionally <strong><ins>veiled</ins></strong> or <strong><ins>uncertain meaning</ins></strong> vt．<strong><ins>使模糊：</ins></strong>to make dark, dim, or <strong><ins>indistinct</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　a fantasy writer who likes to put lots of obscure references in her tales of wizards and warlocks　一个喜欢在巫师故事中添加很多含义模糊的引文的魔幻小说作家<br /><strong>近</strong>　ambiguous, arcane, enigmatic, equivocal, fuliginous, inscrutable, opaque; blear, blur, darken, dim, overshadow, shroud<br /><strong>反</strong>　explicit, manifest, clear, certain, accessible, nonambiguous, obvious, plain, unambiguous, unequivocal　明晰的，没有歧义的；elucidate, brighten, illuminate, light up, lighten　阐明<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>平凡的，不知名的：</ins></strong>not prominent or <strong><ins>famous</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　an obscure poet　无名的诗人<br /><strong>近</strong>　noteless, uncelebrated, unfamous, unknown, unrecognized, unsung<br /><strong>反</strong>　legendary, celebrated, famed, famous, noted, notorious, prominent, renowned, well-known　有名的<br /><strong>派</strong>　obscurity n．无名之辈<br />　　<strong>反</strong>　celebrity　名人<br />

orthodox	L17 U05	[ˈɔːrθədɑːks][sound:orthodox.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ortho-[right]+dox[opinion], of right[即多数人认为正确的]opinion→a.传统的<br />　　　【注】前缀ortho-可以通过authority[n.权威]进行记忆（读音相近）：权威被大众认为“正确”。<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>doc (t), dox</strong>　（1）词根doc (t)表示teach[教]。例如，doctor[博士]可看做“受过最高等教育[doct]的人[-or]”；document[文件]最初指“sth.[-ment]thatteaches[doc](the reader)”；doctrine[教条]也来自词根doct, 可以看成“doct[教]line[条]”。<br />　　　（2）词根dox表示opinion[思想]，与词根doc有一定联系，“教育”传递和塑造“思想”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　doctrinaire, indoctrinate, heterodox, orthodox, paradox<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>传统的：</ins></strong>following or agreeing with <strong><ins>established form</ins></strong>, <strong><ins>custom</ins></strong>, <strong><ins>or rules</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　He believes in the benefits of both orthodox medicine and alternative medicine．他既相信传统药物又相信替代药物的效用。<br /><strong>近</strong>　ceremonial, conventional, regular, routine<br /><strong>反</strong>　casual, freewheeling, informal, irregular, unceremonious, unconventional, unorthodox　不常见的<br />

partial	L17 U10	[ˈpɑːrʃl][sound:partial.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】part[part]+-ial[a.], in part→部分的，不完整的；favour one part, （倾向于喜爱）某部分的→a.偏袒的，偏爱的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>part</strong>　词根part的含义是part[部分]。particle[粒子]就是构成物质的“小的[-cle]部分[part]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　counterpart, partial, particularize, partisan, partition, jeopardy<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>偏袒的，偏爱的：</ins></strong>inclined to favor one party more than the other: <strong><ins>biased</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　He is partial to pretty girls．他偏爱漂亮女孩。<br /><strong>近</strong>　biased, one-sided, partisan, prejudiced<br /><strong>反</strong>　disinterested, equitable, evenhanded, fair, impartial, neutral, objective, unbiased, unprejudiced　公平的<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>部分的，不完整的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>lacking</ins></strong> some necessary part<br /><strong>例</strong>　a partial answer to the problem　一部分的解答<br /><strong>近</strong>　deficient, fragmental, fragmentary, half, halfway<br /><strong>反</strong>　complete, entire, full, intact, integral, perfect, whole　完整的<br /><strong>派</strong>　partially adv．部分地；partiality n．偏袒，偏爱<br />

pensive	L18 U02	[ˈpensɪv][sound:pensive.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】pens[hang, weigh]+-ive[a.], 将东西挂在秤上，以称重、权衡→a.沉思的，（尤指）哀思的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>pend, pens</strong>　词根pend（其他形式pens）表示hang[挂，悬挂]。depend[v.依赖，依靠]字面含义“挂在[pend]下面[de-]”，引申出“挂靠、附属于（某机构）”的含义；independent表示“不[in-]挂在[pend]任何事物下面[de-]的[-ent]”，独立的。pending[紧迫的，即将发生的]来自词根pend的引申义，表示“（某事件）处于悬挂状态”，即还没有发生，但（随时）可能“掉下来，发生”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　compendium, dependable, indispensable, impending, propensity, suspend, pensive<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>沉思的，（尤指）哀思的：</ins></strong>given to or marked by long, quiet and often musingly sad <strong><ins>thinking</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　Rainy days often put her in a pensive mood．雨天总是让她陷入深深的思考之中。<br /><strong>近</strong>　broody, cogitative, meditative, melancholy, musing, reflective, ruminant, ruminative, thoughtful<br /><strong>反</strong>　mindless, thoughtless, unreflective　不加思考的<br />

perceptible	L18 U03	[pərˈseptəbl][sound:perceptible.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】per-[thoroughly]+cept[take]+-ible[a., able], (of sth.) ableto betaken thoroughly→a.可察觉的<br />　　　【派】perceive[v.察觉]<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cap, capt, cept, cip, cup</strong>　这些词根都表示seize[抓]或take[拿]，有着相同的词源。它们的拼写区别在于元音字母的不同，以及词根末尾的t。下面是由它们组成的一些单词：<br />　　　（1）capacity[容量]就是amount one could take[cap], 即一个容器能“拿”多少；<br />　　　（2）capture[捕获]相当于seize[capt]；<br />　　　（3）except[除…外]字面含义“take[cept]...out[ex-]”;accept[接受]是指“to[ac-=ad-]take[cept]”；<br />　　　（4）participate[参与]相当于“take[cip]part (in)”；<br />　　　（5）occupy[占用；占领]字面含义“to take[cup]over[oc-=ob-]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　captious, captivate, inception, exceptional, unexceptionable, perceptible, perceptive, susceptibility, disciple, emancipate, incipient, principal, preoccupation, recuperate<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>可察觉的：</ins></strong>capable of <strong><ins>being perceived</ins></strong> especially by the senses<br /><strong>例</strong>　You should be able to note a perceptible temperature change when you add the second reagents．当你加入第二种试剂的时候，你应该能够察觉到明显的温度变化。<br /><strong>近</strong>　appreciable, apprehensible, detectable, discernible, distinguishable, palpable, sensible<br /><strong>反</strong>　impalpable, imperceptible, inappreciable, indistinguishable, insensible, undetectable　不能感知的<br />
peremptory	L18 U03	[pəˈremptəri][sound:peremptory.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】per-[thoroughly]+empt[take]+-ory[a.], 要求别人全盘接受→a.不容反抗的；喜欢要求的→a.爱发号施令的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>emp (t), sum (pt)</strong>　（1）词根emp (t)表示take[拿]，example[例子，形容词形式exemplary]就是“拿[amp=emp]出来[ex-]的东西[-le]”；preempt[预先占有]就是“预先[pre]拿下[empt]”。<br />　　　（2）词根sum (pt)来自“sub-+empt”的缩写，含义也是take[拿]，例如assume[假设，名词形式assumption]就是“去[as-=ad-]拿[sum]（未被证实的条件）”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　exemplary, exempt, peremptory, preempt, presumptuous, sumptuous<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>不容反抗的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>not allowing contradiction</ins></strong> or refusal; imperative<br /><strong>例</strong>　a peremptory order from the general　将军下达的不容反抗的命令<br /><strong>近</strong>　compulsory, forced, imperative, incumbent, involuntary, obligatory, required<br /><strong>反</strong>　elective, optional, voluntary　可选择的<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>傲慢的：</ins></strong>having a <strong><ins>feeling of superiority</ins></strong> that shows itself in an overbearing attitude<br /><strong>例</strong>　She had such a peremptory approach to running the club that people started to avoid her．她用一种如此傲慢自大的方式来管理俱乐部，令大家纷纷开始躲避她。<br /><strong>近</strong>　assumptive, bumptious, haughty, imperious, lofty, pompous, presumptuous, pretentious, supercilious<br /><strong>反</strong>　humble, lowly, modest　谦逊的<br />

preeminent	L19 U03	[priˈemɪnənt][sound:preeminent.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】pre-[forth]+e-[out]+min[jut]+-ent[a.], jutout forth, （提前）脱颖而出→a.优秀的，重要的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>min</strong>　词根min有“small[小]”和“jut[突出]”两层含义，合起来可以看做“突出的小尖”。<br />　　　（1）词根min的一个常见含义表示“小”，例如“迷你”就来源于mini的音译；minister[大臣]原指（相对于国王来讲的）“小[min (i）]人[-ster]、手下”；<br />　　　（2）词根min的另外一个含义是“突出”，这层含义与（1）的联系是“突出的尖端”很小。mountain[山]（看做与词根min元音替换）相对于地球来讲，就是“突出的（小尖）”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　diminish, eminent, menace, menial, minatory, mince, minimize, miniscule, minute, preeminent<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>优秀的，重要的：</ins></strong>having <strong><ins>paramount</ins></strong> rank, dignity, or importance<br /><strong>例</strong>　the writer's preeminent style　作者出色的文风<br /><strong>近</strong>　distinguished, illustrious, incomparable, notable, outstanding, peerless, superb, supreme, unmatchable<br /><strong>反</strong>　negligible, trivial　不重要的<br /><strong>派</strong>　preeminence n．杰出<br />
preempt	L19 U03	[priˈempt][sound:preempt.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】pre[before]+empt[take], take...before (others)→vt.预先占有；A预先占有B的位置，即A取代B→vt.替换<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>emp (t), sum (pt)</strong>　（1）词根emp (t)表示take[拿]，example[例子，形容词形式exemplary]就是“拿[amp=emp]出来[ex-]的东西[-le]”；preempt[预先占有]就是“预先[pre]拿下[empt]”。<br />　　　（2）词根sum (pt)来自“sub-+empt”的缩写，含义也是take[拿]，例如assume[假设，名词形式assumption]就是“去[as-=ad-]拿[sum]（未被证实的条件）”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　exemplary, exempt, peremptory, preempt, presumptuous, sumptuous<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>预先占有：</ins></strong>to appropriate, <strong><ins>seize</ins></strong>, or take for oneself <strong><ins>before others</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　The naughty children had preempted front-row seats that were reserved for the guests of honor．调皮的孩子们把前排留给贵宾的座位占了。<br /><strong>近</strong>　appropriate, arrogate, commandeer, convert, expropriate, seize, usurp<br /><strong>派</strong>　preemptive adj．先发制人的；先买的<br />

pregnant	L19 U04	[ˈpreɡnənt][sound:pregnant.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】pre-[before]+gn[gen, generate, bear]+-ant[a.], 在生（小孩）之前的→a.怀孕的；产生（结果）的→a.重要的，意味深长的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>gen</strong>　词根gen表示“generate[产生；生育], create, bear”。gene[n.基因]就来自该词根。gentle[a.温和的，文雅的，有教养的]原指“生在[gen]（一个好的家庭）”的绅士[gentleman], 他们往往表现出有教养，性格上温和文雅。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　engender, indigenous, ingenious, ingenuous, homogenize, regenerate, genial, genteel, benign, malign, pregnant<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>重要的，意味深长的：</ins></strong>weighty or significant; <strong><ins>full of meaning</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　the pregnant phrases of the Bible　《圣经》中充满哲理的话语<br /><strong>近</strong>　eloquent, meaningful, momentous, profound, revelatory, significant, suggestive<br /><strong>反</strong>　inane　空洞的<br />
preoccupation	L19 U04	[priˌɑːkjuˈpeɪʃn][sound:preoccupation.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】pre-[before]+occup(y) [occupy, seize]+-ation[n.], seize before (another), 抢在（其他）之前紧紧抓住→n.非常关心，全神贯注<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cap, capt, cept, cip, cup</strong>　这些词根都表示seize[抓]或take[拿]，有着相同的词源。它们的拼写区别在于元音字母的不同，以及词根末尾的t。下面是由它们组成的一些单词：<br />　　　（1）capacity[容量]就是amount one could take[cap], 即一个容器能“拿”多少；<br />　　　（2）capture[捕获]相当于seize[capt]；<br />　　　（3）except[除…外]字面含义“take[cept]...out[ex-]”;accept[接受]是指“to[ac-=ad-]take[cept]”；<br />　　　（4）participate[参与]相当于“take[cip]part (in)”；<br />　　　（5）occupy[占用；占领]字面含义“to take[cup]over[oc-=ob-]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　captious, captivate, inception, exceptional, unexceptionable, perceptible, perceptive, susceptibility, disciple, emancipate, incipient, principal, preoccupation, recuperate<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>非常关心，全神贯注：</ins></strong><strong><ins>extreme</ins></strong> or excessive <strong><ins>concern</ins></strong> with something<br /><strong>例</strong>　He kept sinking back into gloomy preoccupation．他陷入了深深的忧虑之中。<br /><strong>近</strong>　absorption, engagement, engrossment, immersion<br /><strong>反</strong>　apathy, indifference, nonchalance, unconcern　漠不关心<br /><strong>派</strong>　preoccupied adj．全神贯注的<br />

prestige	L19 U05	[preˈstiːʒ][sound:prestige.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【联】pre-[before]+stige[stage], 站在台前→n.声望，威望<br />　　　【注】prestige也可看成“向前[pre-]刺[stig]”，比喻“锋芒”毕露后赢得的声望、威望<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>sti, sti (n) g</strong>　单词stick[刺；坚持]也有“钉”的含义（钉需要刺过物体，被钉的物体不容易变化位置）。很多由sti开头的单词（或词根）从词源（或可以联想成）与“钉、刺”有关。例如：sting[刺，刺痛；叮咬；讽刺]，以及与sting同源的词根stig, stinct。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　distinctive, extinguish, instigate, prestige, stickler, stiff, stifle, stigma, stingy, stipple, stipulate, stitch<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>声望，威望：</ins></strong>the level of <strong><ins>respect</ins></strong> at which one is regarded by others<br /><strong>例</strong>　The prestige of the university has been irrevocably impaired by the plagiarism scandal．这所大学的声望已经因剽窃丑闻而受到了不可挽回的损失。<br /><strong>近</strong>　credit, fame, influence, reputation<br /><strong>反</strong>　infamy　坏名声<br /><strong>派</strong>　prestigious adj．有名望的<br />
presumptuous	L19 U05	[prɪˈzʌmptʃuəs][sound:presumptuous.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】pre-[before]+sumpt[take]+-uous[a.], take before (permission), 在被允许之前拿→a.放肆的，冒昧的；take oneself before (others), 认为自己比别人优越→a.傲慢的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>emp (t), sum (pt)</strong>　（1）词根emp (t)表示take[拿]，example[例子，形容词形式exemplary]就是“拿[amp=emp]出来[ex-]的东西[-le]”；preempt[预先占有]就是“预先[pre]拿下[empt]”。<br />　　　（2）词根sum (pt)来自“sub-+empt”的缩写，含义也是take[拿]，例如assume[假设，名词形式assumption]就是“去[as-=ad-]拿[sum]（未被证实的条件）”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　exemplary, exempt, peremptory, preempt, presumptuous, sumptuous<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>傲慢的：</ins></strong>having a <strong><ins>feeling of superiority</ins></strong> that shows itself in an overbearing attitude<br /><strong>例</strong>　the presumptuous and impatient doctor　这位傲慢、没耐心的医生<br /><strong>近</strong>　assumptive, bumptious, cavalier, haughty, imperious, lofty, overweening, peremptory, supercilious<br /><strong>反</strong>　humble, modest　谦卑的<br />
pretense	L19 U05	[ˈpriːtens][sound:pretense.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】pre-[before]+tens[stretch]+-e[n.], pretend[假装]的名词形式→n.虚假，伪装；stretch before (others), 在别人面前伸展、展示→n.自大，优越感<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>tend, tens, tent</strong>　词根tend表示stretch[伸出，伸展]，例如extend[拓展]就是“向外[ex-]伸展[tend]”;tend作为单词有“趋向”的含义，即“（向某方向）伸展”。词根tend有两个常见的变体tens和tent。extension[拓展，伸展]是extend的名词形式；extent[程度]就是“向外伸展”的多少。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　tendentious, contend, contentious, distend, intensify, pretense, unpretentious, ostensible, ostentatious, portentous<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>虚假，伪装：</ins></strong>the act of <strong><ins>pretending</ins></strong>; a false appearance or action intended to <strong><ins>deceive</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　There is too much pretense in his piety．他的虔诚大多都是伪装。<br /><strong>近</strong>　affectation, camouflage, deceit, disguise, imposture, mask, masquerade<br /><strong>反</strong>　sincerity　真诚<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>自大，优越感：</ins></strong>an <strong><ins>exaggerated sense of one's importance</ins></strong> that shows itself in the making of excessive or unjustified claims<br /><strong>近</strong>　assumption, hauteur, imperiousness, loftiness, lordliness, pomposity, superciliousness, superiority<br /><strong>反</strong>　humility, modesty　谦逊<br />

probe	L19 U06	[proʊb][sound:probe.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】prob[prove, test]+-e[v.], 去检验→v./n.深入调查<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>prob, prov</strong>　词根prob，prov（字母b和v的替换，参考mobile和move）表示“test[检验]，prove[证明]”以及引申含义“通过了检验”，即“证明（或认为）…为好，正确[right]”。probable[a.很可能的；可信的]字面含义“（对于不完全确定的事物）可[-able]证明正确[prob]的”。approve[v.赞成；批准]来自词根prov“认为…正确”的含义。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　approbation, disprove, probe, probity, reprobate, reprove, proofread<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />v./n. <strong><ins>深入调查：</ins></strong>a <strong><ins>penetrating</ins></strong> or critical <strong><ins>investigation</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　probe into his background　深入调查他的背景<br /><strong>近</strong>　delve, explore, inquire; delving, disquisition, exploration, inquisition<br />

proponent	L19 U09	[prəˈpoʊnənt][sound:proponent.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】pro-[forward]+pon[put]+-ent[n.], putforward (to the public), （向公众）提出→n.建议者，支持者<br />　　　【注】词组putforth和putforward都有“提出”的含义<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>pon</strong>　词根pon也表示put[放]，与词根pos同源。component[组件]字面含义是“放在（pon）一起（com-）的东西（-ent）”, 相对于所构成的整体它们就是“组件”。compound[混合物]字面含义是“将一切放在（poun）一起（com-），”即使混合，混合物。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　exponent, proponent, compound<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>建议者，支持者：</ins></strong>one who argues in <strong><ins>support</ins></strong> of something; an advocate<br /><strong>例</strong>　a proponent of sth.　某事的支持者<br /><strong>近</strong>　advocate, apostle, champion, expounder, espouser, friend, promoter, supporter, protagonist<br /><strong>反</strong>　adversary, antagonist, opponent, detractor　诋毁者，反对者<br />

recant	L20 U09	[rɪˈkænt][sound:recant.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】re-[back]+cant[sing], sing...back→vt.撤回，放弃，改变<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cant</strong>　词根cant表示sing[唱]。单词chant[v.唱 n.颂歌]是词根cant的变形；读音联想“唱它”。此外，词根cant由“唱”引申出以下两层含义：<br />　　　（1）“带腔调地说”。例如accent[n.口音；重音]，其中词根cant的元音a变为e。<br />　　　（2）“吸引人的咒语”。（传说海上有一个巫女，当看到有过往的船只时就会唱出令人陶醉的歌声（即咒语）令船员忘却一切，最终导致船永远停止航行。）<br /><strong>同根</strong>　incantation, recant, disenchant, incentive<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>撤回，放弃，改变：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>withdraw</ins></strong> or repudiate (<strong><ins>a statement</ins></strong> or belief) formally and publicly<br /><strong>例</strong>　The man has refused after torture to recant his heresy．这个人在受折磨后依旧拒绝放弃他的异教信仰。<br /><strong>近</strong>　abjure, abnegate, forswear, renege, renounce, repeal, repudiate, retract, withdraw<br /><strong>反</strong>　adhere, insist, maintain, stick　坚持<br /><strong>派</strong>　recantation n．改变论调<br />

recumbent	L20 U10	[rɪˈkʌmbənt][sound:recumbent.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】re-[back]+cumb[lie]+-ent[a.], lie back, 向后躺→a.躺着的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cu (m) b</strong>　（1）词根cu (m) b表示lie[躺；位于]。cubicle[小卧室]中的词根cub指“躺下睡觉”，-cle是表示“小”的名词后缀。（另一方面，cubicle可以看做“小[-（c) le]立方体[cube, 形容词形式cubic]”, 从轮廓上描述了“小卧室”。）<br />　　　（2）cumber[n.＆v.阻碍]可以理解成“躺[cumb]（在路上）（的东西[-er]）”, 像绊脚石那样阻碍前进。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　incubate, incumbent, recumbent, succumb, cumbersome, encumber<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>躺着的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>lying down</ins></strong>, especially in a position of comfort or rest<br /><strong>例</strong>　lying recumbent on the floor　躺在地板上<br /><strong>近</strong>　decumbent, procumbent, prone, prostrate, reclining, supine<br /><strong>反</strong>　erect, upright　直立的<br />
recuperate	L20 U10	[rɪˈkuːpəreɪt][sound:recuperate.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】re-[back]+cup[take]+er+-ate[v.], take (health) back→v.恢复（健康或力量），康复<br />　　　【参】recover[v.恢复]<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cap, capt, cept, cip, cup</strong>　这些词根都表示seize[抓]或take[拿]，有着相同的词源。它们的拼写区别在于元音字母的不同，以及词根末尾的t。下面是由它们组成的一些单词：<br />　　　（1）capacity[容量]就是amount one could take[cap], 即一个容器能“拿”多少；<br />　　　（2）capture[捕获]相当于seize[capt]；<br />　　　（3）except[除…外]字面含义“take[cept]...out[ex-]”;accept[接受]是指“to[ac-=ad-]take[cept]”；<br />　　　（4）participate[参与]相当于“take[cip]part (in)”；<br />　　　（5）occupy[占用；占领]字面含义“to take[cup]over[oc-=ob-]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　captious, captivate, inception, exceptional, unexceptionable, perceptible, perceptive, susceptibility, disciple, emancipate, incipient, principal, preoccupation, recuperate<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />v. <strong><ins>恢复（健康或力量），康复：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>recover health</ins></strong> or strength<br /><strong>例</strong>　He is gradually recuperating from a serious back injury．他正渐渐地从严重的背部损伤中恢复过来。<br /><strong>近</strong>　convalesce, heal, rally, recoup, recover, rehabilitate<br /><strong>反</strong>　deteriorate, flag, wane, weaken　衰退，变得衰弱；die, expire, perish, pass away　死亡<br /><strong>派</strong>　recuperative adj．有助于康复的<br />

replete	L21 U04	[rɪˈpliːt][sound:replete.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】re-[again, 加强语气]+plet[fill]+-e[a.], 不断地填充→a.彻底吃饱了的；充满…的，富于…的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>ple</strong>　词根ple（其他形式plet, plen）表示fill[填充], full[满]（填充后的结果）。complete[v.完成a.完整的；完全的]和plenty[n.丰富，大量]都来自该词根。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　complementary, deplete, implement, replenish, replete, plebeian, plentitude<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>充满…的，富于…的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>possessing</ins></strong> or covered with <strong><ins>great numbers</ins></strong> or amounts of something specified<br /><strong>例</strong>　Financial history is replete with bubbles and crashes　金融的历史充满危机和泡沫<br /><strong>近</strong>　abounding, abundant, awash, flush, fraught, lousy, swarming, teeming, thick, thronging<br /><strong>反</strong>　depleted, drained, exhausted　耗竭的；deficient, incomplete, insufficient, short　缺乏的<br /><strong>派</strong>　repletion n．装满<br />
repose	L21 U04	[rɪˈpoʊz][sound:repose.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【联】re[rest]+pose[pause], rest, pause→n.（劳作后的）休息vi.休息；暴风雨“休息”→n.平静，宁静；一个人休息之后→vt.放置，交给他人<br />　　　【注】也可以理解成re-[back]+pos[put]+-e[v.], 即“放到后面”，引出“休息”的含义<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>pos (t)</strong>　词根pos表示put[放]，同源词根还有post。expose[揭露]就是“（把隐藏的东西）放到[pos]外面[ex-]”;poster[海报]指“放[post]在外面起宣传作用的东西[-er]”。另外, suppose[假设]指“（将未证实的结论）放在[pos]下面[sup-=sub-]（作为研究和讨论的基础）”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　apposite, apropos, compose, depose, deposit, discompose, imposing, poseur, posit, superimpose, supposition, repose, impostor, postulate, posture<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>（劳作后的）休息：</ins></strong>a <strong><ins>state of resting</ins></strong> after exertion or strain vi．<strong><ins>休息：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>take a rest</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　The doctor ordered a period of repose for the patient suffering from insomnia．医生要求正在饱受失眠折磨的病人好好休息一阵。<br />　　They have to repose on couches because all beds have been occupied．因为所有的床都有人占了，他们不得不在沙发上休息。<br /><strong>近</strong>　ease, leisure, relaxation; idle, loll, lounge, relax, rest<br /><strong>反</strong>　exertion, labor, toil, work　劳动，工作；drudge, hustle, moil, strive, struggle, sweat, travail　努力工作<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>平静，宁静：</ins></strong>a state of <strong><ins>freedom from storm</ins></strong> or disturbance<br /><strong>例</strong>　We enjoyed the repose of a summer evening on a remote island．我们在遥远的小岛上共享了夏日傍晚的片刻安宁。<br /><strong>近</strong>　calmness, hush, peace, placidity, quietness, restfulness, serenity, still, tranquility<br /><strong>反</strong>　commotion, pandemonium, tumult, turmoil, unrest, uproar　骚乱，动乱<br />
reprehend	L21 U05	[reprɪˈhend][sound:reprehend.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】re-[again]+prehend[seize], 反复抓（毛病）→vt.谴责，责难，批评<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>prehend, prehens</strong>　（1）词根prehend表示seize[抓]，变体prehens。comprehend[理解]就是“抓住（含义）”；名词形式comprehension, 短语“reading comprehension”是“阅读理解”。<br />　　　（2）词根prehend的另一种变体是pris, 构成的单词prison[监狱]是“抓[pris]（犯人）的地方[-on]”, comprise[包含，由…组成]就是“将…抓[pris]到一起[com-]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　comprehend, apprehension, misapprehension, reprehend, apprise, comprise<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>谴责，责难，批评：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>express</ins></strong> one's <strong><ins>unfavorable opinion</ins></strong> of the worth or quality of<br /><strong>例</strong>　Our conscience reprehends us．我们的良心谴责我们。<br /><strong>近</strong>　berate, blame, castigate, censure, condemn, denounce, dispraise, fault, knock, lambaste, pan, upbraid<br /><strong>反</strong>　extol, laud, praise　表扬<br /><strong>派</strong>　reprehensible adj．应受谴责的<br />

reprobate	L21 U05	[ˈreprəbeɪt][sound:reprobate.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】re-[opposite of]+prob[prove]+-ate[n.＆a.＆v.], opposite of“prove (to be right)”→n.堕落者，道德败坏的人a.堕落的，放荡的；opposite of“approve”→vt.拒绝，不提供；谴责，痛斥<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>prob, prov</strong>　词根prob，prov（字母b和v的替换，参考mobile和move）表示“test[检验]，prove[证明]”以及引申含义“通过了检验”，即“证明（或认为）…为好，正确[right]”。probable[a.很可能的；可信的]字面含义“（对于不完全确定的事物）可[-able]证明正确[prob]的”。approve[v.赞成；批准]来自词根prov“认为…正确”的含义。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　approbation, disprove, probe, probity, reprobate, reprove, proofread<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>堕落者，道德败坏的人：</ins></strong>a morally <strong><ins>unprincipled person</ins></strong> adj．<strong><ins>堕落的，放荡的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>morally corrupt</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　The program rehabilitates reprobates and turns them into hard-working, law-abiding citizens．这个项目让那些堕落的人改过自新，并将他们变成勤劳守法的好公民。<br />　　He is a reprobate judge who could be bribed, and often with astonishing ease．他是一个堕落的法官，极其容易就被贿赂了。<br /><strong>近</strong>　brute, devil, fiend, miscreant, rapscallion, rascal, villain; debased, debauched, degraded, depraved, dissipated, dissolute, libertine, perverse, perverted, rakish<br /><strong>反</strong>　saint　圣人；good, moral, righteous, virtuous　有道德的；pure, uncorrupted　纯净的，未受污染的<br />

reserved	L21 U06	[rɪˈzзːrvd]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】re-[back]+serv[keep]+-ed[a.], keep (words) back, 不说话的→a.内向的，缄默的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>serv</strong>　词根serv表示keep。preserve[v.保存，保护]字面含义“keep[serv]（safe) beforehand[pre-]”。此外，词根serv也特指“被抓起来的的奴隶，或被收留的仆人[servant]”，他们为主人“服务[serve]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　conserve, conservatory, conservative, observant, preservative, reserved, servile, subservient<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>内向的，缄默的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>restrained</ins></strong> in words and actions<br /><strong>例</strong>　He was unemotional, quiet and reserved.　他不动感情、安静并且内向。<br /><strong>近</strong>　closemouthed, constrained, laconic, reticent, restrained, silent, taciturn<br /><strong>反</strong>　communicative, expansive, talkative　健谈的；garrulous, loquacious　话多的<br /><strong>派</strong>　unreserved adj．无保留的，外向的<br />

retract	L21 U08	[rɪˈtrækt][sound:retract.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【注】re-[back]+tract[draw], draw back (claims)→vt.收回，否认<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>tract</strong>　词根tract表示draw[拉], attract[吸引]字面含义“to[at-=ad-]draw[tract]”, 即“拉（注意力）”, 引申为“吸引”。abstract[抽象]就是“（从众多事物中）抽[tract]出[abs-]共同且本质的特征”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　abstract, contract, detract, distract, distraught, extract, extraction, protract, retract, tractable<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>收回，否认：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>take back</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　The newspaper had to retract its allegations against the mayor．报纸不得不收回针对市长的谣言。<br /><strong>近</strong>　abjure, abnegate, disavow, forswear, recall, recant, renounce, repeal, repudiate, withdraw<br /><strong>反</strong>　tender　提出（建议，想法）；adhere, stick　坚持<br /><strong>派</strong>　retractable adj．可收回的<br />
retrench	L21 U08	[rɪˈtrentʃ][sound:retrench.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】re-[加强语气]+trench[cut], cut (expenses)→vi.削减开支<br />　　　【注】trench作为单词是“沟渠”的含义。沟渠是“切”出来的。<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vi. <strong><ins>削减开支：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>curtail expenses</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　Declining business forced the company to retrench．衰减的业务迫使公司削减开支。<br /><strong>近</strong>　economize, reduce, cut down<br /><strong>反</strong>　enlarge, expand　扩大，扩张<br /><strong>派</strong>　retrenchment n．削减开销<br />

retrograde	L21 U09	[ˈretrəɡreɪd][sound:retrograde.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】retro-[re-, backward]+grad[step]+-e[a.＆v.], step backward→a.倒退的vi.退步，退化<br />　　　【注】前缀retro来自re-[back]，表示向后<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>gress</strong>　词根gress表示step[迈步，踏]。progress[进步]就是“向前[pro-]迈步[gress]”。词根gress还有一个同源词根grad（尾辅音s-d相互替换），grade[级别]指在某个领域迈了多少步。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　aggressive, digress, regress, transgress, retrograde<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>倒退的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>moving</ins></strong> or tending <strong><ins>backward</ins></strong> vi．<strong><ins>退步，退化：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>decline</ins></strong> to a worse condition<br /><strong>例</strong>　This is a retrograde step and you will regret it．这是后退的一步，你以后肯定会后悔的。<br />　　The Dark Ages is the period following the fall of the Roman Empire when Western civilization seriously retro-graded.“黑暗时代”指的是罗马帝国崩溃之后，西方文明严重退步的一个历史时期。<br /><strong>近</strong>　backward, receding, regressive, reversed, withdrawing; atrophy, crumble, decay, decline, degenerate, descend, deteriorate, ebb, regress, rot, sink, worsen<br /><strong>反</strong>　progressive　前进的；ameliorate, improve, meliorate　改善<br />

sanctify	L22 U04	[ˈsæŋktɪfaɪ][sound:sanctify.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】sanct[sacred]+-ify[v., make], make...sacred→v.使神圣，将…敬为神<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>sacr, sanct</strong>　词根sacr和sanct都表示“holy, sacred”[神的，神圣的]。sacrifice[n.牺牲]原指“为神[sacr]做[fic]的（牺牲）”，古代拜神时需要杀“牲口”（甚至是人）。saint[n.圣人a.神圣的]（音似“圣徒”）与词根sanct同源。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　sacrosanct, desecrate, execrate, sanction, sanctify, sanctimonious, sanctuary<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>使神圣，将…敬为神：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>make holy</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　The Constitution sanctified the rights of the people．宪法认为人权是至高无上的。<br /><strong>近</strong>　consecrate, hallow<br /><strong>反</strong>　desecrate, profane　亵渎<br /><strong>派</strong>　sanctification n．敬为神明<br />

signal	L23 U03	[ˈsɪɡnəl][sound:signal.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】作为标志的→a.（在重要性、成就方面）非同寻常的；sign[做手势]→v.给出信号<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>sign</strong>　词根和单词sign表示“签字，标志[mark]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　consign, designate, resign, signal<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>（在重要性、成就方面）非同寻常的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>standing above</ins></strong> others in rank, importance, or achievement<br /><strong>例</strong>　The Louisiana Purchase is cited by many historians as one of the most signal events in American history．从法国手中购买路易斯安那被许多历史学家认为是美国历史上最重要的事件之一。<br />　　a signal feat　一项非同寻常的伟业<br /><strong>近</strong>　distinguished, illustrious, luminous, notable, noteworthy, outstanding, preeminent, prestigious, redoubtable<br /><strong>反</strong>　average, inferior, mediocre　一般的，低下的；insignificant, minor, unimportant　不重要的<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />v. <strong><ins>给出信号：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>direct or notify</ins></strong> by a movement or gesture<br /><strong>例</strong>　They signaled at me to come over．他们向我打招呼要我到他们去。<br />　　A lock on the suit-case might signal that there's something of value inside．手提箱上的锁可能意味着里面有贵重物品。<br /><strong>近</strong>　beckon, flag, gesture, wave<br />

soliloquy	L23 U08	[səˈlɪləkwi][sound:soliloquy.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】soli[alone]+loqu[speak]+-y[n.], speak alone→n.（尤指自言自语的）独白<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>log</strong>　词根log表示speak[说]。例如dialogue[对话]字面义speak[log=speak]across[dia-=across]，形象一点说就是“话语在（人）之间穿梭”。作名词讲时，log表示“记录的话”，引申为“文字、作品”。log还有“学说”的含义，-logy是表示学科的后缀。此外，log有两个由尾辅音音变产生的同义词根loqu和locu。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　eulogize, monologue, prologue, grandiloquent, loquacious, obloquy, soliloquy, terminology, circumlocution<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>（尤指自言自语的）独白：</ins></strong>a dramatic or literary form of discourse in which a character talks to himself or herself or reveals his or her thoughts <strong><ins>without addressing a listener</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　a monotonous soliloquy　一段无聊的独白<br /><strong>近</strong>　monologue<br /><strong>反</strong>　chorus, ensemble　合唱<br />
solitude	L23 U08	[ˈsɑːlətuːd][sound:solitude.mp3]<br />			<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>孤独，避世：</ins></strong>the quality or state of <strong><ins>being alone</ins></strong> or remote from society<br /><strong>例</strong>　He sought the kind of solitude where his thoughts would be his only companions．他在寻找一种孤独感，只有他的思想陪伴着他。<br />　　She wished to work on her novel in solitude．她想一个人安静地完成小说。<br /><strong>近</strong>　aloneness, insulation, privacy, seclusion, segregation, separateness, sequestration, solitariness<br /><strong>反</strong>　camaraderie, companionship, company, comradeship, fellowship, society　陪伴<br />
solvent	L23 U08	[ˈsɑːlvənt][sound:solvent.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】solv[loosen]+-ent[a.＆n.], “loosen debts”, 解开（债务的束缚）→a.有偿付能力的；使另一种物质“松开”，分散开（溶质）→n.溶剂<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>solv, solut</strong>　词根solv和solut表示loosen[松开，解开]。solve[解决；溶解]（名词形式solution）字面含义“解开”[solv, solut], 指“解开（绳结、问题）”, 以及“解开（被束缚成一个整体的物质）”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　absolute, absolve, dissolute, dissolve, resolute, solvent<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>有偿付能力的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>able to pay</ins></strong> all legal <strong><ins>debts</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　They're going to have to prove that the company is now solvent．接下来他们必须要证明公司有偿贷能力。<br /><strong>反</strong>　bankrupt　破产的<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>溶剂：</ins></strong>a substance in which <strong><ins>another substance is dissolved</ins></strong>, forming a solution<br /><strong>例</strong>　Some organic solvents, such as benzene, pyridine, furan, are poisonous to human's reproductive system．一些有机溶剂（比如苯、吡啶、呋喃）对人体的生殖系统有毒性。<br /><strong>反</strong>　solute　溶质<br />

soporific	L23 U09	[ˌsɑːpəˈrɪfɪk][sound:soporific.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】sopor[sleep]+i+fic[make], make...sleep→n.催眠的药剂，安眠药 a.催眠的；慵懒的，困倦的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>fic</strong>　词根fic表示make[做，使], 和词根fac (t）同源。efficient[有效的，生效的]字面含义“make out”, 即“做出（效果）”。后缀-fy[使…]即变形自词根fic。例如intensify[加剧]表示“to make[-fy]intense”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　beneficent, deficiency, efficacious, gasification, magnificent, nullification, officious, proficient, soporific, specific<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>催眠的药剂，安眠药：</ins></strong>a drug or other substance that <strong><ins>induces sleep</ins></strong><br />a. <strong><ins>催眠的：</ins></strong>causing or tending to <strong><ins>cause sleep</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　Alcohol is a poor soporific because it disturbs sleep patterns, and so can worsen sleep disorders．酒精是一种欠佳的安眠药，因为它会干扰睡眠的固定模式，从而恶化睡眠紊乱的情况。<br /><strong>近</strong>　hypnotic; narcotic, opiate, slumberous, somniferous, somnolent<br /><strong>反</strong>　stimulant　兴奋剂；arousing, waking, invigorating, stimulating　刺激性的<br />

spectrum	L23 U10	[ˈspektrəm][sound:spectrum.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【记】spectrum[n.光谱；范围，系列]的字面含义是“所观测[spect]到的（所有颜色和颜色的分布）”。一束光通过棱镜等装置形成一条“可见[spect]的彩带”，上面由红到紫排列着一系列颜色，例如阳光被水滴色散后形成的彩虹。这种颜色上的分布被称为光谱。<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>spec (t), spic</strong>　词根spec (t)及其变形spic表示look[看]。如，introspect[内省]就是“向内[intro-]看[spect]（自己）”。expect[期待]的字面含义是“向外[ex-]看[(s) pect]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　aspect, auspicious, conspicuous, circumspect, despicable, despise, prospect, perspicacious, perspicuous, retrospective, specious, speculate, spectator, spectrum<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>光谱；范围，系列：</ins></strong>a broad <strong><ins>sequence or range</ins></strong> of related qualities, ideas, or activities<br /><strong>例</strong>　the whole spectrum of 20th-century thought　20世纪所有不同的思潮<br />　　A political spectrum is a way of modeling different political positions by placing them upon one or more geometric axes symbolizing independent political dimensions．所谓的政治光谱是一种将不同的政治立场可视化的模型，它通过一条或者多条几何坐标轴来定位不同的政治态度。<br /><strong>近</strong>　diapason, gamut, scale, spread, stretch<br />

tendentious	L25 U08	[tenˈdenʃəs][sound:tendentious.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】tend[stretch]+-ent+-(i) ous[a.], （见解向某个方向）伸展的→a.有偏见的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>tend, tens, tent</strong>　词根tend表示stretch[伸出，伸展]，例如extend[拓展]就是“向外[ex-]伸展[tend]”;tend作为单词有“趋向”的含义，即“（向某方向）伸展”。词根tend有两个常见的变体tens和tent。extension[拓展，伸展]是extend的名词形式；extent[程度]就是“向外伸展”的多少。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　tendentious, contend, contentious, distend, intensify, pretense, unpretentious, ostensible, ostentatious, portentous<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>有偏见的：</ins></strong>marked by a tendency in favor of a particular point of view: <strong><ins>biased</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　He made some extremely tendentious remarks．他的一些评论颇具偏向性。<br /><strong>近</strong>　partial, distorting, subjective, biased<br /><strong>反</strong>　unbiased, unprejudiced　公平的<br />

toady	L25 U10	[ˈtoʊdi][sound:toady.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【源】toady[n.马屁精v.拍马屁]来自“toadeater”[吃蛤蟆的人]的缩写形式。古时人们普遍认为蛤蟆有毒，所以江湖郎中兜售药品的常用伎俩是医治“吃蛤蟆中毒的人”。有些知道蛤蟆无毒的人（尤其是郎中的学徒）故意吃蛤蟆并装作中毒的样子让郎中去医治，以谄媚江湖郎中。所以toady有了“马屁精；拍马屁”的含义。<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n./v. <strong><ins>马屁精；拍马屁：</ins></strong>one who <strong><ins>flatters</ins></strong> in the hope of <strong><ins>gaining favors</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　He criticized that I was a toady.　他批评说我是一个马屁精。<br /><strong>近</strong>　sycophant, groveler, flatterer<br />

unexceptionable	L26 U06	[ˌʌnɪkˈsepʃənəbl][sound:unexceptionable.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】un-[not]+ex-[out]+cept[take]+-ion[n.]+-able[a.able], not able to take (mistakes) out→a.无懈可击的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cap, capt, cept, cip, cup</strong>　这些词根都表示seize[抓]或take[拿]，有着相同的词源。它们的拼写区别在于元音字母的不同，以及词根末尾的t。下面是由它们组成的一些单词：<br />　　　（1）capacity[容量]就是amount one could take[cap], 即一个容器能“拿”多少；<br />　　　（2）capture[捕获]相当于seize[capt]；<br />　　　（3）except[除…外]字面含义“take[cept]...out[ex-]”;accept[接受]是指“to[ac-=ad-]take[cept]”；<br />　　　（4）participate[参与]相当于“take[cip]part (in)”；<br />　　　（5）occupy[占用；占领]字面含义“to take[cup]over[oc-=ob-]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　captious, captivate, inception, exceptional, unexceptionable, perceptible, perceptive, susceptibility, disciple, emancipate, incipient, principal, preoccupation, recuperate<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>无懈可击的：</ins></strong>not open to objection or criticism, <strong><ins>beyond reproach</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　unexceptionable movie/book/argument　无懈可击的电影/书/论点<br /><strong>近</strong>　unassailable, undeniable, irrefutable, indisputable, unimpeachable<br /><strong>反</strong>　assailable, controversial　有争议的<br />

unpretentious	L26 U07	[ˌʌnprɪˈtenʃəs][sound:unpretentious.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】un-[not]+pre-[before]+tent[stretch]+-ious[a.], 不在别人面前伸展、展示→a.低调的，谦逊的；notpretend, 不做作的→a.坦诚的，自然的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>tend, tens, tent</strong>　词根tend表示stretch[伸出，伸展]，例如extend[拓展]就是“向外[ex-]伸展[tend]”;tend作为单词有“趋向”的含义，即“（向某方向）伸展”。词根tend有两个常见的变体tens和tent。extension[拓展，伸展]是extend的名词形式；extent[程度]就是“向外伸展”的多少。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　tendentious, contend, contentious, distend, intensify, pretense, unpretentious, ostensible, ostentatious, portentous<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>低调的，谦逊的：</ins></strong>lacking pretension or affectation; <strong><ins>modest</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　an unpretentious virtuoso　一位谦虚的大师<br /><strong>近</strong>　demure, down-to-earth, lowly, meek, unassuming, humble, modest, unostentatious<br /><strong>反</strong>　arrogant, bumptious, conceited, egotistic, fastuous, haughty, imperious, lordly, overweening, peremptory, pompous, presuming, presumptuous, self-asserting, supercilious, superior, toplofty, uppish, flamboyant, ostentatious　傲慢的，自负的<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>坦诚的，自然的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>free from</ins></strong> any intent to <strong><ins>deceive</ins></strong> or impress others<br /><strong>例</strong>　a simple and unpretentious account about growing up in the rural South　一段简单坦率的关于在南部乡村成长经历的叙述<br /><strong>近</strong>　artless, genuine, honest, ingenuous, innocent, naive, simple, sincere, true, unpretending<br /><strong>反</strong>　affected, artful, artificial, assuming, dissembling, dissimulating, fake, guileful, insincere, phony　做作的，虚伪的<br />

vindicate	L27 U03	[ˈvɪndɪkeɪt][sound:vindicate.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【联】v[对号]+indicate[表明]，indicate right→证明，证实；证明（一个人的清白）→vt.为…平反，为…辩护，使无罪<br />　　　【根】vin[来自vim, 表示精力]+dic[say]+-ate[v.], 有力地说→vt.证明，证实<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>dic, dict</strong>　词根dic(t)表示say[说]。常见词predict[预测]，字面义say[dict=say]before[pre-=before], 即预先说（结果）。同大部分与说相关的词根一样，这个词根也有“words”的含义，dictionary[字典]就是a collection of words。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　abdicate, addict, indict, interdict, valediction, vindicate, contradict, dictate<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>为…平反，为…辩护，使无罪：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>free from</ins></strong> allegation or <strong><ins>blame</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　The evidence would completely vindicate him.　这个证据将彻底证明他的清白。<br /><strong>近</strong>　absolve, acquit, exculpate, exonerate<br /><strong>反</strong>　incriminate　使有罪<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>证明，证实：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>give evidence</ins></strong> or testimony to the truth or factualness of<br /><strong>例</strong>　Recent discoveries have generally vindicated the physicist's theories．近期的发现整体上证明了物理学家的理论。<br /><strong>近</strong>　attest, authenticate, certify, corroborate, substantiate, support, validate, verify<br /><strong>反</strong>　disprove, rebut, refute　反驳，驳斥<br />

affectation	L28 U02	[ˌæfekˈteɪʃn][sound:affectation.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】af-[ad-, to]+fect[do]+-ation[n.], （刻意地）去做→n.虚伪，做作<br />　　　【注】注意与形近词affection[n.喜爱；感情]进行区分<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>fac (t), fect, feit</strong>　词根fac (t）以及同源词根fect, feit表示“做[do, make]”。例如factory[工厂]就是“做、制造[fact]（东西）的地方[-ory]”。effect指“做[fect]出[ef-=ex-]的结果”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　facilitate, faction, affectation, disaffected, disinfect, feckless, counterfeit, surfeit, forfeit<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>虚伪，做作：</ins></strong>the act of taking on or displaying an attitude or mode of behavior <strong><ins>not natural</ins></strong> to oneself or <strong><ins>not genuinely felt</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　His little affectations irritated her.　他做作的小动作激怒了她。<br /><strong>近</strong>　façade, guise, mannerism, pose, pretense, show<br /><strong>反</strong>　artlessness, genuineness, innocence, naivety　天真，淳朴<br />

agility	L28 U02	[əˈdʒɪləti][sound:agility.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ag[act]+-il (e)[easy]+i+-ty[n.], easyto act, （身体）方便行动→n.（身手）敏捷<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>ag, act</strong>　词根ag变形自act[做，行动]（g-ct相互替换）。agent[办事者，代理人]就是指“who[-ent]acts[ag]”。此外，词根ag还有“引导[drive, lead]”的含义。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　agility, agitate, coagulate, cogent, demagogue, pedagogue, agog, react, reactionary<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>（身手）敏捷：</ins></strong><strong><ins>quickness</ins></strong>, <strong><ins>ease and grace</ins></strong> in physical activity<br /><strong>例</strong>　His agility on the parallel bars has won him several medals．他在双杠上的矫捷身姿助他赢得了数枚奖牌。<br /><strong>近</strong>　deftness, dexterity, nimbleness, sleight, spryness<br /><strong>反</strong>　awkwardness, clumsiness, gaucheness, gawkiness, gracelessness, ungainliness（行动）笨拙<br />

captious	L28 U08	[ˈkæpʃəs][sound:captious.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】capt[seize]+ious[a.], seize (errors), （过分）抓毛病的→a.爱挑毛病的，吹毛求疵的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cap, capt, cept, cip, cup</strong>　这些词根都表示seize[抓]或take[拿]，有着相同的词源。它们的拼写区别在于元音字母的不同，以及词根末尾的t。下面是由它们组成的一些单词：<br />　　　（1）capacity[容量]就是amount one could take[cap], 即一个容器能“拿”多少；<br />　　　（2）capture[捕获]相当于seize[capt]；<br />　　　（3）except[除…外]字面含义“take[cept]...out[ex-]”;accept[接受]是指“to[ac-=ad-]take[cept]”；<br />　　　（4）participate[参与]相当于“take[cip]part (in)”；<br />　　　（5）occupy[占用；占领]字面含义“to take[cup]over[oc-=ob-]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　captious, captivate, inception, exceptional, unexceptionable, perceptible, perceptive, susceptibility, disciple, emancipate, incipient, principal, preoccupation, recuperate<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>吹毛求疵的，爱挑毛病的：</ins></strong>marked by an often ill-natured inclination to <strong><ins>stress faults and raise objections</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　a captious and cranky eater who has never met a vegetable he didn't hate　一个古怪又挑剔的食客，从来就没有他不讨厌的蔬菜<br /><strong>近</strong>　carping, caviling, critical, faultfinding, hypercritical, judgmental, overcritical<br /><strong>反</strong>　appreciative　表示欣赏的<br />

consent	L29 U01	[kənˈsent][sound:consent.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】con-[together]+sent[sense], sense together, 想法一致→vi.同意<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>sens, sent</strong>　词根sens和sent表示sense[感觉；观念]。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　commonsensical, consensus, dissension, insensible, insensitive, sensation, assent, consent, dissent, insentient, sentinel<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>同意，赞同：</ins></strong>the <strong><ins>approval</ins></strong> by someone in authority for the doing of something<br />vi. <strong><ins>同意：</ins></strong>to give assent or <strong><ins>approval</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　We had to get our neighbor's consent in order to trim the tree from his side．想要从邻居家那边修剪树木，我们得先得到他的同意。<br />　　consent to being tested in her neurobiology experiment　同意在她神经生物学的实验中作测试对象<br />　　refuse to consent to the marriage　拒绝这桩婚事<br /><strong>近</strong>　allowance, approval, authorization, clearance, concurrence, granting, license, sanction, warrant; acquiesce, agree, approve, assent, subscribe<br /><strong>反</strong>　interdiction, prohibition, proscription　禁止；dissent　反对；deny, veto　否决<br />
consign	L29 U01	[kənˈsaɪn][sound:consign.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】con-[together]+sign[签字]，共同签字（达成合同），从而把责任（或某物）转移给某人，即“转交，转移（给他人）”；后引申出把某人置于某种（往往是不好的）处境→把…置于<br />　　　【参】同源词assign[v.指派]（前缀as-=ad-加强语气, consign的前缀con-也可看成加强语气），词组“assign Ato B[将A分配给B]”在某些语境下与“consign Ato B[将A置于B]”含义类似<br />　　　【注】词组consign...to oblivion[将…（置于）遗忘]<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>sign</strong>　词根和单词sign表示“签字，标志[mark]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　consign, designate, resign, signal<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>转交，转移（给他人）：</ins></strong>to give, transfer, or deliver into the hands or <strong><ins>control of another</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　The record shows that the deliveryman had consigned our package to a next-door neighbor．记录显示邮递员把我们的包裹转投给隔壁邻居了。<br />　　a writer consigned to oblivion　湮没无闻的作家<br /><strong>近</strong>　commend, commit, confide, delegate, deliver, entrust, hand, recommend, repose, transfer, transmit, vest<br /><strong>反</strong>　hold, keep, retain　保留<br />
