contend	L29 U01	[kənˈtend][sound:contend.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】con-[together]+tend[stretch], stretch (out) together, 都伸出手（去拿）→vi.竞争，争夺；con-作为前缀加强语气，伸张（正义/认为正确的事）→vt.声明，声称<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>tend, tens, tent</strong>　词根tend表示stretch[伸出，伸展]，例如extend[拓展]就是“向外[ex-]伸展[tend]”;tend作为单词有“趋向”的含义，即“（向某方向）伸展”。词根tend有两个常见的变体tens和tent。extension[拓展，伸展]是extend的名词形式；extent[程度]就是“向外伸展”的多少。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　tendentious, contend, contentious, distend, intensify, pretense, unpretentious, ostensible, ostentatious, portentous<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vi. <strong><ins>竞争，争夺：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>strive or vie in contest</ins></strong> or rivalry or against difficulties<br /><strong>例</strong>　two traditional rivals contending for the championship　两个争夺冠军头衔的老对手<br /><strong>近</strong>　battle, fight, race, rival, vie<br /><strong>反</strong>　capitulate, quit, succumb, surrender, give in　投降<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>声明，声称：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>state as a fact</ins></strong> usually forcefully<br /><strong>例</strong>　I would contend that the minister's thinking is flawed on this point．我声明部长的想法在这一点上有漏洞。<br /><strong>近</strong>　affirm, allege, assert, aver, avouch, avow, declare, insist, maintain, profess, protest, purport, warrant<br /><strong>反</strong>　deny, gainsay　否认<br />

damn	L29 U03	[dæm][sound:damn.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【参】damage[破坏]，指上帝会对恶行者进行破坏、毁灭→vt.（在道德上）谴责<br />　　　【注】damn在美国的口语中经常出现。俚语“Goddamn it.”是一句骂人的话，字面含义“上帝（应该）谴责、消灭[damn=damage]它”，相当于汉语“该死的”。类似于“天气该死的热”形容天气很热，damn作副词表示“非常地，极其地”。<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>（在道德上）谴责：</ins></strong>to declare to be <strong><ins>morally wrong or evil</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　a cleric who damned gambling and strong drink　一位严厉谴责赌博和酗酒的牧师<br /><strong>近</strong>　anathematize, censure, decry, denounce, execrate, reprehend, reprobate<br /><strong>反</strong>　bless, eulogize, exalt, extol, glorify, laud, praise　赞颂<br />

dependable	L29 U04	[dɪˈpendəbl][sound:dependable.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【记】depend[依赖，依靠]+-able[a.], able to depend→a.可靠的，值得信赖的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>pend, pens</strong>　词根pend（其他形式pens）表示hang[挂，悬挂]。depend[v.依赖，依靠]字面含义“挂在[pend]下面[de-]”，引申出“挂靠、附属于（某机构）”的含义；independent表示“不[in-]挂在[pend]任何事物下面[de-]的[-ent]”，独立的。pending[紧迫的，即将发生的]来自词根pend的引申义，表示“（某事件）处于悬挂状态”，即还没有发生，但（随时）可能“掉下来，发生”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　compendium, dependable, indispensable, impending, propensity, suspend, pensive<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>可靠的，值得信赖的：</ins></strong>capable of being <strong><ins>depended on</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　a dependable source of income　可靠的收入来源<br />　　He was a good friend and a dependable companion．他是一个好朋友，一个值得信赖的好伙伴。<br /><strong>近</strong>　calculable, reliable, responsible, safe, secure, solid, trustable, trustworthy<br /><strong>反</strong>　undependable, unreliable, unsafe, untrustworthy　不值得信赖的<br />

disenchant	L29 U04	[ˌdɪsɪnˈtʃænt][sound:disenchant.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】dis-[not, opposite of]+en-[in，使]+chant[sing], 使不进入咒语或被吸引的状态→vt.使清醒<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cant</strong>　词根cant表示sing[唱]。单词chant[v.唱 n.颂歌]是词根cant的变形；读音联想“唱它”。此外，词根cant由“唱”引申出以下两层含义：<br />　　　（1）“带腔调地说”。例如accent[n.口音；重音]，其中词根cant的元音a变为e。<br />　　　（2）“吸引人的咒语”。（传说海上有一个巫女，当看到有过往的船只时就会唱出令人陶醉的歌声（即咒语）令船员忘却一切，最终导致船永远停止航行。）<br /><strong>同根</strong>　incantation, recant, disenchant, incentive<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>使清醒：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>free from illusion</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　disenchant voters　使选民清醒<br /><strong>近</strong>　disabuse, undeceive<br /><strong>反</strong>　beguile, cozen, delude, dupe, fool, gull, hoax, hoodwink, misguide, misinform, mislead　诱骗<br />

disprove	L29 U05	[ˌdɪsˈpruːv][sound:disprove.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】dis-[opposite of]+prov[prove]+-e[v.], opposite of“prove”, prove to befalse→vt.证明为假，反驳<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>prob, prov</strong>　词根prob，prov（字母b和v的替换，参考mobile和move）表示“test[检验]，prove[证明]”以及引申含义“通过了检验”，即“证明（或认为）…为好，正确[right]”。probable[a.很可能的；可信的]字面含义“（对于不完全确定的事物）可[-able]证明正确[prob]的”。approve[v.赞成；批准]来自词根prov“认为…正确”的含义。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　approbation, disprove, probe, probity, reprobate, reprove, proofread<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>反驳，证明为假：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>prove to be false</ins></strong> or wrong<br /><strong>例</strong>　Magellan's circumnavigation of the globe disproved any lingering notions that the earth is flat．麦哲伦的环球旅行彻底反驳了任何残存的“地球是平的”的观念。<br /><strong>近</strong>　belie, confound, confute, debunk, disconfirm, discredit, falsify, rebut, refute, shoot down<br /><strong>反</strong>　confirm, establish, prove, validate, verify　证实，证明为真<br />
distinctive	L29 U05	[dɪˈstɪŋktɪv][sound:distinctive.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】di (s)-[apart]+stinct[stick]+-ive[a.], 可以（用针刺从而）分离的→a.完全不同的；特征性的，典型的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>sti, sti (n) g</strong>　单词stick[刺；坚持]也有“钉”的含义（钉需要刺过物体，被钉的物体不容易变化位置）。很多由sti开头的单词（或词根）从词源（或可以联想成）与“钉、刺”有关。例如：sting[刺，刺痛；叮咬；讽刺]，以及与sting同源的词根stig, stinct。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　distinctive, extinguish, instigate, prestige, stickler, stiff, stifle, stigma, stingy, stipple, stipulate, stitch<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>完全不同的：</ins></strong>being <strong><ins>not of the same kind</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　She seems to alternate between two distinctive hairstyles．她的发型似乎在两种截然不同的样式中变换。<br /><strong>近</strong>　disparate, dissimilar, distant, distinct, distinguishable, diverse, unalike, unlike<br /><strong>反</strong>　identical, indistinguishable, same　相同的；alike, analogous, kindred, like, parallel, similar　相似的<br /><strong>派</strong>　distinction n．区别，差别<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>特征性的，典型的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>serving to identify</ins></strong> as belonging to an individual or group<br /><strong>例</strong>　Jerusalem has a distinctive Middle East flavor．耶路撒冷有着典型的中东风情。<br /><strong>近</strong>　characteristic, classic, diagnostic, discriminating, distinguishing, identifying, peculiar, symptomatic, typical<br /><strong>反</strong>　atypical, uncharacteristic, untypical　非典型的<br />
doctrinaire	L29 U05	[ˌdɑːktrəˈner][sound:doctrinaire.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】doctrin[doctrine，教条，信条]+-aire[a.], （死守） 教条的→a.教条主义的，照本宣科的<br />　　　【注】后缀-aire还表示“具有某特点的人”，例如millionaire[n.百万富翁]就是“拥有一百万金钱的人”;doctrinaire还有名词含义“死信教条的人”，即“教条主义者”。<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>doc (t), dox</strong>　（1）词根doc (t)表示teach[教]。例如，doctor[博士]可看做“受过最高等教育[doct]的人[-or]”；document[文件]最初指“sth.[-ment]thatteaches[doc](the reader)”；doctrine[教条]也来自词根doct, 可以看成“doct[教]line[条]”。<br />　　　（2）词根dox表示opinion[思想]，与词根doc有一定联系，“教育”传递和塑造“思想”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　doctrinaire, indoctrinate, heterodox, orthodox, paradox<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>教条主义的，照本宣科的：</ins></strong>given to or marked by the forceful expression of <strong><ins>strongly held opinions</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　A doctrinaire conservative, the columnist takes special delight in baiting liberals．这个专栏作家是个谨遵教条的顽固保守主义者，他很享受挑衅那些自由主义者的感觉。<br /><strong>近</strong>　dogmatic<br /><strong>反</strong>　latitudinarian（宗教方面）能容纳不同意见的<br />

eclectic	L29 U06	[ɪˈklektɪk][sound:eclectic.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】ec-[ex-, out]+lect[choose]+-ic[a.], choose out (from different sources)→a.混合的，多元化的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>lect</strong>　词根lect表示“choose[选择]”。select[v.挑选]就是“选[lect]出[se-]”；election[n.选举]字面含义“choose[lect]...out[e-=ex-]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　eclectic, predilection, intelligible<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>混合的，多元化的：</ins></strong>composed of elements drawn <strong><ins>from various sources</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　The museum's eclectic collection has everything from a giraffe skeleton to medieval musical instruments．博物馆里的展品丰富多样，从长颈鹿的骨架到中世纪的乐器都有。<br /><strong>近</strong>　assorted, diverse, heterogeneous, indiscriminate, magpie, mixed, motley, piebald, ragtag, varied<br /><strong>反</strong>　homogeneous, uniform　同一性的<br />
efficacious	L29 U06	[ˌefɪˈkeɪʃəs][sound:efficacious.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【记】effic[effect]+-acious[a.多的], full of (desired) effects→a.有效的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>fic</strong>　词根fic表示make[做，使], 和词根fac (t）同源。efficient[有效的，生效的]字面含义“make out”, 即“做出（效果）”。后缀-fy[使…]即变形自词根fic。例如intensify[加剧]表示“to make[-fy]intense”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　beneficent, deficiency, efficacious, gasification, magnificent, nullification, officious, proficient, soporific, specific<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>有效的：</ins></strong>having the power to <strong><ins>produce a desired effect</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　efficacious new drug　有效的新药<br /><strong>近</strong>　effective, effectual, efficient, fruitful, operative, potent, productive<br /><strong>反</strong>　bootless, fruitless, ineffective, ineffectual, inefficient, inoperative, unproductive, useless　无效的<br />

equilibrium	L29 U06	[ˌiːkwɪˈlɪbriəm][sound:equilibrium.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】equ (i)[equal]+libr[秤, Libra天秤座]+-ium[n.], 相等的状态→n.均势，平衡；（情绪）稳定不变，平静→n.（感情上的）平静<br />　　　【注】词根libr表示“秤”，equilibrium指“秤的两端重量相等的状态”。deliberate[深思熟虑的]是指经过了“秤[lib (e) r]”去权衡、掂量，其中前缀de-加强语气。类似的含义还有measured[深思熟虑的，谨慎的]，calculated[经过计算（成败得失）的，经过深思熟虑的]。<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>equ</strong>　词根equ表示equal[相等的]。equator[赤道]将地球分成了“相等的”两半。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　egalitarian, equable, equilibrium, equity, iniquity<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>均势，平衡：</ins></strong>a condition in which <strong><ins>opposing forces are equal</ins></strong> to one another<br /><strong>例</strong>　find an equilibrium between A and B　在A和B之间找到一个平衡点<br /><strong>近</strong>　counterpoise, equilibration, equipoise, poise, stasis<br /><strong>反</strong>　disequilibration, disequilibrium, imbalance, nonequilibrium, unbalance　不平衡<br />

incentive	L30 U01	[ɪnˈsentɪv][sound:incentive.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】in-[in]+cent[cant, sing]+-ive[n.], 通过唱歌吸引→n.刺激，诱因<br />　　　【注】另一种解释，cent来自词根cand[点燃]，candle[蜡烛]就是“可以点燃的小东西”。进入点燃的状态→刺激，诱因<br />　　　【联】in-[in]+cent[美分，指钱]+-ive[n.], moneyinside→刺激，诱因<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cant</strong>　词根cant表示sing[唱]。单词chant[v.唱 n.颂歌]是词根cant的变形；读音联想“唱它”。此外，词根cant由“唱”引申出以下两层含义：<br />　　　（1）“带腔调地说”。例如accent[n.口音；重音]，其中词根cant的元音a变为e。<br />　　　（2）“吸引人的咒语”。（传说海上有一个巫女，当看到有过往的船只时就会唱出令人陶醉的歌声（即咒语）令船员忘却一切，最终导致船永远停止航行。）<br /><strong>同根</strong>　incantation, recant, disenchant, incentive<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>刺激，诱因：</ins></strong>something that <strong><ins>incites</ins></strong> or has a tendency to incite to determination or action<br /><strong>例</strong>　A little bonus will give employees an incentive to work harder.　一点点奖金就可以刺激雇员更加努力地工作。<br /><strong>近</strong>　boost, goad, impetus, incitement, instigation, momentum, motivation, motive, provocation, spur, stimulant, stimulus, yeast<br /><strong>反</strong>　deterrent, disincentive　抑制剂，阻碍物<br />
incumbent	L30 U01	[ɪnˈkʌmbənt][sound:incumbent.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】in-[on]+cumb[lie]+-ent[a.], lie on (duty), 位于（职务）的→a.义不容辞的，必须的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cu (m) b</strong>　（1）词根cu (m) b表示lie[躺；位于]。cubicle[小卧室]中的词根cub指“躺下睡觉”，-cle是表示“小”的名词后缀。（另一方面，cubicle可以看做“小[-（c) le]立方体[cube, 形容词形式cubic]”, 从轮廓上描述了“小卧室”。）<br />　　　（2）cumber[n.＆v.阻碍]可以理解成“躺[cumb]（在路上）（的东西[-er]）”, 像绊脚石那样阻碍前进。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　incubate, incumbent, recumbent, succumb, cumbersome, encumber<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>义不容辞的，必须的：</ins></strong>imposed as an <strong><ins>obligation</ins></strong> or <strong><ins>duty</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　It is incumbent upon sb. to do sth．做……事是……应尽的义务<br /><strong>近</strong>　compulsory, forced, imperative, involuntary, necessary, obligatory, peremptory, required<br /><strong>反</strong>　elective, optional, voluntary　可选择的<br />

menial	L30 U03	[ˈmiːniəl][sound:menial.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】men[min, small]+-ial[a.＆n.], 渺小的，卑微的→a.卑贱的，低下的；卑微的人→n.仆人，奴仆<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>min</strong>　词根min有“small[小]”和“jut[突出]”两层含义，合起来可以看做“突出的小尖”。<br />　　　（1）词根min的一个常见含义表示“小”，例如“迷你”就来源于mini的音译；minister[大臣]原指（相对于国王来讲的）“小[min (i）]人[-ster]、手下”；<br />　　　（2）词根min的另外一个含义是“突出”，这层含义与（1）的联系是“突出的尖端”很小。mountain[山]（看做与词根min元音替换）相对于地球来讲，就是“突出的（小尖）”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　diminish, eminent, menace, menial, minatory, mince, minimize, miniscule, minute, preeminent<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>卑贱的，低下的：</ins></strong>showing, expressing, or offered in a <strong><ins>spirit of humility or unseemly submissiveness</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　low-paid menial jobs such as cleaning the street　一些低收入的卑贱工作，比如扫大街<br /><strong>近</strong>　base, humble, lowly, servile, slavish, subservient<br /><strong>反</strong>　arrogant, haughty, imperious, lordly, supercilious, superior　自大的，狂妄的<br />

perceptive	L30 U06	[pərˈseptɪv][sound:perceptive.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】per-[thoroughly]+cept[take]+-ive[a.], (of sb.) takethoroughly→a.敏锐的；洞察力强的<br />　　　【派】perception[n.洞察力；知觉]<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cap, capt, cept, cip, cup</strong>　这些词根都表示seize[抓]或take[拿]，有着相同的词源。它们的拼写区别在于元音字母的不同，以及词根末尾的t。下面是由它们组成的一些单词：<br />　　　（1）capacity[容量]就是amount one could take[cap], 即一个容器能“拿”多少；<br />　　　（2）capture[捕获]相当于seize[capt]；<br />　　　（3）except[除…外]字面含义“take[cept]...out[ex-]”;accept[接受]是指“to[ac-=ad-]take[cept]”；<br />　　　（4）participate[参与]相当于“take[cip]part (in)”；<br />　　　（5）occupy[占用；占领]字面含义“to take[cup]over[oc-=ob-]”。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　captious, captivate, inception, exceptional, unexceptionable, perceptible, perceptive, susceptibility, disciple, emancipate, incipient, principal, preoccupation, recuperate<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>敏锐的：</ins></strong>able to <strong><ins>sense slight</ins></strong> impressions or <strong><ins>differences</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　perceptive U.S. political commentator　有洞察力的政治评论员<br /><strong>近</strong>　delicate, fine, keen, quick, sensitive, sharp<br /><strong>反</strong>　dead, imperceptive, insensible, insensitive, numb　反应慢的，麻木的<br />

prerequisite	L30 U08	[ˌpriːˈrekwəzɪt][sound:prerequisite.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【记】pre-[before]+requis[require]+-ite[n.], （做某事）之前需要（的条件）→n.前提，先决条件<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>quir, quis</strong>　词根quir, quis表示ask, seek[要求；寻求；询问]。例如require指“v.要求，需要”（前缀“re-”加强语气）。query[n.＆v.疑问，询问]也来自词根quir。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　acquire, exquisite, inquisitive, perquisite, requisite, prerequisite<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>先决条件，前提：</ins></strong>something that is <strong><ins>necessary to an end</ins></strong> or to the carrying out of a function<br /><strong>例</strong>　Competence is prerequisite to promotion．能力是提升的必要条件。<br /><strong>近</strong>　condition, essential, must, necessity, precondition, requirement, requisite, sine qua non<br />
prerogative	L30 U08	[prɪˈrɑːɡətɪv][sound:prerogative.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】pre-[before]+rog[ask]+-ative[n.], （可以比其他人）预先提出要求→n.特权，权力<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>rog</strong>　词根rog的含义相当于ask[命令，要求，问]，可以通过与词根log的拼写相似性进行记忆。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　abrogate, arrogance, interrogate, prerogative, surrogate<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>特权，权力：</ins></strong>an exclusive or special <strong><ins>right</ins></strong>, <strong><ins>power</ins></strong>, or <strong><ins>privilege</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　It is your prerogative to refuse to attend religious services．你有权力不参加宗教活动。<br /><strong>近</strong>　appanage, birthright, entitlement, privilege, right<br />
proclaim	L30 U08	[prəˈkleɪm][sound:proclaim.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】pro-[forth]+claim[shout], 向前喊叫→vt.宣告，使…公之于众<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>claim</strong>　词根claim表示shout[喊叫]，“大声地说”。claim作为单词最常见的含义是“声称”，exclaim[呼喊]就是shout[claim]out[ex-]。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　claim, clamor, acclaim, proclaim, disclaim, declaim, reclaim<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vt. <strong><ins>宣告，使…公之于众：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>declare publicly</ins></strong>, typically insistently, proudly, or defiantly and in either speech or writing<br /><strong>例</strong>　He launched a coup and proclaimed himself President．他发动了一场政变，然后宣称自己已成为总统。<br /><strong>近</strong>　advertise, announce, blare, blazon, broadcast, declare, enunciate, herald, promulgate, publicize, publish, release, trumpet<br /><strong>反</strong>　conceal, hide　隐藏；silence, suppress　压制（观点的发表）<br />

sectarianism	L30 U10	[sekˈteriənɪzəm]<br />			<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>宗派主义，顽固：</ins></strong>stubborn or intolerant <strong><ins>adherence to</ins></strong> one's opinions or <strong><ins>prejudices</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　An ideological sectarianism prevented the political party from ever being anything more than a fringe group．意识形态上的顽固和保守使得这个政党只能成为一个边缘团体。<br /><strong>近</strong>　dogmatism, illiberalism, intolerance, narrow-mindedness, partisanship, small-mindedness<br /><strong>反</strong>　broad-mindedness, liberalism, open-mindedness, tolerance　开明<br />
secular	L31 U01	[ˈsekjələr][sound:secular.mp3]<br />			<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>世俗的，尘世的：</ins></strong>of or relating to the <strong><ins>worldly or temporal</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　That's an issue for the secular authorities, not the church．这个问题和宗教无关，是一件世俗事务。<br /><strong>近</strong>　carnal, earthborn, earthbound, fleshly, material, mundane, sublunary, temporal, terrene, terrestrial, worldly<br /><strong>反</strong>　heavenly, unearthly, unworldly　非尘世间的；spiritual　精神上的；religious　宗教的；clerical　牧师的<br />
simile	L31 U01	[ˈsɪməli][sound:simile.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】sim[like]+ile[n.], 像，比作→n.明喻<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>sim</strong>　词根sim表示like[像]，与same[相同]同源。similar[相似的]来自词根sim。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　simile, simulate<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />n. <strong><ins>明喻：</ins></strong>a figure of speech <strong><ins>comparing two unlike things</ins></strong> that is often introduced by like or as<br /><strong>例</strong>　Even though both similes and metaphors are forms of comparison, similes indirectly compare the two ideas and allow them to remain distinct in spite of their similarities, whereas metaphors compare two things directly. For instance, a simile that compares a person with a bullet would go as follows：“Chris was a record-setting runner as fast as a speeding bullet.”A metaphor might read something like, “When Chris ran, he was a speeding bullet racing along the track.”尽管明喻和暗喻都是比喻的手法，明喻会间接地对两个对象进行比较，同时允许差异的存在，而暗喻则直接对两者进行比较。比如说，用明喻来把一个人比作子弹会这样说：“克里斯是一个不断打破纪录的选手，他跑得就和高速子弹一样快。”而暗喻可能会说：“当克里斯奔跑的时候，他就是一颗在赛场上高速飞行的子弹。”<br /><strong>反</strong>　metaphor　暗喻<br />

succumb	L31 U02	[səˈkʌm][sound:succumb.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【根】suc-[sub-, down]+cumb[lie], liedown (tosuperior strength)→vi.屈服；lie down (forever）→vi.死亡<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cu (m) b</strong>　（1）词根cu (m) b表示lie[躺；位于]。cubicle[小卧室]中的词根cub指“躺下睡觉”，-cle是表示“小”的名词后缀。（另一方面，cubicle可以看做“小[-（c) le]立方体[cube, 形容词形式cubic]”, 从轮廓上描述了“小卧室”。）<br />　　　（2）cumber[n.＆v.阻碍]可以理解成“躺[cumb]（在路上）（的东西[-er]）”, 像绊脚石那样阻碍前进。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　incubate, incumbent, recumbent, succumb, cumbersome, encumber<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />vi. <strong><ins>屈服：</ins></strong>to <strong><ins>yield to superior strength</ins></strong> or force or overpowering appeal or desire<br /><strong>例</strong>　She refused to succumb to her fears and defiantly walked through the dark cemetery．她拒绝向自己的恐惧屈服，而是倔强地走过了幽暗的墓地。<br /><strong>近</strong>　bow, capitulate, concede, submit, surrender, give in<br /><strong>反</strong>　resist　抵抗<br /><hr />【<strong>考法 2</strong>】<br />vi. <strong><ins>死亡：</ins></strong>to be brought to an end (as <strong><ins>death</ins></strong>) by the effect of destructive or disruptive forces<br /><strong>例</strong>　The patient lay so still and pale that everyone thought he had succumbed, and then he opened his eyes．面色惨白的病人静静地躺在床上，正当所有人都以为他已经过世时，他突然睁开了眼睛。<br />　　The doctor worked tirelessly until finally he, too, succumbed to the plague．医生不知劳累地工作，直至最后，他也死于瘟疫。<br /><strong>近</strong>　decease, demise, expire, perish, pass away<br /><strong>反</strong>　endure, stand　忍受住；breathe, live, survive　存活<br />

unavailing	L31 U04	[ˌʌnəˈveɪlɪŋ][sound:unavailing.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【记】un-[not]+avail[n.效用]+-ing[a.], 没有效用的→a.徒劳的，无果的<br />　　　【注】avail表示“n.效用；利益”，字面含义“to[a-=ad-]be worth[vail=val]，有价值的”（类似value）。available指“有效用的，可利用的；空闲的（因此可用）”。<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>val</strong>　词根val表示“strong[强壮]；worth[有价值，有效用]”。valediction[告别演说]就是say“be well, strong”[一切安好，身体健康]。value[价值]也来自这个词根。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　ambivalent, convalesce, equivalent, prevail, unavailing, valiant, valid<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>徒劳的，无果的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>producing no results</ins></strong><br /><strong>例</strong>　an unavailing effort to avert a war　试图避免战争的徒劳尝试<br /><strong>近</strong>　abortive, barren, bootless, fruitless, ineffectual, unproductive, unprofitable, unsuccessful, useless, vain<br /><strong>反</strong>　effective, effectual, efficacious, fruitful, potent, productive　有效的；successful　成功的<br />

wrongheaded	L31 U05	[ˌrɔːŋˈhedɪd][sound:wrongheaded.mp3]<br />		<hr /><strong>构词</strong>　【联】head wrong, （一直）朝向（错误）→a.固执己见的，坚持（错误观点）的<br /><strong>词根</strong>　<strong>cap, cip</strong>　词根cap表示head[头，首]。capital[首都，首字母]就来自词根cap。另外，词根cap有一个变形形式cip。<br /><strong>同根</strong>　madcap, precipitate, precipitous, precipice, headlong, levelheaded, wrongheaded<br />	<hr />【<strong>考法 1</strong>】<br />a. <strong><ins>固执己见的，坚持（错误观点）的：</ins></strong><strong><ins>stubborn in adherence</ins></strong> to wrong opinion or principles<br /><strong>例</strong>　In spite of other's objections, he is always wrongheaded in his opinions．他总是不管他人的反对而固执地坚持自己哪怕是错误的观点。<br /><strong>近</strong>　adamant, headstrong, immovable, implacable, inconvincible, inflexible, intransigent, mulish, obdurate, pertinacious, perverse, stubborn, unyielding, willful<br /><strong>反</strong>　acquiescent, agreeable, amenable, compliant, flexible, pliable, pliant, relenting, yielding　易受影响的<br />
